text: Graham on Fox on Trump: I would urge him to open up the gov’t for a short period of time, like three weeks, before he pulls the plug. See if we can get a deal. If we can’t at the end of three weeks, all bets are off. See if he can do it by himself through the emergency powers
author: ChadPergram

text: Graham on Fox: Every Democrat that I’ve worked with for about 10 years now has agreed to funding for barriers/walls on Obama’s watch, on Bush’s watch and all of a sudden it’s a bad thing on Trump’s watch...What’s he supposed do? Just give in? He’s not going to give in
author: ChadPergram

text: Schumer to force vote on a resolution to disapprove of the U.S. Treasury Department’s decision in December to relax sanctions for three Russian companies connected to Russian oligarch Oleg Deripaska
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump on Fox on Biden: “He’s weak.”
author: ChadPergram

text: Manchin: It’s time for Congress to stop cowering to the executive branch and stop taking West Virginia livelihoods hostage. This government shutdown is a manufactured political stunt that is hurting West Virginia, our economy and our national discourse.
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump on Fox: I have the right to call a national emergencies. Many have called for things of lesser importance than this. I'd rather see the Democrats come back from their vacation..if they don't come to their senses I'll do a national emergency.
author: ChadPergram

text: Manchin: Now that the President has taken the national emergency declaration off of the table, it’s time for Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell to bring up the House passed appropriations bills that would finally reopen government.
author: ChadPergram

text: Schiff: I can say that counterintelligence concerns about those associated w/the Trump campaign, including the President himself, have been at the heart of our & the President’s own statements and actions, have only heightened our need to follow the evidence wherever it may lead
author: ChadPergram

text: Congressional Black Caucus on GOP ldrs & GOP IA Rep King: They must actually condemn Mr. King by removing him from his committee assignments so that he can no longer affect policies that impact the very people he has made it clear he disdains.
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump tweet: We have a massive Humanitarian Crisis at our Southern Border. We will be out for a long time unless the Democrats come back from their “vacations” and get back to work. I am in the White House ready to sign!
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump tweet: I do have a plan on the Shutdown. But to understand that plan you would have to understand the fact that I won the election, & I promised safety and security for the American people. Part of that promise was a Wall at the Southern Border. Elections have consequences!
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump tweet: Democrats could solve the Shutdown in 15 minutes! Call your Dem Senator or Congresswoman/man. Tell them to get it done! Humanitarian Crisis.
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump tweet: Democrats should come back to Washington and work to end the Shutdown, while at the same time ending the horrible humanitarian crisis at our Southern Border. I am in the White House waiting for you!
author: ChadPergram

text: Government shutdown is now officially the longest in history. 22 days. Eclipses the mark set in '95-'96
author: ChadPergram

text: Up against the wall. No end to the government shutdown
author: ChadPergram

text: The government shutdown is about to enter day 22
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi to Hse Dems: Trump is threatening to grant himself extraordinary powers to steal billions of dollars from disaster-impacted communities..Leadership and our Committees are working together to develop legal, policy, and communications responses should they be needed.
author: ChadPergram

text: A look at the latest on the government shutdown
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi alongside other lawmakers enrolls bill to ensure that federal lawmakers get paid once shutdown ends. Passed by Senate yesterday. House synced up today. Now goes to Trump to sign
author: ChadPergram

text: Jordan to Cummings: In contrast with your statement expressing, 'no interest in inappropriately interfering with any ongoing criminal investigations,' one of your first moves as Chairman was to announce a hearing to bring in Michael Cohen
author: ChadPergram

text: GOP IA Rep Steve King  said he made a “freshman mistake" when speaking about white supremacism & nationalism. King: I want to make one thing abundantly clear. I reject those labels and the evil ideology that they define..I condemn anyone that supports this evil & bigoted ideology
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi on if GOP IA Rep Steve King is fit to serve: "We'll be acting on that..he said terrible things. Terrible things have been said by this administration as well."
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi says the House has taken "many paths alleviating and opening the government" by passing various spending bills. On Trump, says "I'm the mother of five, grandmother of nine. I know a temper tantrum when I see one. Its unfortunate and services are being withheld."
author: ChadPergram

text:
Graham: I look forward to meeting with President Erdogan in the near future to discuss common interests and security concerns regarding northeastern Syria.  

“
author: ChadPergram

text: GOP TX Sen Cornyn indicates he opposes efforts to reprogram/transfer money money designated to help recover from Hurricane Harvey to help build a border wall
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse Intel Cmte Chair Schiff to Trump Admin: Should President Trump declare any type of national emergency prior to that date (January 16), I expect a briefing immediately upon such declaration.
author: ChadPergram

text: In letter to admin, Hse Intel Cmte Chair Schiff requests assessment by intelligence community on threats to national security posed by legal or illegal migrants on the southern border by January 16.
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse Intel Cmte Chair Schiff letter to admin on wall proposal: I have not seen recent or updated information from the..Intelligence Community (IC) to substantiate the Admin’s dire proclamations about the magnitude..of this claimed crisis – particularly with respect to terrorism
author: ChadPergram

text: Murkowski says if Trump declares a national emergency for border wall, the next president may try to do something on climate change and say 'I don't care if I have the support of Congress. I'm going to direct these funds to address..& I don't care whether Congress supports me'
author: ChadPergram

text: From colleague Ben Florance. Murkowski on declaring a nat'l emergency for wall: I disagree..he may have the legal authority to do that..The real concern that I have is the precedent that this then sets
author: ChadPergram

text: Graham: They hate President Trump more than they want to fix problems — even problems they acknowledged to be real and serious in the past.  Democrats will do everything in their power to defeat Trump in 2020. Mr. President, declare a national emergency now.  Build a wall now.
author: ChadPergram

text: Graham: I just met with President Trump and his team. It’s clear to both of us that Democrats don’t want to make a deal and will never support border wall/barriers on President Trump’s watch, even though they did so in the past.
author: ChadPergram

text: Senate is out. House done with business. Longest government shutdown set in stone
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem MD Sen Van Hollen on suggestions made to gov't employees to make ends make during the shutdown: "'Have a garage sale. Clean out attic's and basement. Clean out unwanted items'..I want to see the president of the united states hold a garage sale."
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem MD Sen Van Hollen on the shutdown: When the president says it's pretty clear he can relate to what's happening, it's pretty clear he can't
author: ChadPergram

text: Hoyer to Scalise during the flr colloquy on the 2013 government shutdown over Obamacare: When we voted to open it up, the Minority Whip didn’t vote to open it up. Maybe he doesn’t care about paying people
author: ChadPergram

text:
Hoyer to Scalise during the colloquy on the flr on the shutdown: 
If the Minority Whip think it’s good border security to not pay those protecting the border is good policy, we differ
author: ChadPergram

text:
GOP OK Rep Tom Cole on the new House Democratic majority:
This is so much like our majority that showed up in 2011 and they had been elected to the House of Commons
author: ChadPergram

text:
Sr Hse Apps Cmte mbr Tom Cole of OK on if the administration dips into the Military Construction fund to pay for the wall. He is skeptical, as an appropriator:
I want to see their justification
author: ChadPergram

text:
Rep. Tom Cole (R-OK). Cole on if the President should declare an emergency to get the wall:
I would prefer he not. But I don’t hold him responsible for being in this situation

Cole says the President isn’t to blame:
I know who’s willing to negotiate and who’s willing to not
author: ChadPergram

text: 10 GOPers voted to re-open Dept of Inteior: Reps. Rodney Davis (R-IL), Brian Fitzpatrick (R-PA), Jaime Herrera Beutler (R-WA), Will Hurd (R-TX), John Katko (R-NY), Adam Kinzinger (R-IL), Chris Smith (R-NJ), Elise Sefanik (R-NY), Fred Upton (R-MI) and Greg Walden (R-OR).
author: ChadPergram

text: The weekly colloquy on the House floor is under way between House Majority Leader Steny Hoyer (D-MD) and House Minority Whip Steve Scalise (R-LA). Pretty good debate back and forth right now about the shutdown. This is Scalise’s first time doing this in his new position
author: ChadPergram

text:
The House has approved Interior appropriations bill in effort to re-open that section of government.
 The vote was 240 to 179
 All Dems voted yea
 
10 GOPers voted nay.
 
12 GOPers voted yes yesterday on the Transportation/Housing spending bill. That’s the high-water mark so far
author: ChadPergram

text: House now voting on Interior appropriations bill in effort to re-open that section of government.
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump tweet: Humanitarian Crisis at our Southern Border. I just got back and it is a far worse situation than almost anyone would understand, an invasion! I have been there numerous times - The Democrats, Cryin’ Chuck and Nancy don’t know how bad and dangerous it is...
author: ChadPergram

text:
Pelosi on the possibility of a national emergency to build a wall:
“There are thoughts and they are thoughts of Constitutional scholars.” Says they want to find the best way to secure our borders.
author: ChadPergram

text: GOP SC Sen Graham was in the game to try to get a deal for the border wall..until he was dealt out
author: ChadPergram

text:
Rep. Jared Huffman (D-CA) during flr debate on Interior Appropriations bill: 
We may now have enough trash building up in our National Parks to build a wall

Huffman:
This government does not belong to Donald Trump. It belongs to the American people
author: ChadPergram

text:
House now debating Interior Appropriations bill to re-open that section of the government. Is the fourth of seven outstanding spending bills

Appropriations Subcommittee Chairwoman Betty McCollum (D-MN) calls on all National Parks to be closed until the shutdown is resolved.
author: ChadPergram

text: Senate in session today but no action expected on gov’t shutdown as we hit day 21, tying the record for the longest shutdown
author: ChadPergram

text: House in session today. Debate & vote on the Interior appropriations bill as Democrats try to re-open individual sections of the gov’t. Have not courted more than 12 GOPers on other bills to do so though
author: ChadPergram

text: No movement in gov’t shutdown talks. Lawmakers on both sides have reservations about a “national emergency” to build a border wall
author: ChadPergram

text: Non-voting Puerto Rican "Resident Commissioner" to Congress Jenniffer Gonzalez Colon (R-PR) says idea of taking disaster aid targeted for Puerto Rico to build the wall is “unacceptable" and adds "I will not support the reallocation of funds.”
author: ChadPergram

text: From colleague Jason Donner. Graham on Trump declaring national emergency for the wall: I always said it would be the last resort. We’re there there's no pathway forward that I can see.
author: ChadPergram

text: Schiff: During today’s bfn w/..Mnuchin, I pressed the secretary on deep concerns I have about the potential for Russian oligarch Oleg Deripaska..to exercise continuing influence and control over the sanctioned companies. His testimony..did not resolve those concerns.
author: ChadPergram

text: From colleague Mike Emanuel: Illinois Republican Congressman and Air National Guardsman Adam Kinzinger will be heading for his reserve duty at the southern border in the coming weeks
author: ChadPergram

text: Fox confirms WH directs Army Corps of Engineers to see if it can divert money to border wall from disaster funding bill to cover wildfires in California, hurricanes in Texas, Florida and Puerto Rico
author: ChadPergram

text: Jordan on Cohen hrng: The Democrats' star witness has admitted to providing intentionally false and misleading testimony to Congress. He is also a witness in ongoing law-enforcement matters, including Special Counsel Mueller's probe.
author: ChadPergram

text: Top GOPer on Hse Oversight Cmte Jordan: Cummings promised to pursue rigorous, responsible, fact-based oversight. However, the Chairman's announcement today suggests he will be using the committee as a venue for political theater rather than legitimate oversight.
author: ChadPergram

text: From colleague Caroline McKee. Cummings downplaying the Cohen hearing: "The press did not pay a lot of attention to the other things that we’ll be looking at. Our first hearing will be in regard to HR1. And we’ll also have a major hearing regarding lowering prescription drugs"
author: ChadPergram

text: Cummings on Cohen hearing:  We're going to make sure that we do absolutely nothing to interfere with the Mueller Investigation. That is very very important to us.
author: ChadPergram

text: Grassley on if Trump declares a nat'l emergency: I would advise against that as a bad precedent even if the president's got the authority to do it. I’d advise against it and I’d think that each side ought to be laying something on the table to negotiate.
author: ChadPergram

text: USCP The USCP is responding to demonstration activity outside of room SR-317. All other personnel are directed to avoid the area until further notice. (this is McConnell’s office)
author: ChadPergram

text: Rubio: The problem with that is here in the senate is that Schumer and Pelosi think they’re winning and the President thinks he’s winning. They’ve both boxed themselves into an impossible situation but they’re the only ones ultimately who can solve
author: ChadPergram

text: From colleague Caroline McKee. Manchin on if Trump declared a national emergency for the wall: "If he did it tonight everybody’d be right here to vote..Anybody whose leaving would come back immediately.”
author: ChadPergram

text: Senate ok's bill to provide back pay to furloughed federal workers once shutdown is over
author: ChadPergram

text: Top Dem on Senate Intel Cmte Warner: We would like to see Michael Cohen come back to the Senate Intelligence Committee. He didn’t tell the truth to our committee and it landed him in legal jeopardy. We’ve been in conversations with his lawyers about bringing him back
author: ChadPergram

text: GOP SC Sen Graham: I’ve never been more depressed about moving forward than I have right now. I just don’t see a pathway forward.
author: ChadPergram

text: Intel Cmte Chair Burr on Cohen: Cohen has had in his possession for months a request to return to the Senate Intelligence Committee for additional closed-door testimony, made all the more necessary by Mr. Cohen's indictment and guilty plea for making false statements
author: ChadPergram

text: Oversight Cmte mbr Dem MO Rep Clay on if there is a risk of Dems overplaying hand w/Cohen: I'm sure that there's always a risk. We saw it with the Kavanaugh hearings. There's a risk of over playing your hand..I don't think the Oversight Cmte intends on overplaying their hand
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem MO Rep Clay on Cohen testimony: Over the last two years, we've had very little oversight over this administration. This is probably just a crack in the window that starts the process of real oversight.
author: ChadPergram

text: Mbr of Hse Oversight Cmte MO Dem Clay says he believes Cohen is credible. "We will determine it somewhat in the hearing, but we will… I think as far as credibility is concerned, I think both men I knew exactly what they were doing and both of them have a story to tell."
author: ChadPergram

text: Colleague Mike Emanuel rpts Trump killed effort by GOP SC Sen Graham to try to engineer a "grand bargain" on the wall & also secure immigration provisions. Graham: "It is time for President Trump to use emergency powers to fund the construction of a border wall/barrier."
author: ChadPergram

text: From colleague John Roberts. Trump atty Giuliani says he can't imagine why Hse Dems would want to hear testimony from Cohen before Congress, as he is, "a thoroughly discredited liar."
author: ChadPergram

10 Republicans joined Democrats and voted yea.

All Democrats voted yea
 
12 GOPers voted yea.

text: Hse now voting on bill to fund transportation/housing pgms

author: ChadPergram

author: ChadPergram

text: Trump: We can declare a national emergency. We shouldn’t have to
author: ChadPergram

text: Hearing with Michael Cohen on Feb 7 likely to be biggest investigative hearing since fmr AG Sessions before Senate panel in June ‘17. Question is does it live up to hype
author: ChadPergram

text: Schiff: Mr. Cohen has expressed an interest in telling his personal story in open session..it will be necessary, however, for Mr. Cohen to answer questions pertaining to the Russia investigation, and we hope to schedule a closed session before our committee in the near future.

text: Michael Cohen on appearing before Hse Cmte on Feb 7: I look forward to having the privilege of being afforded a platform with which to give a full and credible account of the events which have transpired.”
author: ChadPergram

author: ChadPergram

text: Hse Oversight Cmte hrng w/Trump personal atty Michael Cohen scheduled for Thursday February 7
author: ChadPergram

text: Cummings: I thank Michael Cohen for agreeing to testify before the Oversight Cmte voluntarily..we have no interest in inappropriately interfering with any ongoing criminal investigations, and to that end, we are in the process of consulting with Special Counsel Mueller’s office.

text: From colleague Caroline McKee. Sen Mike Rounds (R-SD) says shutdown is a “binary issue” between Pelosi & Trump
author: ChadPergram

text: Colleague Jason Donner rpts AG Nominee William Barr now mtg w/McConnell
author: ChadPergram

text: Senate fails for a 2nd time on procedural vote to start debate on bill to assist Israel and sanction Syria. The vote was 53-43. But it needed 60 yeas. McConnell contends Democrats are blocking all action in the Senate because of the shutdown
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem DE Sen Coons on shutdown: I think we should find a way to agree on modern border security technology that doesn’t necessarily us building a vanity project concrete wall in the desert.
author: ChadPergram

text:
Pence:
Nothing is going to move until we get an agreement on Homeland Security and border security 

Pence:
More and more Americans are going to demand that Democrats in Congress step up and negotiate
author: ChadPergram

text:
Pence on the supposition that he told Senate Republicans the President would sign the Senate’s stopgap spending bill before Christmas:
That’s not accurate
author: ChadPergram

text:
Pence on Wed WH Mtg: 
I didn’t blame the President for a second for ending the meeting

Pence on Pelosi’s interpretation of the meeting:
She doesn’t recall it the way I recall it

Pence on when the President runs out of patience:
We’ll see
author: ChadPergram

text:
Pence when asked if the White House has misjudged House Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D-CA) at the meeting. Sidesteps question:
It was a cordial environment..they got out the tired talking point you need to re-open the government before we can negotiate
author: ChadPergram

text:
Pence on ending shutdown: 
The President said it would take 45 minutes. I don’t know it would take that long
author: ChadPergram

text:
Pence on CapHill on border wall: 
This is not a manufactured crisis people

Pence:
No wall, no deal

Pence on economic impact of shutdown:
This economy is roaring right now. Unemployment is at a 20 year low or a 30 year low
author: ChadPergram

text:
Pence on CapHill on border wall: 

Pence:
The President has made no decision with declaring a national emergency

Pence:
The President is going to get this done one way or another

Pence on if they declare a national emergency:
If it came to that, we would defend that
author: ChadPergram

text:
Pence on CapHill: 
I had a conversation after the meeting with Speaker and the Leader after the meeting yesterday. I said to them “Make us an offer”

Pence on a national emergency:
The President believes he has an absolute right to declare a national emergency
author: ChadPergram

text:
Pence on CapHill: 
This is a President absolutely determined to address this crisis

Pence:
It’s time for the Democrats to start negotiating 

Pence:
The President has asked us to look for an agreement..it’s time for the Democrat leadership to step up and come back to the table
author: ChadPergram

text:
Pence on the administration proposing a steel barrier on the border:
One of the Democratic leaders in the room thought that was a productive pathway

Pence:
The President is looking to build a wall. But he’s looking to do so much more than that
author: ChadPergram

text:
Pence on CapHill:
From the first day of this partial government shutdown, we’ve been working in good faith

Pence:
From the first day of this partial government shutdown, Democrats have refused to negotiate
author: ChadPergram

text:
Pence at CapHill: 
We do have a humanitarian crisis at our southern border...we’ve seen a dramatic increase in families and unaccompanied minors

Pence:
The President has brought great urgency to this

Pence:
We think human trafficking generates $2.5 billion on an annual basis
author: ChadPergram

text: From colleague Bree Tracey. Senate Apps Cmte Chair Shelby: The Democrats are going to have to not be against everything. They are going to have to be for something.

author: ChadPergram

text: Graham trying to craft a deal on opening gov’t & possible immigration/DACA arrangement. But Hse conservatives/Freedom Caucus likely won’t like it. Could be a problem for ldrs like McCarthy/Scalise

text: Ind VT Sen Sanders: It appears that as part of our campaign, there were some women who were harassed..I  thank them from the bottom of my heart for speaking out..what they experienced was absolutely unacceptable & not what a progressive campaign or any campaign should be about
author: ChadPergram

text: From colleague Jason Donner. GOP TN Sen Alexander: There should never be a government shutdown. It should be off limits in our discussion. I recommended that that we find provisions for border security and that we voted for before and enact them and reopen the government.

author: ChadPergram

text: From colleagur Bree Tracey. Durbin on if Trump declares a nat’l emergency for wall: If any president..this one or any president decides to just move unilaterally to spend funds as part of a national emergency, it goes way beyond the delegation of authority of the Constitution
author: ChadPergram

text: Schumer on the shutdown: Speaker Pelosi and I have gone over to the White House whenever we’ve been asked. But the president is simply not budging.
author: ChadPergram

text: Schumer on shutdown: The Congress, the Senate in particular, can no longer wait for this president to see the light of Reason. We gave it a good faith effort. Staffers worked over the weekend.
author: ChadPergram

text:
Graham as he walked into McConnell’s office on if Democrats would be game to trade immigration for a wall:
Let’s see where the marker is
author: ChadPergram

text:
GOP SC Sen Lindsey Graham on his efforts to thaw the shutdown talks: “Pelosi has dealt herself out. She is a non-player.”

Graham says “the best way to have a good outcome” is for the Appropriations Cmte hold a hearing on the President’s request for a wall and then have a markup.
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi says "as a Californian, how shocking" it was to hear Trump say he was going to withhold wildfire assistance from California. "I would urge my Republican colleagues to stop looking the other way..and they are just cavalier about it"
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi on if Trump declares a national emergency to get the border wall: I think he's going to have to answer to his own party on usurping that much power
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi on if Trump declares a national emergency to get the border wall: The President will have problems on his own side of the aisle
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi accuses WH of moving the goalposts "out of the stadium."
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi on WH mtg & Trump: I think he thought we would all stay there when he got up. He got up. We got up
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi on if she could consider DACA as part of a deal for a wall: We haven't had that discussion.
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi: I don't even know if the President wants the wall. I think he just wants a debate on the wall.
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi on Trump & shutdown: I don’t think he really wants a solution. I think he loves the distraction that this is from his other problems and that’s most unfortunate. It’s a luxury this country can’t afford under any circumstance.
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi on Trump: He knows I will not support a border wall. He knows that in 30 days I will not support a wall.
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi: The president doesn’t believe in governance. He doesn’t appreciate the role of public policy in the lives of the American people.
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi on Dem efforts to try to open gov't: This has all been held up by the presidents petulance..This has been stalled by the presidents obstinance
author: ChadPergram

text: McConnell to Cardin on effort to pass combo bill to re-open most of gov't: This will not produce a result. It's been perfectly clear that the only way to produce this result is for the president, the Speaker of the House and the Minority Leader to agree
author: ChadPergram

text: Pence now at the Capitol, talking to GOP mbrs about shutdown & wall.
author: ChadPergram

text: Colleague Peter Doocy rpts Kushner reached out to Dem WV Sen Manchin to discuss immigration. Talks going on behind the scenes in effort to trade DACA for wall.
author: ChadPergram

text:
McConnell objects, blocking Cardin in effort to pass Hse spending bill to re-open parts of gov’t. McConnell calls it a “show vote.”

Cardin sharply tells McConnell “I can tell the Majority Leader this is not a show vote.”
author: ChadPergram

text:
Sen. Ben Cardin (D-MD) asks unanimous consent on flr they pass one of the spending bills to end the shutdown.  

McConnell intercedes. Says “the last thing we need to do is trade pointless, absolutely pointless show votes back and forth across the aisle.”
author: ChadPergram

text: Schumer is now on floor. Trying to get Senate to start considering House passed spending bills to end shutdown. Is expected to be blocked. Schumer describes the President as “intransigent.” He also whipsaws McConnell for not helping to end the shutdown.
author: ChadPergram

text: The House today will debate and vote on the next round of individual spending bills to re-open the government. Up today: Agriculture and Transportation/Housing appropriations.
author: ChadPergram

text: Expect informal Senate talks to end the shutdown to continue, lead by Sen. Lindsey Graham (R-SC). He is trying to get a trade on border security/wall for immigration/DACA.
author: ChadPergram

text: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D-CA) will hold her first formal press conference as Speaker at 10:45 am et.
author: ChadPergram

text:
At 10:30 am et, Senate Democrats will try to get clearance on the floor to consider House-approved spending bills to re-open parts of government. 

Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer (D-NY) wants all Democrats on the floor for this. Republicans are expected to block Democrats.
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump tweet: Cryin Chuck told his favorite lie when he used his standard sound bite that I “slammed the table & walked out of the room. He had a temper tantrum.”..after Nancy said no to proper Border Security, I politely said bye-bye and left, no slamming!
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump tweet: There is GREAT unity with the Republicans in the House and Senate, despite the Fake News Media working in overdrive to make the story look otherwise...
author: ChadPergram

text: Treasury Sec Mnuchin to CapHill today to brief Hse mbrs about decision to ease sanctions on companies linked to Oleg Deripaska
author: ChadPergram

text: There are a lot of new freshman House Democrats besides Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez and Rashida Tlaib. And many are more moderate
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse to continue w/efforts to re-open gov’t today by moving individual spending bills. Agriculture & Transportation/Housing up today
author: ChadPergram

text: GOP TX Sens Cornyn/Cruz to join Trump on trip to border today as wall fight continues
author: ChadPergram

text: Senate holds another procedural vote today to move to bill to aid Israel and sanction Syria. Similar effort failed earlier this wk. Expect effort to get Hse passed spending bills on flr too
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi on Hse passing bill to re-open Treasury Dept/IRS: If Senate Republicans do not pass this legislation that they have already supported, they will be fully complicit in the chaos and cruelty of the Trump Shutdown
author: ChadPergram

text: Jordan: People have a right to know if the Dep AG plotted to wear a wire to secretly record the President with the goal of removing him from office.Rod Rosenstein's expected departure from his post in no way absolves him of his responsibility to answer questions before Congress.
author: ChadPergram

text: Fmr Hse Spkr Boehner famously ended his time in Congress w/what he called a "barn cleaning" to make things easier for Paul Ryan as Spkr. Finished interim deal on spending bills. Raised debt limit. Dem MA Rep McGovern says Ryan should have done the same at end of his Spkrshp
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem MA Rep McGovern critical of fmr Spkr Ryan leaving Congress w/gov't shutdown: "I think he should have finished his business...I don't know how he could have left town and left this country in such a mess."
author: ChadPergram

text: Fox has confirmed there is a classified House Foreign Affairs Committee briefing at 4 pm Thursday on a decision by Treasury to ease sanctions on companies linked to Oleg Deripaska Treasury Sec Mnuchin to appear
author: ChadPergram

text: Fox confirms that FDA is suspending routine domestic food-processing facility inspections have ceased due to shutdown. FDA trying to get some workers back on the job
author: ChadPergram

text: Colleague Caroline McKee rpts Sen Graham says working group trying find some bipartisan solutions to gov't shutdown. Murkowski hopes there will be more meetings.
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi at WH mtg about the shutdown: "It's cold out here and the temperature wasn't much better in the Situation Room"
author: ChadPergram

text:
From Dem source on WH mtg. Trump to Pelosi: "In 30 days, will you be in favor of a wall?"

Pelosi:" No."
 
Trump: "What's the point?" "Bye bye" (slams hands on the table)
author: ChadPergram

text:
From Dem source on WH mtg. "Schumer: you are using people as leverage. Why won't you open the government and stop hurting people?"
 
Trump: "Because then you won't give me what I want."
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem source on WH mtg: Pelosi said Democrats support border security and support addressing the narcotics and contraband interdiction issues Trump spoke about.  chumer noted that most drugs are coming through ports of entry.
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem source familiar w/WH mtg: Pelosi and Schumer in their opening talked about specific impacts of the shutdown.  Impacts to federal workers: their paychecks, mortgage payments, impacts to veterans because so many are federal employees.
author: ChadPergram

text: McCarthy on Pelosi saying that Trump was "petulent" in the shutdown mtg. McCarthy: "Not at all"
author: ChadPergram

text: After WH mtg, McCarthy says Trump "didn’t slam his hands down at all. He said 'Alright I guess you guys don’t want to do anything.'"
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem MA Sen Elizabeth Warren to travel to NH on January 12
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse Agriculture Cmte Chair Peterson (D-MN) says he doesn't think shutdown will backfire on farmers w/Trump: "Today we got 67 calls for building the wall and 5 against. It sounds to me he is still pretty popular."
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse Agriculture Cmte Chair Collin Peterson says gov't shutdown is hurting dairy farmers because they can't sign up for new pgms. Mentions a cattle rancher who is waiting for a check that can't be cut. Says the rancher can't pay rent or pay loan.
author: ChadPergram

text: Big mtg has been going on in Graham's office for a while now. Unclear what they have been talking about. Colleague Peter Doocy rpts Jared Kushner just left. Other senators spotted: Tillis, Murkowski, Alexander, Manchin, Collins, Portman.
author: ChadPergram

text:
8 GOP yeas on Financial Svcs Apps bill to re-open that section of gov’t: 

Reps. Will Hurd (R-TX), John Katko (R-NY), Elise Stefanik (R-NY), Fred Upton (R-MI), Brian Fitzpatrick (R-PA), Greg Walden (R-OR), Jaime Herrera Beutler (R-WA) and Adam Kinzinger (R-IL)
author: ChadPergram

text: Dems are not making much progress getting GOPers to break ranks on individual spending bills to re-open parts of gov’t. Dem Caucus chair Jeffries predicted “double digits” when asked how many GOPers would vote yea. Only 8 on financial svcs appropriations bill
author: ChadPergram

text:
The House has voted to approve the individual Financial Services Appropriations bill to re-open that section of the government.  The vote was 240 to 188
 
All Democrats voted aye.
 
They were joined by 8 Republicans who voted yes
author: ChadPergram

text:
House now voting on the Financial Services Appropriations bill to re-open that section of the government

Key will be to see how many House Republicans side with Democrats and vote aye
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi on Trump: He is willing to hold federal workers hostage to my point of view. How pathetic is his argument if he doesn’t have confidence that he can prevail in negations if he have to shut down government to strengthen his hand.
author: ChadPergram

text: Hoyer on how they end the shutdown: “We’ve got to stop taking hostages”
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi on if this is the end of talks: I hope not. We have had people over the weekend in a series of meetings trying to come to an agreement of stipulation of fact of what the challenge is. The merit of different ways to protect the border. Border security is of high priority.
author: ChadPergram

text: McConnell after WH mtg on shutdown: I hope we made it clear to you guys after the lunch that we are sticking with the president on this.
author: ChadPergram

text: McConnell on WH mtg: I think it’s safe to say we didn’t make any progress today
author: ChadPergram

text: Hoyer on shutdown mtg: This is not partisan difference. This is policy difference.
author: ChadPergram

text: On the shutdown. The dam will only break at this pt if there is some triggering “event” which compels them to re-open the gov’t.  Next metric to watch: See how many Hse GOPers break ranks and vote yes on the financial services appropriations bill in the House later today
author: ChadPergram

text: We weren’t expecting a breakthrough at the WH today on the shutdown. But the sides now seem further apart than they ever were
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi at the Capitol after WH mtg: “It was a petulent President of the United States”
author: ChadPergram

text: Pence: There will be no deal without a wall
author: ChadPergram

text: Senate Apps Cmte Chair Shelby on Trump lunch: The message today is stay together..be cohesive and let people know he’s willing to sit down and discuss this with the Democrats in a rational way.
author: ChadPergram

text: McCarthy on Trump & CA wildfires: We are all frustrated with the lack of proper forest management that could mitigate the damage our communities have experienced and will certainly experience in the future.
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump tweet: I left a meeting with Chuck and Nancy, a total waste of time. I asked what is going to happen in 30 days if I quickly open things up, are you going to approve Border Security which includes a Wall or Steel Barrier? Nancy said, NO. I said bye-bye, nothing else works!
author: ChadPergram

text: McCarthy accuses Dems of not telling the truth about what happened in WH mtg. Says he was “disturbed” by Dems behavior in mtg
author: ChadPergram

text: McCarthy says Pelosi said they could not have “border security” in 30 days if they re-opened the gov’t. Says Dems only want to “argue.”
author: ChadPergram

text: McCarthy says they need to bring cameras back to the meetings on the shutdown
author: ChadPergram

text: Pence says “the Democratic leaders are unwilling to even negotiate”
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi on what WH mtg & Trump’s case for wall: The evidence does not match the situation you describe
author: ChadPergram

text: WH Mtg on shutdown breaks up. Dems speaking now
author: ChadPergram

text: From colleague Caroline McKee. GOP AK Sen Murkowski on the shutdown: "There are consequences and people are starting to feel those consequences.”
author: ChadPergram

text: Top Dem on Senate Energy/Public Works Cmte Carper: When Andrew Wheeler was first selected to be (Acting EPA Admin)..I urged him to restore public trust in the agency by..remedying some of Scott Pruitt’s most egregious actions and proposals. He has not done so.
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump admin on individual spending bills the Hse is passing this wk to re-open gov't: "If H.R. 264, H.R. 267, H.R. 265, or H.R. 266 are presented to the President, his advisors would recommend that he veto the bills."
author: ChadPergram

text: From colleague Guerin Hays. Graham on if Trump discussed a national emergency in lunch mtg: The president didn’t talk about that. To me that would be your last option not your first. Because you set a precedent. You've got to think about what this precedent does.
author: ChadPergram

text: From colleague Guerin Hays. Leahy: I hate to see Rod Rosenstein leave.. don’t know if it helps Dems or republican. I thought he was in the position with a great deal of credibility and expertise and professionalism so hate to see him leave
author: ChadPergram

text:
GOP KS Sen Moran on impacts of gov’t shutdown:
The farm bill we just passed is not being implemented
author: ChadPergram

text:
GOP KS Sen Moran on shutdown & wall:
No one says what they’re normally for. They’re just against the other side

Moran:
I’m opposed to declaring an emergency. Other members of the Senate are as well
author: ChadPergram

text: GOP KS Sen Moran: “Almost everyone I know lives paycheck to paycheck..That ought to be pressure on all of us to get this resolved”
author: ChadPergram

text: Colleague Peter Doocy rpts GOP senator in the Senate mtg challenged Trump over shutdown. But they emphasized they want the shutdown over soon
author: ChadPergram

text: Bicameral, bipartisan Congressional leaders now heading to the WH for meeting with Trump on gov’t shutdown
author: ChadPergram

text: House now debating Financial Services Appropriations bill to re-open that section of the government
author: ChadPergram

text:
Trump after meeting with Senate GOPers: “We have a very unified party”

Trump on the GOP lunch
There was no reason for me to be there

Trump:
We had a great time..There was solidarity
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump still at the Capitol meeting with GOP senators. To meet with bipartisan, bicameral Congressional leaders in less than an hour. Waiting to see if any GOP senators..or the President, potentially shift their position
author: ChadPergram

text: Upon arriving at the Capitol to meet with Senate GOPers about the wall, Trump says that Democrats are losing a lot of support over the shutdown
author: ChadPergram

text: Feinstein: It’s absolutely shocking for President Trump to suggest he would deny disaster assistance to communities destroyed by wildfire. Attacking victims is yet another low for this president.
author: ChadPergram

text: Colleague Caroline McKee rpts Acting DefSec Patrick Shanahan finishes mtg with Hse Armed Svcs Cmte chair Adam Smith. Shanahan says they had a had a “great meeting” with Smith
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump now arriving at the Capitol to take part in the Senate GOP lunch & talk about the border & what Trump argues is a crisis at the border.
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump formally sends nomination of Andrew Wheeler to the Senate. Is nominated to succeed Scott Pruitt as EPA Administrator
author: ChadPergram

text: From colleague Jason Donner. Dem AL Sen Doug Jones: on shutdown: People have been entrenched but they're talking again..So hopefully that we can break this impasse. Hopefully people are not as entrenched as they may give publicly and we can get something
author: ChadPergram

text: Revamped schedule for Hse to pass indvidual spending bills. Financial Services today. Agriculture & Transportation/Housing tomorrow. Interior on Friday
author: ChadPergram

text: Sen. Shelley Moore Capito (R-WV) chairs the Senate Homeland Security Appropriations Subcommittee, which handles wall funding. Capito says she would have to see a prospective deal to re-open gov't before committing to it
author: ChadPergram

text:
There is some rumbling among some moderate Republicans about pushing to re-open the government, regardless of where they are with the wall.
Sens. Cory Gardner (R-CO), Lisa Murkowski (R-AK) and Susan Collins (R-ME) are leaning in that direction.
author: ChadPergram

text: Top bicameral/bipartisan Congressional leaders head to WH for 3 pm conclave. This is important because it involves the principals, NOT just aides. The criticism of the weekend “working group” is that many of the aides in the meetings were not “deputized” to negotiate
author: ChadPergram

text: President Trump heads to Capitol Hill shortly to meet with Senate Republicans and Vice President Pence at the weekly Senate GOP policy luncheon. This is a reprise of what Pence did last night with the House GOPers.
author: ChadPergram

text: Notable that House Majority Leader Steny Hoyer (D-MD) is presiding from the dais over the debate on the rule for debate on the Financial Services Appropriations bills on the floor later today.
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse today on schedule to pass Financial Svcs spending bill today, likely with some GOP votes. Agriculture & Interior tomorrow. Transportation/Housing Friday.
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse Rules Cmte Chair McGovern on Hse prepping individual spending bills to re-open gov't: This is not where we intended to be to to start the new Congress. Cleaning up the mess left by the last Congress..But we are where we are. This is an emergency. We need to re-open the gov't
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump on shutdown & wall: I think we are getting closer..I didn’t want this fight.
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump on shutdown: "I think something will happen. I really do. Otherwise we will have to go about it in a different manner.”
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump says he may declare a national emergency for the wall if he doesn't get a deal with Congress
author: ChadPergram

text: Schumer on mtg with Trump today: We will continue to negotiate but first order of business is to reopen the government
author: ChadPergram

text: Schumer on federal employees impacted by shutdown: To use them as hostage through a temper tantrum by the president is so unfair. It ought to end and it ought to end now
author: ChadPergram

text: Graham as incoming Senate Judiciary Cmte chair after mtg w/AG nominee Barr: I’m going to do a deep dive into the FISA issue. I think he'll be part of it.
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse Dem Caucus Chair Jeffries says “we expect this number to enter the double digits” when asked how many GOPers could vote for individual Hse appropriations bills to re-open sections of gov’t
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse Dem Caucus Chair Jeffries says a wall is a “5th century solution to a 21st century problem. Wants Trump to take “yes” for an answer” as Hse moves individual spending bills to re-open gov’t
author: ChadPergram

text: On prayer and profanity
author: ChadPergram

text: Atty Genera nominee William Barr at the Capitol today to meet w/incoming Senate Judiciary Cmte chairman Graham & others ahead of comfirmation hearings
author: ChadPergram

text: House slated to debate/vote on Financial Services appropriations bill today to re-open Treasury & the IRS
author: ChadPergram

text: Top Bicameral, bipartisan leaders to the White House later today to discuss gov’t shutdown
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump/Pence to the Capitol today to talk to Senate GOPers at lunch about wall & border security
author: ChadPergram

text: Senate today swore-in GOP FL Sen Rick Scott. Here are the breakdowns for the new Congress. 100 Senate mbrs. 53 GOPers 47 Dems. Technically, 45 Dems as Sanders & King are independents yet caucus w/Dems. Hse: 434 mbrs. 235 Dems.  199 GOPers. One vacancy. NC’s 9th district
author: ChadPergram

text: McConnell: The past eighteen days have shown that Democrats’ refusal to negotiate is not due to any principled objection, but simply due to partisan spite for the president.
author: ChadPergram

text: McConnell: President Trump reaffirmed his commitment to addressing the humanitarian and security crisis at our nation’s southern border. His proposal to increase security through physical barriers suits the reality on the ground.
author: ChadPergram

text:
DSCC's David Bergstein on Trump speech: 

“Tonight’s address moved Senate Republicans closer to defeat in 2020 because the longer they drag out their pointless shutdown, the more damaging it will be for them.”
author: ChadPergram

text: Schumer: The symbol of America should be the Statue of Liberty, not a thirty-foot wall. So our suggestion is a simple one: Mr. President: re-open the government and we can work to resolve our differences over border security. But end this shutdown now.
author: ChadPergram

text: Schumer: Most presidents have used Oval Office addresses for noble purposes.  This president just used the backdrop of the Oval Office to manufacture a crisis, stoke fear, and divert attention from the turmoil in his Administration.
author: ChadPergram

text: Schumer: How do we untangle this mess? There is an obvious solution: separate the shutdown from the arguments over border security.  There is bipartisan legislation – supported by Democrats and Republicans, to re-open government
author: ChadPergram

text: Schumer: Tonight – and throughout this debate and his presidency – President Trump has appealed to fear, not facts.  Division, not unity. Make no mistake: Democrats and the President both want stronger border security.  However, we sharply disagree with the President
author: ChadPergram

text: In Pelosi's remarks, she uses the phrases "the fact is" five times. An effort to contrast what Democrats contend are falsehoods propounded by the administration and the president about the wall.
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi: The fact is: President Trump must stop holding the American people hostage, must stop manufacturing a crisis, and must re-open the government.
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi: The fact is: the women and children at the border are not a security threat, they are a humanitarian challenge – a challenge that President Trump’s own cruel and counterproductive policies have only deepened.
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi: The President is rejecting these bipartisan bills which would re-open government – over his obsession with forcing American taxpayers to waste billions of dollars on an expensive and ineffective wall – a wall he always promised Mexico would pay for.
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi: Sadly, much of what we have heard from President Trump throughout this senseless shutdown has been full of misinformation and even malice. The President has chosen fear.  We want to start with the facts.
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi/Schumer up now, responding to Trump's televised address.
author: ChadPergram

text: In his televised remarks, Trump does NOT declare a national emergency in order to construct the border wall.
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump remarks complete. Now waiting for remarks by Pelosi/Schumer from the Capitol
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump: This is a choice between right and wrong. Justice and injustice.
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump on border security: "How much more American blood must we shed?"
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump says wall will pay for itself and will be paid for by Mexico/Canada trade pact. Not yet agreed to by Congress.
author: ChadPergram

text: Says gov't shutdown could be solved "in a 45 minute meeting." Says that's why he called Congressional leaders to the White House.
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump calls out Schumer by name. Says "they changed their mind" & "refused to acknowledge the crisis." Says the shutdown is because "Democrats won't fund border security."
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump says border issues "strains public resources." Says it disproportionately impacts African Americans & Hispanic Americans. Says "this is a humanitarian crisis. A crisis of the heart and a crisis of the soul."
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump to make his first televised address from the Oval Office shortly. Will speak about the border wall and border security. To be followed by the Democratic response at the Capitol with Pelosi and Schumer
author: ChadPergram

text: Giffords standing in the well with the Arizona delegation for the moment of silence: Dem CA Rep Mike Thompson and Dem GA Rep Lucy McBath whose son was killed by gun violence
author: ChadPergram

text: House now observing moment of silence on 8th anniversary of Tuscon shooting which wounded fmr Dem AZ Rep Gabrielle Giffords & killed aide Gabe Zimmerman. Giffords on the floor now
author: ChadPergram

text: DHS Sec Nielsen as she the Capitol after mtg w/House GOPers on her message about the border “it’s a crisis”
author: ChadPergram

text: Pence & DHS Sec Nielsen leave House GOP briefing on border. No comments
author: ChadPergram

text: And in other news...GOP SC Sen Lindsey Graham on the Senate flr: “The Clemson Tigers have become the gold standard for college football, both on and off the field”
author: ChadPergram

text: McCarthy says Pence did not tell House Republicans if Trump will delcare a national emergency for the border
author: ChadPergram

text:
After mtg w/Pence/Nielsen on border security: House Republican Conference Chairwoman Liz Cheney (R-WY):
The main message is we have a crisis at the southern border

House Minority Whip Steve Scalise (R-LA):
We have a clear crisis at the southern border
author: ChadPergram

text: Senate fails to launch debate on bill to assist Israel & sanction Syria. Procedural vote was 56-44. But it needed 60 yeas
author: ChadPergram

text: Judiciary Cmte Chair Grassley to meet w/AG nominee Barr tomorrow
author: ChadPergram

text: House to observe moment of silence tonight the 8th anniversary of the Tuscon shooting which killed aide Gabe Zimmerman & wounded fmr Dem AZ Rep Gabrielle Giffords. She will be on the flr for the moment of silence
author: ChadPergram

text: Senate now taking procedural vote to advance bill which would impose sanctions against Syria, assist Israel & cooperate with Jordan
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump to Capitol Hill tomorrow for Senate GOP policy lunch. Then the Big 8 Congressional leaders invited to the White House at 3 pm tomorrow
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse Rules Cmte now mtg. Will prep financial svcs spending bill for debate tomorrow. Would fund Treasury & IRS
author: ChadPergram

text: Pence, Nielsen, Mulvaney on CapHill for briefing of House GOPers about their case for a border wall.
author: ChadPergram

text: Big 8 Congressional leaders to White House at 3 pm et Wednesday
author: ChadPergram

text: Fmr Dem AZ Rep Gabrielle Giffords on CapHill for rollout of bipartisan, universal background checks bill. Applies to all gun purchases/transfers. Today is the 8th anniversary of Giffords being shot. Aide Gabe Zimmerman was killed in the attack
author: ChadPergram

text: Colleague Caroline McKee rpts Pence now in McConnell's office
author: ChadPergram

text:
Pence swears-in GOP FL Sen Rick Scott. Among those spotted were several former Florida GOP senators: 

Sens. Connie Mack Sr. (R-FL), Mel Martinez (R-FL) and George LeMieux (R-FL)
author: ChadPergram

text: Pence now at Capitol to swear-in Sen-elect Rick Scott of FL
author: ChadPergram

text: From colleague Jason Donner. McConnell does not reply when asked if the possibility of Trump declaring a national emergency for the border wall is a good idea
author: ChadPergram

text:
McConnell on Dems & gov't shutdown: 
The only thing that changed now are political whims & the occupant of the White House. It’s just political spite. A tantrum being prioritized over the public business

McConnell:
They’ve put that partisan tantrum over keeping the gov't open
author: ChadPergram

text: In his flr remarks, McConnell accuses Democrats of wanting to block the wall just because it’s President Trump’s initiative. Some years ago, McConnell famously described Senate GOP efforts to make President Obama “a one term President.”
author: ChadPergram

text: McConnell says the shutdown was “caused by Democrats unwillingness to negotiate with the White House." Says Dems are "wanting to shut the Senate down, too."
author: ChadPergram

text: Top GOPer on Hse Armed Svcs Cmte Thornberry on acting DefSec Shanahan if he should recuse himself on Boeing issues: I don’t know.,I worry if we go too far saying anyone involved in defense contracting can’t work in the DOD....it’s like cutting off your nose in spite of your face
author: ChadPergram

text: Top GOPer on Hse Armed Svcs Cmte Thornberry on if there is anything Congress can do to block Trump from using military construction money for wall: "I am opposed to using national defense funds for anything else."
author: ChadPergram

text: From colleague Caroline McKee. Top GOPer on Hse Armed Svcs Cmte Thornberry. Opposes using military construction money for border wall. Says "to take some of that money will be damaging and I’m not in support of that. We should fund border needs on their own."
author: ChadPergram

text: In opening prayer, Senate Chaplain Barry Black speaks of federal workers enduring "collateral damage" because of partial government shutdown.
author: ChadPergram

text: Pence coming to the Capitol to swear-in GOP FL Sen-elect Rick Scott. Pence will also be here later today to meet with House GOPers, alongside DHS Sec Nielsen, to discuss the border wall.
author: ChadPergram

text: Sen Bernie Sanders (I-VT) to deliver a response to Trump tonight. Will be streamed on Facebook, YouTube and Twitter. Comes after Pelosi/Schumer deliver their response to Trump.
author: ChadPergram

text: The latest on the shutdown and the political fallout
author: ChadPergram

text: Hoyer: "After Newt Gingrich shut down the government there was not another shutdown for 17 years. Why? Because the American public was so mad about it."
author: ChadPergram

text: Hoyer on if Trump can declare a nat'l emergency for the wall: “I don’t think the president has that authority. I think it’s analogous to the governments that we’ve seen all over the world applying martial law to justify them doing whatever they want, to whomever they want"
author: ChadPergram

text: From colleague Caroline McKee. Hoyer says Trump has taken "hostage the people’s government and people who work for the government.” Says "in another context we would call that an act of kidnapping or terrorism."
author: ChadPergram

text: Recent instances of Mrbs of Congress responding to a NON State of the Union, televised address by the President: 3) Fmr Hse Spkr John Boehner (R-OH) responded to President Obama speaking about the debt limit crisis from the Speaker’s Ceremonial Office in the Capitol in July, 2011
author: ChadPergram

text: Recent instances of Mrbs of Congress responding to a NON State of the Union, televised address by the President: 2) Former Rep. Charles Boustany (R-LA) responded to President Obama from the Strom Thurmond Room of the Capitol after he gave his health care speech in September, 2009
author: ChadPergram

text: Recent instances of Mrbs of Congress responding to a NON State of the Union, televised address by the President: 1) Sen. Jack Reed (D-RI) responded to President George W. Bush after an Iraq/Afghanistan speech from the Mansfield Room at the Capitol in September, 2007.
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi/Schumer announce they will deliver a response to Trump's speech about the border and wall tonight following his remarks. They will give their remarks from the Speaker's Balcony at the Capitol.
author: ChadPergram

text: Freshman members of Congress are no longer “outsiders.” They are now “incumbents.”
author: ChadPergram

text: Senate to take procedural vote late this afternoon to start on bill which assists provides defense aid to Israel, reauthorizes cooperation w/Jordan & "to halt the wholesale slaughter of the Syrian people, and for other purposes."
author: ChadPergram

text: Senate today to swear-in Sen.-elect Rick Scott (R-FL)
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse Rules Cmte to meet later today to prep Financial Svcs & general government funding bill for flr debate/vote later this wk. Bill covers Treasury & IRS. Hse Dems intend to pass all remaining 7 bills individually in attempt to re-open gov't
author: ChadPergram

text: Pence & DHS Sec Nielsen to CapHill later today to brief House GOPers on issues at the border
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump to speak to nation tonight about border in televised address from Oval Office. Pelosi/Schumer seeking equal TV time
author: ChadPergram

text: Fmr Dem AZ Rep Giffords on CapHill today as Pelosi & Dem CA Rep Thompson roll out bipartisan bill calling for bipartisan background checks for all gun sales/transfers. Bill is HR 8. Today is 8th anniversary of shooting where Giffords was wounded & aide Gabe Zimmerman was killed
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi/Schumer: Now that the television networks have decided to air the President’s address, which if his past statements are any indication will be full of malice and misinformation, Democrats must immediately be given equal airtime.
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi/Schumer: Trump keeps rejecting the bipartisan House-passed bills, which have already received strong bipartisan support in the Senate, to re-open..gov’t..he is still demanding that American taxpayers pay at least $5.7 billion for his wall, which can’t pass either chamber
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi/Schumer: Democrats and an increasing number of Republicans in Congress have repeatedly urged the President and Leader McConnell to end the Trump Shutdown and re-open the government while Congress debates the President’s expensive and ineffective wall.
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump potentially declaring nat'l emergency could ramp up impeachment talk. But Pelosi’s been here before. When Dems got the Hse in '07, she quashed a rebellion among Dems who wanted to impeach President George W Bush over Iraq.
author: ChadPergram

text: On Tlaib, Pelosi has wrestled with disciplining mbrs for intemperate remarks – of even the opposite party. Pelosi didn't want to formally discipline Joe Wilson after he shouted "you lie" at Obama. Clyburn pushed for & secured an informal “resolution of disapproval” for Wilson
author: ChadPergram

text: Dems struggling w/overexposed freshmen Dems now. Ocasio-Cortez. Tlaib. Little focus on Dem freshman moderates like CunninghamSC, GoldenME, McAdamsUT. Swing voters may think the party is too far left if they only hear about Ocasio-Cortez & Tlaib.
author: ChadPergram

text: Dems privately seething about Tlaib's comments about Trump last week. Believe that took focus off gov't shutdown & wall fight.
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi always has a good read on temperature of her caucus. She knows they don't want a wall. But there has never been a shutdown to start a new Congress. A lot of mbrs are unknowns. Not clear what so many new Dems would support to re-open gov't.
author: ChadPergram

text: If Trump declares nat'l emergency for wall, he could draw of Congressional appropriators. It is said there are three types of Members of Congress. Democrats. Republicans. And Appropriators. Those who control the purse strings won’t support Trump tramping on their ground at all.
author: ChadPergram

text: Members of Congress of both parties guard their Constitutional prerogatives closely. Many won’t be happy about a national emergency to declare a wall.
author: ChadPergram

text: If Trump does go around Congress for wall, watch to see if GOPers challenge him. Trump got an earful from some Congressional GOPers for how he handled Saudi Arabia after Khashoggi killing & Syria withdrawal plan. GOP had previously been more deferential to Trump
author: ChadPergram

text: On Trump going around CapHill for wall, all administrations test limits of exec power. Truman in Youngstown Steel case. Rebuked by SCOTUS. Obama w/recess appointments. Rebuked by SCOTUS. SCOTUS said exec branch can't tell legislative branch what constitutes a recess.
author: ChadPergram

text: Dems & some GOPers will explode if Trump goes around Congress & declares a national emergency for border wall. Hse GOP often said it wanted Congress to reclaim Congressional authority to take on Obama. Watch to see if GOPers were to give Trump a pass.
author: ChadPergram

text: Hearing that WH may start to meet w/rank & file mbrs on border wall. Lots of these talks need to be kicked to the mbr level. That's why there was criticism of wknd talks w/staff. Aides aren't always deputized to negotiate on behalf of mbrs
author: ChadPergram

text: From colleague Kevin Corke: Pence: "The weekend sessions were productive from the standpoint that we understand the priorities on both sides.  Now we need to get the Democrats to negotiate.”
author: ChadPergram

text: From colleague Kevin Corke. He rpts Trump is still considering declaring a national emergency not not sure if he will call for one. WH counsel's office looking at what one would look like & what it can do. WH also contends that tax refunds won't be impacted by the shutdown
author: ChadPergram

text: Nadler on Trump & border wall: e can’t take funds for other purposes just because he declares national emergency..we will oppose any attempt by the president to make himself a king or a tyrant
author: ChadPergram

text: Judiciary Cmte Chair Nadler on if Trump declares nat'l  emergency to build wall: The president has no authority of usurping Congressional authority..
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse Judiciary Cmte Chair Nadler on Trump to speak to nation about border wall: I expect president to lie to the American people.
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem TX Rep Castro says if Trump declares a national emergency for border wall, it would be "profoundly inappropriate to circumvent Congress" & build the wall "against the will of Congress."
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem TX Rep Gonzalez on Trump border visit: If the president does visit McAllen, Texas, he should feel free to walk around and support our local businesses– after all it is safer to walk around McAllen than it is D.C.
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem TX Rep Gonzalez, who represents a district on the border, on Trump coming to border Thus. Let me remind the president that McAllen, Texas, a border city, has experienced some of the lowest crime rates in 30 years.
author: ChadPergram

text: Pence & DHS Sec Nielsen to brief Hse GOPers on border situation at 5:30 pm et Tues on CapHill. Expected to brief GOP senators on Wed
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump to speak tomorrow night about the border crisis to a national TV audience
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem Rep. Torres Small and CHC Chair Castro lead delegation to Alamogordo, NM today to probe death of Felipe Gomez Alonzo in CBP custody.
author: ChadPergram

text: On prayer and profanity...
author: ChadPergram

text: What’s next with the partial government shutdown
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump tweet:..Pence & group had a productive meeting with the Schumer/Pelosi representatives today. Many details of Border Security were discussed. We are now planning a Steel Barrier rather than concrete. It is both stronger & less obtrusive. Good solution, & made in the USA
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem official familiar w/WH mtg on shutdown: No progress was made today. At this time, there is not another meeting of this group scheduled.
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem official on WH mtg: The Admin did not present any commensurate cuts in the DHS budget to accommodate..increases they are seeking. Given the failure of the White House to present a full budget justification today, the Dem staff pleaded again..to change course & re-open gov’t
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem official on WH mtg: Yesterday, Democrats asked for a full budget justification for the Administration’s position because the $5.7 billion wall request was not included in the Administration’s FY 2019 request..Democratic staff did not receive a full budget justification today
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem official familiar w/today’s WH mtg on the shutdown: The meeting today at 1 p.m. started approximately 45 minutes late because the White House did not have the information Democrats requested ready.
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse GOP ldrshp aide on WH shutdown mtg: Democrats were given what they asked for, which was a detailed, breakdown list of the administration’s proposals for border security that include the wall and other border protection measures.
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump says he’s looking at declaring a “national emergency” to get his border wall
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump when asked if he’s spoken to Pelosi: We’ve been in touch with a lot of people and I informed my folks to say that we’ll build a steel barrier
author: ChadPergram

text: WH mtg w/Congressional ldrshp aides now starting on the gov’t shutdown
author: ChadPergram

text: By the end of the week, the House likely will have passed different versions of all funding bills to re-open the government twice. These pkgs are expected to be DOA in the Senate
author: ChadPergram

text: We expect the House to consider the Financial Services and General Government appropriations bill Wednesday. This measure deals with Treasury and funds the IRS.
author: ChadPergram

text: This wk the Hse begins approving new appropriations measures on an individual basis. Rules Committee will meet late Tuesday afternoon to tee up some of these measures for the floor. The Rules Committee is the gateway for most legislation to reach the House floor.
author: ChadPergram

text:
House to consider 2nd set of bills to fund government again this week
The House already approved one amalgamated spending bill, addressing six areas of spending AND one measure to fund DHS through February 8. The House approved both bills on a bipartisan basis.
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump on gov’t workers not receiving paychecks: I can relate and I'm sure the people who are on the receiving end will make adjustments, they always do...but many of those people who won't be receiving a paycheck, many of those people agree with what I'm doing.
author: ChadPergram

text: Admin officials, top Congressional aides, slated to meet again later today on gov’t shutdown
author: ChadPergram

text: WH’s Sanders on Fox when asked if Trump is in fact willing to keep gov’t shut for months or yrs: “Absolutely. The president means what he says when he says that.“
author: ChadPergram

text: WH’s Sanders on Fox. Says Dems at shutdown mtg said "’We’re not here to make an agreement.’ this is the beginning of a conversation that still has I think a lot left to be worked out.  They’re going to meet again later this afternoon & hopefully they’ll continue to make progress”
author: ChadPergram

text: Apps Cmte Chair Lowey: These bills will stop this chaos, get many federal employees back on the job, and ensure that key parts of the government are working for the American people.
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse Dems release text of 4 appropriations bills to re-open the government for the coming week. Starts with the Financial Svcs appropriations bill
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi: Next wk Hse Dems will begin passing individual appropriations bills to re-open all gov’t agencies, starting with the appropriations bill that covers the Dept of the Treasury & the lRS. This action is necessary so..people can receive their tax refunds on schedule.
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi: While President Trump threatens to keep the government shut down for 'years', Democrats are taking immediate further action to re-open government, so that we can meet the needs of the American people, protect our borders and respect our workers.
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem aide familiar w/shutdown mtg: Democratic staff indicated it will be difficult to make real progress as long as the president keeps the government closed
author: ChadPergram

text: Democratic aide says administration “doubled down” on $5.7 billion in White House meeting. Says “everyone knows can’t pass either chamber of Congress. Democratic staff repeatedly urged the Trump Administration and Republicans to reopen the government but were rejected.”
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem source familiar w/WH shutdown mtg: Today was an opportunity for the Administration to come down from an untenable position that cannot pass the Congress. That did not happen. The same group will meet tomorrow.
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem source familiar w/WH mtg: Democratic staff in the room were clear that White House must support re-opening government immediately and that it will grow increasingly hard to start formal negotiations with government closed.  Administration officials refused.
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem sources familiar w/WH mtg: Democrats in the room asked for a formal budget justification for the Administration’s position in order to finally determine what the Administration’s request is.  As you know, the White House has been all over the place on numbers for months.
author: ChadPergram

text:
Democratic source familiar with today’s White House meeting:
 
The Vice President made clear that the White House will not move off of the $5.7 billion dollar proposal that led to the Trump Shutdown.
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse GOP ldrshp aide on shutdown mtg: It was productive and beneficial to have Secretary Nielsen finally be able to outline the crisis at the border in detail without interruption, given her prior efforts were cut off by Democrat leaders. The group agreed to meet again tomorrow.
author: ChadPergram

text: Readout on shutdown mtg from Hse GOP ldrshp aide: House & Senate Republican leadership chiefs and policy directors, along with senior Democrat policy staff, met today with the Vice President, Secretary Nielsen, and other senior administration officials for an in-depth discussion
author: ChadPergram

text: WH on shutdown mtg: There was no in depth conversation about dollar figure, but the priorities for security. VP reiterated President’s position that we need funding for the wall. Dems requested further details in writing on needs of DHS. We will provide this tonight/tomorrow
author: ChadPergram

text: From colleague Jennifer Bowman. WH official on shutdown mtg:!Secretary Nielsen was able to provide a full briefing on the crisis at the Southern border. The conversation was productive and they agreed to meet again tomorrow afternoon.
author: ChadPergram

text: New challenges for the New Democratic Hosuse
author: ChadPergram

text: Colleague Jennifer Bowman rpts WH mtg on efforts to end shutdown appears to have concluded
author: ChadPergram

text: Mtg now starting on gov’t shutdown w/Pence, Mulvaney, Nielsen, Kushner & top Congressional leadership aides
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump tweet on shutdown: I don’t care that most of the workers not getting paid are Democrats, I want to stop the Shutdown as soon as we are in agreement on Strong Border Security! I am in the White House ready to go, where are the Dems?
author: ChadPergram

text: Congressional ldrshp aides to meet with Pence, Mulvaney, Nielsen & Kushner in effort to end partial government shutdown
author: ChadPergram

text: New year. But same government shutdown
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse Armed Svcs Cmte Chair Smith on moving military $ to fund wall: It has a direct impact on readiness because readiness is always the last place they go for $. Readiness is fixing equipment..enough ammo for training, enough fuel for training, that’s where you get less training
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse Armed Svcs Cmte Chair Adam Smith on reprogramming military money for the wall: I think that would be a terrible idea..I think it harm readiness and harm our military.
author: ChadPergram

text: Harry Truman once said “if you want a friend in Washington, get a dog.” A dog in the Capitol Rotunda by the statue of Alexander Hamilton on a Friday night.
author: ChadPergram

text: McCarthy criticized Dems for not keeping Hse in session this wknd to solve shutdown. But GOP, when in control of Hse, cut everyone loose before Christmas. Ryan last seen at Capitol Dec 22. GOP controlled Senate met briefly today. Returns Tuesday afternoon
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse GOP passed bill in Dec w/only GOPers to fund gov't w/wall money. Bill was dead in water. Hse Dems, now in control passed bills w/bipartisan support to fund gov't w/o wall money. But GOP now criticizing Dems for the same tactic they took before Christmas
author: ChadPergram

text: Fox is told after Trump burned McConnell w/interim Dec spending bill, McConnell is partly backing away from talks. Putting issue mostly in hands of Hse/Senate Dems & Trump. Reiterates bill must be able to get Trump's signature to re-open gov't
author: ChadPergram

text: At WH today, McCarthy/Scalise stood by Trump in Rose Garden. McConnell came back to Capitol. Thune was never seen. McConnell feels burned by Trump after he put interim spending bill on flr Dec 19, passed it & then Trump threatened veto. Was told Trump would sign it.
author: ChadPergram

text: Of the 12 spending bills, Milcon/VA & Defense are among the 5 signed into law. Admin can "reporgram" or "transfer" funds w/Congressional approval. Otherwise, most money already appropriated is set in stone.
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse Armed Svces Cmte Chair Smith worried that Trump's plan to take $ from military for wall will harm military readiness. Pts out military just got big spending hike in March. Asks why Trump wants to take that away. Worries about military accidents
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse Homeland Security Cmte Chairman Bennie Thompson writes to DHS Sec Nielsen requesting her to testify: "Your border security presentation..is yet another example of the misinformation & outright lies the..Administration has used to make the case for the..boondoggle border wall"
author: ChadPergram

text: The biggest pitfall for a freshman Member of Congress? Becoming an incumbent.
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse Armed Svcs Cmte chair Adam Smith: Trump values the construction of his wall over military readiness and support for our troops and their families. Diverting money from these military construction accounts could have substantial impacts for servicemembers
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi on WH mtg: How do you define progress in a meeting?  When you have a better understanding of each other's position?  When you eliminate some possibilities?  If that's a judgment, we made some progress.
author: ChadPergram

text: Schumer on what he said to Trump: I pointed out to him..I got in my office this morning.  A fire dispatcher from upstate New York, his wife is pregnant, signed a mortgage, can't get the F.A.A., the F.H.A. to approve it now because the government is closed.
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi after WH mtg: We agree that we will continue our conversations but we all recognize, on the Democratic side, that we really can’t resolve this until we open up government and we made that very clear to the President.
author: ChadPergram

text: Fox confirms that the Vice President’s office has invited Congressional leadership staff to meet with the Vice President at 11 am Saturday at the White House to discuss ending the government shutdown
author: ChadPergram

text: Senate to swear-in Sen.-elect Rick Scott (R-FL) at 4 pm et Tuesday
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem official familiar w/WH mtg. Says Pence floated idea of staff talking thru wknd on shutdown. Pelosi/Schumer urged Trump to commit to re-opening by Tues. Trump refused. Official say "working group" was not discussed in the mtg
author: ChadPergram

text: Leahy: The real national emergency is the President’s senseless and costly shutdown. There is no national emergency on the southern border...We need comprehensive immigration reform to address the complex issues at our southern border, not military assets.
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump says he can declare a "national emergency” to build border wall. Trump still needs approval by chairs/ranking mbrs of Hse/Senate Apps Cmtes to move around already appropriated money. Constitution gives Congress power of purse. Use only dictated by Congress
author: ChadPergram

text: From colleague Caroline McKee. When he returned to the Capitol, McCarthy described the latest WH mtg as more productive than the previous one. Said there were now parameters for what Pelosi defines as border security
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump on shutdown: I think it's going to be over sooner than people think.
author: ChadPergram

text: GOP KY Sen Kennedy on Tlaib: I don’t know the Congresswoman, but her comments were inappropriate. I prefer to think she was over caffeinated and just made a mistake. If I’m wrong and she has this much hate in her heart, I feel sorry for her.
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump on Tlaib: I thought her comments were disgraceful...I think she dishonored herself and dishonored her family....Using language like that in front of her son...I thought it was highly disrespectful to the United States of America.
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump says Pelosi told him "we're not looking to impeach you."
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump on Tlaib & impeachment: You can't impeach somebody who's doing a great job
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump says it doesn't matter who is blamed for the shutdown, be it him, Schumer or Pelosi. "It's just words."
author: ChadPergram
