text:
Pelosi on the deal to limit the terms on House leaders to three terms:
That’s a long time

Pelosi on the deal to limit the terms on House leaders to three terms:
I feel very comfortable about what they’re proposing
author: ChadPergram

text:
Pelosi on what the committees should probe in January regarding the President:
The committees will have to make a judgment as to where to go
author: ChadPergram

text:
Pelosi on President Trump:
I know he doesn’t like government. I know he doesn’t know a lot about government. 

Pelosi on a possible shutdown:
Let’s not talk about what might happen. 

Pelosi on a shutdown: 
The only obstacle is the President of the United States
author: ChadPergram

text:
Pelosi on if the first thing Democrats have to do is re-open the government in January:
We would just have to do it. It’s the imperative..that’s a very bad thing to do to our country

Pelosi on President Trump:
Does he want to have government closed forever?
author: ChadPergram

text:
Pelosi on talking to Trump since the Oval Office Mtg Tuesday:
No. I haven’t spoken to him since the other day

Pelosi:
We might be more likely to have a CR for all 7 

Pelosi on if there is behind-the-scenes negotiating:
We are not in any negotiations
author: ChadPergram

text:
Pelosi on President Trump and a shutdown:
Perhaps he doesn’t understand, people need their paychecks. Perhaps that’s not the life he leads

Pelosi on the House GOPers passing a bill to fund the wall:
They do not have the votes to pass the President’s proposal
author: ChadPergram

text:
Pelosi on government shutdown:
I don’t even know if it’s possible to have an omnibus..It’s unfortunate that the President would decide he would shut down government..at a holiday season..that’s a drastic thing for him to do..It would be shut down for a while

text: Defense hawks scored a big jump in Pentagon spending in omnibus spending bill in March. Defense hawks may take a dim view of moving some of that fought-after money from the Pentagon & using it for another purpose, such as wall construction
author: ChadPergram

text: On moving wall money from 1 appropriations bill to another: OMB would have to make request. Chairs/rankers of Hse/Senate Armed Services, Homeland Security & Appropriations Committees would to agree to the transfer
author: ChadPergram

text: On wall money, Ryan said they could “get into the conversation about reprogramming” money for the wall. But "reprogramming" lies within individual appropriations bill. Taking money from defense & moving it to DHS is a "transfer." Such a transfer must be ok'd by Congress
author: ChadPergram

text: Wall money would fall under the DHS Apps Bill, which Congress hasn’t approved yet. Trump already signed into law 2 bills dictating how the military spends it money. the Defense Apps Bill and the Military Construction Apps Bill. You can't go back after the fact
author: ChadPergram

text: Under the Constitution, Congress controls the purse, not the executive. Article I, Section 9 states “No Money shall be drawn from the Treasury, but in Consequence of Appropriations made by Law.” The admin can't just take $ Congress targeted for 1 purpose & use it for another
author: ChadPergram

text: President Trump suggested in tweets a few days ago that if Congress fails to approve money for his border wall, he would simply shift money around and have the military build the wall. Such a "transfer" as it's called in Congressional parlance is almost impossible.
author: ChadPergram

text: House syncs up with Senate, approving final version of the farm bill 369-47

text: Nothing is set in stone. But multiple Senate sources tell Fox it’s possible the Senate will take a procedural vote Wednesday to start debate on the non-binding resolution drafted by Sens Sanders/Lee calling for the U.S. to stop supporting the civil war in Yemen, via Saudi Arabia.
author: ChadPergram

text: From colleague Caroline McKee. Dem NY Rep Jeffries on criminal justice bill prospectively moving through the Senate: Nothing is ever easy in terms of systematic change..We're thankful for the efforts that have been put in place by.
author: ChadPergram

text: Do House GOPers have the votes to build the border wall & avert a government shutdown?
author: ChadPergram

text: Senate hoping to work out deal to call up Yemen/Saudi Arabia resolution. But nothing formalized yet.
author: ChadPergram

text: Ind VT Sen Sanders: Tomorrow, I will move to proceed to S.J. Res. 54, the resolution I have offered with Senators Lee and Murphy to end U.S. involvement in the disastrous Saudi-led war in Yemen.
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem TX Rep Gonzalez says a lot of lawmakers are "overly optimistic that they can go home for Christmas." But adds from the spectacle we saw at the White House), we don’t know.
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem TX Rep Gonzalez on Trump/Pelosi/Schumer mtg: Getting to the Oval Office with cameras is not the setting for having a candid conversations..it is hard to negotiate with cameras in front of you. it draws people into their own corners, it keeps the world divided.
author: ChadPergram

text: Chief Deputy Whip McHenry says they whipped the tax bill today…and says that the vote tally “looked good.”
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse GOP Chief Deputy Whip McHenry says “we can pass it” when asked about potential standalone $5 billion bill for the border wall
author: ChadPergram

text: Multiple mbrs from both parties tell Fox they are more resigned now to being in Washington the week between Christmas and New Year’s. One lawmaker said they were working on  getting caregivers for elderly loved ones in case they were stuck in DC
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump tweet: Thanks to Leader McConnell for agreeing to bring a Senate vote on Criminal Justice this week! These historic changes will make communities SAFER and SAVE tremendous taxpayers dollars. It brings much needed hope to many families during the Holiday Season.
author: ChadPergram

text: Flake: The age old thing is for one one party to the blame the other for a shutdown. It’s not our fault, it’s them. When the president says this is mine. I’ll take the mantle than I think the Democrats left that meeting pretty happy.
author: ChadPergram

text: Flake on shutdown possibility: I think we all concede we’re further away than we were maybe before the meeting so we’ll see..
author: ChadPergram

text: Senate approves final version of farm bill, 87-13
author: ChadPergram

text: Flake on Trump/Pelosi/Schumer mtg: I don’t think it ever helps to have discussions like this in the public. They went to negotiate, it’s definitely tough to negotiate with the cameras there.
author: ChadPergram

text: Senate now voting on final version of the farm bill
author: ChadPergram

text: From a political standpoint, a GOP strategy to pass $5b in wall funding on their own in the Hse rebukes Pelosi who said they didn't have the votes & shows that Trump was right when he said he had the votes. That would put pressure on Schumer to get Dems to overcome a filibuster
author: ChadPergram

text: The key to the Hse passing a $5b wall funding bill could hinge on how many mbrs show up. 433 mbrs now in the Hse. Only 375-390 mbrs have been showing up for many roll call votes since midterm elections
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse GOP sources indicate they are thinking about putting a $5b border wall bill on the flr & confident it could pass. However, they have not done so yet. But such a move & vote would be a show of support for Trump
author: ChadPergram

text:
Schumer on Trump’s performance:
What you saw, is why they lost in November

Schumer:
They let in the press and the President went on a ten or 15 minute diatribe
author: ChadPergram

text:
Sen. Patrick Leahy to Dem on the Appropriations Cmte:
I’ve been here for 44 years..eight presidents. This is the only time I’ve seen a President say they want a government shutdown..this is irresponsible 

Leahy:
If you saw it on a comedy show, you’d say this goes over the top
author: ChadPergram

text:
Schumer on what the Democratic leaders told Trump:
If you shut down the government, Leader Pelosi will pass a clean CR in January
author: ChadPergram

text:
Schumer:
We gave the President two options to keep the government open...You heard the President. He wants a shutdown...no President should ever say that he would be glad to have a government shutdown
author: ChadPergram

text:
McConnell on criminal justice reform:
Sen. Cotton and others are entitled to their amendments. I’m going to make sure they have their amendments
author: ChadPergram

text:
McConnell on the prospects of a shutdown:
I hope that’s not where we end up. I know it was a spirited discussion..I would still like to see a smooth ending
author: ChadPergram

text:
Sen. Roy Blunt (R-MO) on linking DACA to wall funding:
Now all of a sudden all of these issues can’t be associated..this is not that hard.
author: ChadPergram

text: McConnell on averting a shutdown. & finishing the criminal justice reform bill: “Magical things happen at Christmas"
author: ChadPergram

text: Senate to vote at 3:45 pm et to proceed to final version of the farm bill
author: ChadPergram

text:
Senate Majority Whip John Cornyn (R-TX):
I hope that everyone wants to get home for Christmas as badly as I do
author: ChadPergram

text:
McConnell:
Shoehorning criminal justice reform complicates things..

McConnell:
With maximum cooperation, magic things happen at Christmas
author: ChadPergram

text: GOP LA Sen Kennedy on Trump/shutdown: I think he’s going to do it. I’ve always believed it. I’ve believed it for some time. I’m prepared to be here for Christmas. The president feels very strongly about the need for a wall and I think he’s prepared to do it.
author: ChadPergram

text: Top Dem on Senate Apps Cmte Leahy on Trump: He seems far more interested in having a Trump shutdown. I don’t know what he think he gains by having a Trump shutdown.
author: ChadPergram

text: Blumenthal: I’m just completely befuddled and mystified by what the President’s end game here. What is his goal? If he wants to showdown the government, I think the American people are going to be very unforgiving..this kind of horror show really is inexplicable.
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi/Schumer: We gave the president two options that would keep the government open.  It’s his choice to accept one of those options or shut the government down.
author: ChadPergram

text: WH: The Democrat Party has made clear they would rather keep the border open than the government open..Democrats are fighting to protect illegal immigrants.  This Administration will always put Americans first.
author: ChadPergram

text: WH on Dem ldrs mtg: We will continue to pursue real solutions to defend our nation and uphold our laws – and hope Democrats will work with us in a bipartisan fashion to do so.  A nation without borders is no nation at all
author: ChadPergram

text: WH: President Trump had a constructive dialogue with Democrat Leaders Chuck Schumer & Nancy Pelosi. The President and the Democrat Ldrs agreed to support the passage of historic Criminal Justice Reform..Major disagreement remains on the issue of border security and transparency
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi on Trump mtg: We left it in a very good place. We gave him 2 possibilities (CR possibilities to avoid a shutdown with interim spending bills)
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi on mtg w/Trump: How many time did he mention the word wall? However obsessive is with the wall, is it worth shutting down the government? The economy has uncertainty
author: ChadPergram

text: PelosiI don’t think its productive to have the President misrepresent the facts. He took full responsibility for the shutdown over the wall. That was important for the American public to hear
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi on mtg w/Trump: Usually we stipulate to a set of facts before proceed to making a judgment. That’s what wasn’t happening with the president
author: ChadPergram

text: Pence at the Capitol now. Briefing Senate GOPers at lunch about mtg over gov’t funding with Pelosi/Schumer
author: ChadPergram

text:
Graham on border wall fight/shutdown:
I want to be the party that delivers...if this is what it takes, so be it
author: ChadPergram

text: Graham on Trump/border wall: “This is a fight we’re going to have. He needs to dig in..this liberal arrogance, take it on. Stare it down.”
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi back at the Capitol. Says they left things “in a pretty good place” with CR propsoals with administration. Does not think the meeting is indicative of how things will be with this administration in the future. Says the “wall” is “all he could talk about”
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi on mtg w/Trump & border wall: I didn't want to in front of those people, say 'We don't know what you're talking about'
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi says if Trump "does not accept that hand of friendship, we will still be who we are."
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi: I told the President as I told him over and over again, this new Congress will be different from the Congress we have now
author: ChadPergram

text: Schumer after Trump mtg on border security: We offered the President a way to avoid a shutdown (A CR for all spending bills, a CR for DHS spending bill & 6 regular spending bills)
author: ChadPergram

text: A skirmish with Trump helps Pelosi flex her muscles and bona fides to liberals who are skeptical of her..and moderate Democrats who think it’s time for her to go. Tangling with the President is good politics for Pelosi..as she still lacks the votes to become Speaker.
author: ChadPergram

text: House Republicans lack the votes on their own to pass a bill with or without a border wall. They need Democratic assistance in either scenario. Pelosi is right that Republicans control the House…but they need Democratic votes.
author: ChadPergram

text: After the exchanges between Trump, Pelosi & Schumer, they all appear to be on a collision course toward a partial government shutdown on December 22
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump: I am proud to shut down the government over border security..and I'm going to shut it down for border security.
author: ChadPergram

text:
Schumer: We don't want to shut down the government over a political dispute..
Trump to Schumer:: The last time, you shut it down
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump: Nancy is in a situation right now where it's not easy for her to talk right now.. Pelosi: Please don't characterize the strength that I bring to this meeting
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump to Pelosi/Schumer: If we got $5 billion, we could do a tremendous chunk of wall..this is a national emergency
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump to Pelosi and Schumer: If we don't have border security, we're going to shut down the government
author: ChadPergram

text: Schumer "When the President brags that he won North Dakota and Indiana, he's in real trouble" This unfolds as Dem ND Sen Heitkamp is on the flr, delivering her farewell address after losing
author: ChadPergram

text: Schumer says the border wall is "wasteful and doesn't solve the problem." Trump: "It totally solves the problem"
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi: Let's call a halt to this. We come in here at the first branch of government. Article 1. Trump: We're going to keep it open if we have border security. Schumer: Let's debate in private
author: ChadPergram

text:
Schumer to Trump: You say my way or you will shut down the government..
Trump: And if it's not good border security, I'm not going to take it
author: ChadPergram

text: Schumer: We have a disagreement about the wall..we do not want to shutdown the government..you have called 20 times to shutdown the government.
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump tells Pelosi that he "has the votes in the House." Keeps saying the issue is the Senate. He needs 60 votes in the Senate. But so far there are not the votes on the GOP side of the aisle in the House to pass a border wall.
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi to Trump: There are no votes, majority votes, for a wall.
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump tells Pelosi he would have the wall approved "in two seconds" if he had the votes in the Senate
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi: We must keep government open (Says GOP should have votes in the House to pass the wall). There are equities to be weighed
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump on meeting with Schumer/Pelosi: We may not have an agreement today and we probably won't
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump: If you want to find out how effective a wall is, just ask Israel.
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump says he'll also talk about the farm bill & criminal justice reform bill with Pelosi and Schumer
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump says he's going to talk about the wall with Pelosi/Schumer. Says it's "a tough issue..because we're on opposite sides" of that. Reiterates that the wall "will get built."
author: ChadPergram

text: Schumer/Pelosi now at WH to meet w/Trump on border wall.
author: ChadPergram

text:
Hoyer on if the unresolved question of if Pelosi has the votes to Speaker is affecting the border wall debate:
I don’t think so in this sense...I don’t think Nancy’s leadership position has affected the border wall
author: ChadPergram

text:
Hoyer:
We want to make it very, very clear. We are for border security
author: ChadPergram

text:
Hoyer on if anything resolved in a meeting with term limits:
Nothing
author: ChadPergram

text:
Hoyer on Pelosi potentially negotiating a plan for term limits for House leaders:
She is not negotiating for me

Has Pelosi kept him aprised of her conversations?
No

text: Nadler: I must first dispense with a completely illegitimate issue, which is the fantasy, dreamed up by some conservatives, that Google and other online platforms have an anti-conservative bias.

text:
Hoyer on if he supports term limits for House leaders:
No

text:
Hoyer on Republicans trying to portray the Democrats as week on border security:
It was the major message the campaign
It was a political show..and the public rejected that argument..I think the public rejected the hysteria

Hoyer on if Democrats will revisit earmarks in the new Congress:
I hope so

We have agreement on six of those bills..we ought not to undermine the six bills where we have agreement

Hoyer on the GOP demanding Democrats to fund a border wall:
They need to pass it with their votes alone..or reach a compromise to pass it

Hoyer on criminal justice reform likely coming up in the Senate soon:
I presume it will pass and we would be able to approve it next week..with the adding of the sentencing reform, it will be a complete package

Hopefully we can break this impasse

The House has passed two good down payments on the wall..it takes 60 votes in the Senate

The idea that the incoming majority doesn’t care about border security is preposterous 

Ryan on Schumer/Pelosi meeting with Trump today:
I want to see what comes of this meeting

text: nder the Constitution, spending authority resides with the legislstive branch, not the executive. If Congress hasn’t allocated money for this express puprose (such as a wall), the executive branch just can’t move money around to make something happen.
author: ChadPergram

text: Congress has already approved and the President has signed into law both the defense appropriations and military construction appropriations bills for fiscal year 2019. Neither measure included money designed for building a wall
author: ChadPergram

text:
This may be the last time to secure money for a border wall. with Republicans controlling the White House, the House and the Senate.
The government is funded through
11:59:59 pm et December 21.
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi says she won’t agree to border money in exchange for a DACA fix. Remember that the President cut a deal with Pelosi and Schumer, not House Speaker Paul Ryan (R-WI) and Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell (R-KY) in September, 2017 to avert a shutdown.
author: ChadPergram

text: Senate Democats seem amenable to some wall money. But this path is perilous for Pelosi..as she tries to nail down the final votes necessary to become Spkr. A shutdown which bleeds into the new year is the worst possible scenario for Pelosi as Dems try to launch their agenda
author: ChadPergram

text: The vote mixin the Hse is jumbled House Republicans this summer defeated legislation twice to fully fund the border wall. Hse GOPers lack the votes on their side to pass a bill w/border funding…or legislation w/o wall money. That means they must lean on Democrats for help.
author: ChadPergram

text:
Seven of the 12 outstanding spending bills remain incomplete. The most prominent is the measure funding the Department of Homeland Security. That’s where the border wall is the flashpoint. 
Democratic votes in both the House and Senate are the lynchpin to averting a shutdown.
author: ChadPergram

text: House Minority Leader Nancy Pelosi (D-CA) and Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer (D-NY) head to the White House today to talk to President Trump about averting a government shutdown.
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump tweet: People do not yet realize how much of the Wall, including really effective renovation, has already been built. If the Democrats do not give us the votes to secure our Country, the Military will build the remaining sections of the Wall. They know how important it is!
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump tweet: I look forward to my meeting with Chuck Schumer & Nancy Pelosi. In 2006, Democrats voted for a Wall, and they were right to do so. Today, they no longer want Border Security. They will fight it at all cost, and Nancy must get votes for Speaker...
author: ChadPergram

text: Dems votes are needed to avoid a partial gov’t shutdown later this month over the border wall
author: ChadPergram

This is our last chance to address illegal immigration before Democrats take over the House. Republicans in Congress must fulfill our promise to the American people by building President Trump’s wall, ending catch and release & securing our borders

text: Schumer/Pelosi on Trump mtg Tues about gov't funding: This holiday season, the president knows full well that his wall proposal does not have the votes to pass the House and Senate, and should not be an obstacle to a bipartisan agreement.
author: ChadPergram

text: Schumer/Pelosi on mtg w/Trump Tues: Republicans still control the House, the Senate, and the White House, and they have the power to keep government open. Our country cannot afford a Trump Shutdown,  especially at this time of economic uncertainty.
author: ChadPergram

text: GOP AZ Rep Biggs: Mark Meadows is a proven conservative leader in Congress. Under his watch, the House Freedom Caucus has become one of the most-influential caucuses in the House. He would make an exceptional Chief of Staff for President Donald Trump.
author: ChadPergram

text: Meadows on Fox: My life changed over the last 24 hours when Nick Ayers decided not to do it and there was a story out there that I was on a list..since Nick Ayers has stepped down, I have not had a conversation with the president about this potential.
author: ChadPergram

text: Meadows won't completely dismiss reports he could be in the running to be WH Chief of Staff: Making comments...too many people draw assumptions, he's interested and not interested, and he’s going to be excited and he’s going to be disappointed.
author: ChadPergram

text:
Meadows on if he’s pouring cold water on reports he could be in the mix:
It’s fair to say that I haven’t been commenting on any of those reports 

Meadows:
I’ve had a lot of colleagues suggest I should do this. But I don’t know about private conversations
author: ChadPergram

text:
Meadows on possibly becoming WH CoS:
Any time you answer a question without hearing the proposal, would be foolish..I’m looking forward to having conversations with the President, if he so chooses.
author: ChadPergram

text:
Meadows on possibly becoming WH CoS: 
The last time I had contact with the White House it was with the understanding Nick Ayers was going to be taking the job…I think the President is evaluating a number of options…
author: ChadPergram

text:
Meadows on possibly becoming WH CoS:
The President has a lot of good candidates and he’ll make the right decision for his administration
author: ChadPergram

text: Meadows says he has “read the reports” and “honored to be considered" to be WH Chief of Staff. But says he has “one job” right now, and that is to represent “Western North Carolina.” He says he’s not “out campaigning for the job.”
author: ChadPergram

text: GOP NC Rep Mark Meadows on possibility of becoming WH Chief of Staff: "I've had no conversations in the past 48 hours with the White House." Says he has not discussed this since Nick Ayers dropped out of the running. Says he's "flattered" to be considered.
author: ChadPergram

text: Leahy: We know the President likes to stir up drama, but a government shutdown is not the backdrop for one of his reality TV shows..If the government shuts down on December 22nd, an estimated 380,000 Federal employees will be furloughed without pay just days before Christmas
author: ChadPergram

text: Leahy: There is only one thing standing between fully funding our government and a shutdown:  President Trump.  For months now, he has repeatedly called for a government shutdown unless we provide $5 billion dollars for his boondoggle border wall.
author: ChadPergram

text: Top Dem on Senate Apps Cmte Leahy: There is absolutely no reason for the government to shut down.  The Senate and House Appropriations Committees have been negotiating for weeks on a seven-bill minibus that would fully fund the..gov’t..we are very close to a deal.
author: ChadPergram

text: Big question on CapHill is if Freedom Caucus ldr Mark Meadows could become Trump Chief of Staff. Meadows is skilled in CapHill combat & fighting for conservative principles. Could be key factor in border wall fight
author: ChadPergram

text: USCP rpt they arrested 138 people in connection with unlawful demonstrations in the House Buildings. Most were demonstrating about climate change.

text: You can always tell when they’re about to start a new Congress. The House corridors are littered with furniture as dozens upon dozens of offices are moving
author: ChadPergram

text: USCP says there was a small attic fire in Russell Senate Office Blg Saturday night which was quickly extinguished. Sprinklers activated. However, multiple sources say there is substantial water damage to some Senate offices

text: Trump tweet: On 245 occasions, former FBI Director James Comey told House investigators he didn’t know, didn’t recall, or couldn’t remember things when asked. Opened investigations on 4 Americans (not 2) - didn’t know who signed off and didn’t know Christopher Steele. All lies!
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump tweet: Leakin’ James Comey must have set a record for who lied the most to Congress in one day. His Friday testimony was so untruthful! This whole deal is a Rigged Fraud headed up by dishonest people who would do anything so that I could not become President...
author: ChadPergram

text: Ryan: John Kelly is a patriot. Service to America is part of his DNA & our country is better for his duty at the WH. During this time he has become a dear friend & trusted partner. He was a force for order, clarity, and good sense. He is departing what is often a thankless job
author: ChadPergram

text: Many conservatives aren’t satisfied with the Comey/2016 investigation. GOP FL Rep Matt Gaetz says the way the committees handled this reminded him of quote…”the death rattle of Republican oversight.”
author: ChadPergram

text: Comey appears before the Hse committees again on December 17th. Also, former Attorney General Loretta Lynch is due within a few days for an interview.
author: ChadPergram

text: Comey told Hse mbrs said that he felt that President Trump asked him to halt the probe during their February, 2017 meeting. Comey says that’s why he wrote his memo. In addition, Comey says that President Obama did not ask him to investigate the Trump campaign.
author: ChadPergram

text: Comey said yesterday in the hall..and behind closed doors that he had confidence in the FISA process..and the warrant to surveil Carter Page. But when asked who would sign off on the investigation of a major political campaign, he didn’t know.
author: ChadPergram

text: Lots o fcriticism directed at fmr FBI Agent Peter Strzok & whether he had anti Trump bias. Comey told Hse Strzok helped write the Oct 28th '16 memo about Clinton. Clinton campaign says that's why they lost the election. Comey says it’s hard to believe that Strzok sided w/Clinton
author: ChadPergram

text: At different points in the Hse interview, Comey defended Special Counsel Robert Mueller. He said he admires Mueller. Said he would “bet his life” that Mueller would do things the right way. Comey says he doesn’t even have Mueller’s phone number and they aren’t friends.
author: ChadPergram

text: he most significant part of the Comey transcript. Comey said the FBI quote..”opened investigations on four Americans to see if there was any connection between those four Americans the Russian interference effort. Those four Americans did NOT include the candidate.”
author: ChadPergram

text: On 245 occasions, fmf FBI Director James Comey told Hse investigators either he didn’t know, didn’t recall or couldn’t remember things when asked. At the end of the session, Comey said they rehashed Hillary Clinton’s emails. But there was not a lot of that in the transcript
author: ChadPergram

text: Comey: We opened investigations on four Americans to see if there was any connection between those four Americans and the Russian interference effort. And those four Americans did not include the candidate.
author: ChadPergram

text:
Dem FL Rep Deutch: Did President Obama or anyone in his administration ever make a demand or a request the FBI or DOJ infiltrate or surveil the Trump campaign? 
Comey. No, not to my knowledge.
author: ChadPergram

text: Nadler on Gaetz saying he wasn't bound by deal w/Comey. "Perhaps be asked to leave at this point, as should anybody else who tells us upfront they will not feel bound by what this committee has represented to the witnesses."
author: ChadPergram

text: At Comey i-view, GOP FL Rep Gaetz says he was "not a party" to the agreement forged by the Hse & Comey. Said "I don't consider myself bound by it." Gowdy said he'd comply with the deal. Says "It is manifestly unfair to take part of what someone says and disregard the whole"
author: ChadPergram

text: Nadler asks if Comey is friends w/Mueller: Comey. I am not. I admire the heck out of the man, but I don't know his phone number, I've never been to his house, I don't know his children's names. I think I had a meal once alone with him in a restaurant. I like him.
author: ChadPergram

text: Some factoids from the Comey interview. Comey said he "didn't remember" 71 times. "Didn't know" 166 times. "I don't recall" 8 times. Also, not a lot of discussion about Clinton's emails as Comey suggested in the hallway yesterday. Comey to return for a 2nd session on Dec 17
author: ChadPergram

text: In Hse interview, Comey goes to bat for Strzok: Peter Strzok helped draft my letter to Congress on Oct 28th that Hillary Clinton blames for her defeat. So it's hard for me to see how he was on Team Clinton secretly at that point in time..
author: ChadPergram

text: The Comey transcript is 235 pages. 23 mbrs present: Goodlatte Issa KingNY Gohmert Jordan Buck Ratcliffe Gaetz Biggs Nadler JacksonLee Cohen Deutch Bass Gowdy Sanford Cooper Krishnamoorthi Gomez Plaskett
author: ChadPergram

text: On the decision by fmr AG Sessions to recuse himself, Comey told Hse investigators he thought it was "an obvious recusal."
author: ChadPergram

text: After Trump meeting, Comey sayd he felt Trump was "directing me" to drop a criminal investigation "which I thought was improper." Says that's why he wrote the memo so the FBI could decide what to do about the perceived request.
author: ChadPergram

text: Rep Ratcliffe asks Comey in Hse interview if Comey made up his mind about prosecuting/not prosecuting Hillary Clinton before the FBI interview.
author: ChadPergram

text: In Hse interview, Comey applauds the Mueller probe. Says Mueller has "an all-star team" working for him. Says he "would bet my life that Bob Mueller will do things the right way."
author: ChadPergram

text: Gowdy asked Comey who had the authority at the FBI to investigate a major political campaign and if it would be approved by Comey. Comey replied he "never encountered a circumstance" where an investigation was launched into a big political campaign.
author: ChadPergram

text: Comey interview to Hse Cmtes indicates FBI looked at possible ties to Trump campaign & Russia and if there were efforts to interfere in the election. Comey told Hse mbrs Trump was not one of those investigated. Says Obama did not order him to probe Trump campaign
author: ChadPergram

text: Comey transcript from yesterday's session with House Oversight/Judiciary Cmtes now up: https://oversight.house.gov/wp-content/uploads/2018/12/Comey-interview-transcript-12-7-18_Redacted-1.pdf …
author: ChadPergram

text: Comey left yesterday’s House transcribed interview around 4:30 pm et. Agreement was to release the transcript 24 hrs later
author: ChadPergram

text: Nadler/Cummings: Comey confirmed that in July 2016, the FBI opened a counterintelligence investigation into four Americans who were associated w/..Trump or his campaign, to determine whether there was a connection between them & the Russian efforts to undermine the 2016 elections
author: ChadPergram

text: Nadler/Cummings: Director Comey said that he would “bet his life” on the integrity of Special Counsel Robert Mueller’s investigation—but that he and Mueller are not “best friends” as President Trump has stated.
author: ChadPergram

text: Cummings/Nadler: Director Comey said that he had no concerns then, and has no concerns now, about the lawfulness of Carter Page’s FISA application.
author: ChadPergram

text: Nadler/Cummings: Director Comey stated that President Trump’s attacks on the Department of Justice and the Special Counsel are corrosive and damaging, make the FBI’s job harder, make Americans less safe, and undermine national security.
author: ChadPergram

text: Nadler/Cummings say “Director Comey’s statements today about Hillary Clinton were consistent with his previous public comments and Congressional testimony. There were no new material facts produced.”
author: ChadPergram

text: Nadler/Cummings: As the Special Counsel’s investigation appears to be closing in on (Trump) & his associates..GOP colleagues seem intent on spending their final days in pwr attempting to provide cover to..Trump & attempting to re-litigate the..decision not to prosecute..Clinton
author: ChadPergram

text: Nadler/Cummings: Director Comey’s testimony today offered us nothing new from his previous testimony on these same matters.  We see no reason why our Republican counterparts turned what could have been a one-day public hearing into a two-day closed-door interview.
author: ChadPergram

text: Waiting for the Nightmare Before Christmas in Congress
author: ChadPergram

text: Judiciary/Oversight Cmtes are slated to release transcript of the Comey interview in the next 24 hrs
author: ChadPergram

text: Feinstein on Cohen/Manafort: These legal documents outline serious and criminal wrongdoing, including felony violations..at the direction of President Trump, false statements to Congress about communications with Russian government officials in the pursuit of Trump Tower Moscow
author: ChadPergram

text: Sometimes it’s hard to track exactly how many children run through the hallways of the Capitol after most of the workers head home on a Friday night. There appear to be at least two
author: ChadPergram

text: After hours on a Friday night, one can sometimes find children sprinting through the halls of the US Capitol
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump tweet: Hopefully Mitch McConnell will ask for a VOTE on Criminal Justice Reform. It is extremely popular and has strong bipartisan support. It will also help a lot of people, save taxpayer dollars, and keep our communities safe. Go for it Mitch!
author: ChadPergram

text: Comey on if lawmakers adhered to the terms under which he agreed to appear: I saw somebody tweeting out a secret picture from inside there. But what are you going to do?
author: ChadPergram

text: Comey: I hav total confidence that the FISA process was followed and the entire case was handled in a thoughtful & responsbile way by DoJ & FBI. I think the notion that FISA was abused here is nonsense
author: ChadPergram

text: Comey: I think the President’s attacks on the DoJ broadly and the FBI are something that no matter what political party youre in you should find deeply troubling, and continue to speak out about, and not become numb to the rule of law
author: ChadPergram

text: Comey: The FBI for understandable reasons doesnt want me to talk about the details of the investigation that is still ongoing..but that’s a very teeny part of what we talked about
author: ChadPergram

text: Comey on if he was directed to not answer mbrs questions by DoJ: When you read the transcripts then I think you will not see that happening
author: ChadPergram

text: Comey: I’m not sure we need to do this at all but I’m trying to respect the institution to answer questions in a respectful way. You’ll see I did that in the transcript. You’ll see that if you get transcript of my return visit. I think week after next and then this will be over.
author: ChadPergram

text: Comey after mtg w/Judiciary Cmte: We could have done this in open setting & when you read the transcript you’ll see we're talking again about Hillary Clinton's e-mails for heaven sakes
author: ChadPergram

text: Comey re-asserts that he wishes Judiciary Cmte interview had been done in open session.
author: ChadPergram

text: GOP FL Rep Gaetz on Comey returning for 2nd i-view later this month: Thus all strikes me as a bizzare timeline. We’ve had 42 names from Devin Nunes for 5 months and were just now getting to James Comey sort of seems like the death rattle of Republican oversight.
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump tweet: It is being reported that Leakin' James Comey was told by Department of Justice attorneys not to answer the most important questions. Total bias and corruption at the highest levels of previous Administration. Force him to answer the questions under oath!
author: ChadPergram

text: Comey leaves closed door interview with Judiciary Cmte. Says most terms of agreement were upheld. Expected to return on Dec 17
author: ChadPergram

text: Comey indicates he’ll come back on Dec 17 before Judiciary Cmte for more questions
author: ChadPergram

text: GOP FL Rep Gaetz says there will be a second session with Comey.
author: ChadPergram

text: Gowdy leaves Comey mtg. He says they still questions for Comey. Would like a 2nd session. Unclear if there is time in this Congress
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump tweet: Mike Pompeo is doing a great job, I am very proud of him. His predecessor, Rex Tillerson, didn’t have the mental capacity needed. He was dumb as a rock and I couldn’t get rid of him fast enough. He was lazy as hell. Now it is a whole new ballgame...
author: ChadPergram

text: OH/MI Hse Dems to Trump: Respectfully, we invite you to join us to visit the Lordstown Assembly, Warren Transmission, Brownstown Battery, Baltimore Operations and Detroit-Hamtramck plants, to meet the workers who will soon receive pink slips.
author: ChadPergram

text: Feinstein on AG pick: Barr must commit to supporting..Mueller’s investigation and allowing him to follow the facts. He must also commit to resisting political pressure placed on the Justice Department.
author: ChadPergram

text: Feinstein: There’s no question..Barr is an experienced lawyer, having previously served as AG. However, there are concerns about his independence given his expansive views of executive power and partisan statements about pardons, the Mueller investigation and Hillary Clinton
author: ChadPergram

text: Schume on AG pick: It has been many years since Mr. Barr served in government, and the Senate will need to fulfill its constitutional obligation to carefully review and consider both his record in the Reagan and Bush administrations, as well as his record in the private sector.
author: ChadPergram

text: Schumer on AG pick: Barr must commit – at a minimum – under oath before the Senate to two important things..that the Special Counsel’s investigation will proceed unimpeded, and second, that the Special Counsel’s final report will be made available to Congress and the public
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem Rep Krishnamoorthi on Comey interview: I've attended almost every single one of these. it's the same questions. over and over again. we get the same answers from almost all the witnesses. And again, i'm left with the impression that we got nowhere today.
author: ChadPergram

text: Grassley on nomination of Wm Barr to be AG: His compelling credentials and experience, serving at the highest levels in both government—including as a former AG under President George H.W. Bush—and in the private sector, make him more than well-qualified to lead the DoJ again
author: ChadPergram

text: Incoming Judiciary Cmte chair Nadler on the probe of Comey. Asked if he will end it once he becomes chair: Yes...because it's a waste of time to start with. The entire purpose of this investigation is to cast aspersion on the real investigation which is Mueller.
author: ChadPergram

text: Nadler on Comey appearance: It should have been in public, but at least they're going to release the (transcript) because a number of the previous interviews have been in confidence, but portions have been leaked
author: ChadPergram

text: Issa: Comey is in there with two attorneys. One that's from the DoJ has repeatedly, I would say at his gleeful acceptance, instructed that he will not be answering a great many questions that are clearly items at core of our investigation
author: ChadPergram

text: Madows: I think the holdup is twofold in why Rod Rosenstein has not come in. One is certainly with Rod Rosenstein & DoJ, but the other is quite frankly our side not being persistent & tenacious enough to get that done.I believe that we've got to do that before the end of the yr
author: ChadPergram

text: Meadows: Comey has suggested that there are multiple leaks on Capitol Hill and I find that is very hypocritical when we know with certainty in his own admission that he was leaking information with the sole purpose of placing a narrative in the public domain.
author: ChadPergram

text: Colleague Catherine Herridge rpts some mbrs in the Comey interview are growing frustrated. GOP CA Rep Issa says there's a DoJ atty w/Comey telling him not to answer certain questions. Says they may ask Comey to come back
author: ChadPergram

text: Colleague Catherine Herridge rpts GOP NC Rep Meadows says the Comey transcribed interview has a hard stop at 4:15 pm et today
author: ChadPergram

text: Graham: President Trump made an outstanding decision in nominating William Barr to serve as the next Attorney General. I will do everything in my power to push him through the Senate Judiciary Cmte and onto the floor of the Senate for eventual confirmation as soon as possible
author: ChadPergram

text: Ryan: President Trump has made an excellent selection by nominating Heather Nauert to be UN ambassador..Janna & I have known and respected Heather for many years, and we look forward to all that she will accomplish at the UN as an advocate for freedom, liberty, and human rights
author: ChadPergram

text: A break from the “arena” on Capitol Hill
author: ChadPergram

text: Comey now inside Judiciary Cmte suite for closed door interview, slated to start at 10 am et
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse Judiciary Cmte is interested in Comey’s handling of the case involving Hillary Clinton and classified information. Comey announced in July, 2016 that Clinton wouldn’t be charged. However, he said she was “extremely careless” with classified material.
author: ChadPergram

text: Unclear how long the Judiciary Cmte session w/Comey may last. One source suggested it may drag into the evening. The key is how many lawmakers are present and how long they take with their questions. The House is out of session today.
author: ChadPergram

text: Expect the Hse Judiciary Cmte to release a transcript of the Comey interview, perhaps as early as Saturday. Comey was concerned that GOPers may pick and choose what portions of the interview they wish to leak.
author: ChadPergram

text: We expect Comey to arrive shortly before the 10 am et Judiciary Cmte mtg here on Capitol Hill. Comey initially fought the Commitee’s subpoena to appear in court. He finally forged an agreement to appear. Comey will publicly speak at some point today.
author: ChadPergram

text: Former FBI Dir James Comey to speak to House Judiciary Cmte behind closed doors today for transcribed interview
author: ChadPergram

text: The nightmare before Christmas
author: ChadPergram

text: Speaker Ryan at lighting of the Congressional Christmas tree: A season dedicated to wonder and faith. We take our joy at the birth of a savior, heralded by angels, and we spread that joy to those in our lives. We could all use a little more of that.
author: ChadPergram

text: Schumer: If President Trump wants to throw a temper tantrum and shut down the government over Christmas over the wall, that’s his decision
author: ChadPergram

text: In addition to non-binding Saudi Arabia/Yemen resolution, there is  a piece of actual legislation (with teeth) which would impose sanctions against Saudi Arabia and prohibit arms sales. There is also a bipartisan resolution to condemn MBS for the killing of Khashoggi.
author: ChadPergram

text: Corker believes Senate will vote to start debate on non-binding Yemen/Saudi Arabia resolution next wk. Suggests there will be a vote on a "point of order" to limit amdts to "germane" issues related to the resolution. That would avoid potential legislative mischief on other topics
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem MA Sen Warren on DNA test, tax returns & possible 2020 run: I've put out 10 years of tax returns, my hiring records and DNA tests all out there on the internet for anybody to see..I believe that it's important to be transparent.  I think that's how public officials should be
author: ChadPergram

text: Senate Apps Cmte Chair Shelby on a 2-wk punt on the government spending fight: "It's where we were last week."
author: ChadPergram

text:
Top Democrat on Judiciary Committee Feinstein about the potential nomination of William Barr to be Attorney General.

Feinstein:
I don’t really know him…I don’t have an opinion on him.
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi on mtg w/USTR Lighthizer & new trade proposal: As I reiterated to USTR Lighthizer, while there are positive things in this proposed trade agreement, it is just a list without real enforcement of the labor and environmental protections.
author: ChadPergram

text: From colleague Jason Donner. Senate Apps Cmte Chair Shelby on Pelosi's idea for a CR on Homeland Security $: We’d look at anything but I believe the best route is to keep on seven together, pass them..We made a lot of progress on 75 percent of the appropriations.
author: ChadPergram

text: Senate syncs up with House & ok’s interim spending bill to avert partial government shutdown Saturday morning. The Senate okayed the package via unanimous consent, without a roll call vote. The bill now goes to President Trump to sign.
author: ChadPergram

text: House now considering stopgap spending bill to avoid a partial government shutdown this weekend Re-ups all money for the seven remaining spending bills at the current levels through December 21 at 11:59:59 pm et. No objection. Measure now goes to the Senate
author: ChadPergram

text: Feinstein on Khashoggi: If we don’t hold the crown prince responsible, it will set a horrible precedent. This action must be met with the strongest condemnation by our president. I urge him to review all available intelligence, including the audio tape, and forcefully respond.
author: ChadPergram

text: If the Hse GOP brass accepts a compromise short of full wall funding, expect the Freedom Caucus to be upset. Conservatives ould try to drive a wedge among Republicans and argue some aren’t fighting hard enough for the President’s priorities. Pelosi won't accept any bill w/wall $
author: ChadPergram

text: Fox is told quite a few House Republicans have no intention of coming back for further votes. That could be a problem to pass a bill about the border wall. Some Republicans would like a shutdown to hamstring Democrats as they seize control of the House next year.
author: ChadPergram

text: It is generally believed that Hse GOPers lack the votes on their side to pass a bill with OR without the $5 billion in wall funding. Remember, the House this summer TWICE rejected bills which funded the wall. Democrats won’t help with this.
author: ChadPergram

text: On avoiding a partial government shutdown before Dec 21. Border wall funding is a flashpoint. Any plan needs 60 votes to overcome a Senate filibuster. That means there must be Democratic buy-in and “give” by Republicans. But there are issues in the House, too.
author: ChadPergram

text:
Expect the House to approve the interim spending bill just after noon et.
The Senate is trying to get clearance to approve the same package at some point today once the paperwork comes from the Hse. Unclear if someone may object or throw a monkey wrench into the gears.
author: ChadPergram

text: From colleague Caroline McKee. Sen Chris Murphy (D-CT) says the election was “a referendum on gun violence." Mentions Rep-elect Lucy McBath (D-GA) known as a gun violence prevention advocate. Murphy says “we won with gun violence champions.”
author: ChadPergram

text:
Pelosi on GOPers complaining about “ranked voting” which helped unseat Rep. Bruce Poliquin (R-ME):
If they had won, they would have no problem with the Constitutionality with that
author: ChadPergram

text:
Pelosi on the outstanding North Carolina House race if if House would seat a prospective, declared winner:
The House still retains the rights to decide who is seated..any member elect can object to the seating. And then we can see how that goes
author: ChadPergram

text:
Pelosi on who she expects to brief next week on Saudi Arabia:
I am hoping we would have the Director of the CIA
author: ChadPergram

text:
Pelosi on the length of a potential DHS CR:
Full year. There is no point in doing that. There is too much uncertainty on that
author: ChadPergram

text:
Pelosi on how they should go forward to fund the government:
I think it makes sense to pass the six bills where there is agreement..And then have a CR on Homeland Security
author: ChadPergram

text:
Pelosi on if she would accept some wall funding in exchance for a DACA fix:
No...they’re two different subjects 

Pelosi on forging a deal to avoid a shutdown:
We have before us all of the factors to make a decision.
author: ChadPergram

text:
Pelosi on a possible government shutdown:
The appropriations bill is the door opener or door closer...
author: ChadPergram

text:
Pelosi:
The farm bill...that looks good..I hope maybe that can be passed next week
author: ChadPergram

text:
Pelosi on Bush41:
He was a sweetheart
author: ChadPergram

text:
Pelosi:
We will pass common sense gun violence prevention legislation soon and it will be bipartisan
author: ChadPergram

text: From colleague Jason Donner. GOP LA Sen John Kennedy on border wall funding: “I don’t think he’s [Trump] kidding. I think he’s prepared to shut the government down.”
author: ChadPergram

text: Durbin: I said it months ago and I will say it again: we should formally expel the Saudi Ambassador to the United States given the Crown Prince’s direct involvement in the kidnapping and murder of Jamal Khashoggi.  And we should call on our allies to do the same
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi/Schumer to meet with Trump on government spending at the White House on December 11 at 11:30 am et
author: ChadPergram

text: GM CEO Mary Barra on Capitol Hill again today for mtgs with lawmakers after announced plant closures
author: ChadPergram

text: Senate hrng today on Zimbabwe after its elections.
author: ChadPergram

text: Capitol Christmas tree lighting ceremony is night. It is a noble fir from the Willamette National Forest in Oregon. Brigette Harrington, fourth-grade student from Hillsboro, Oregon, will assist Speaker Ryan with lighting the tree.
author: ChadPergram

text: House expected to approve 2-wk interim spending bill today to avoid a partial wknd shutdown. Expect the Senate to follow suit later today
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem OH Rep Tim Ryan on mtg w/GM CEO Barra: I conveyed that to Mary Barra today and once more insisted that GM do everything it can to place a new product at the Lordstown plant. These are not just numbers on a page, but people’s lives at stake.
author: ChadPergram

text: Sens Graham, Fesintein, Rubio, Markey, Young & Coons introduce resolution holding Crown Prince of Saudi Arabia Mohammed bin Salman accountable for "the abhorrent and unjustified killing of journalist Jamal Khashoggi."
author: ChadPergram

text: Graham on Trump's push for border wall $: "If I were the president I would stick with it. And I've always thought more wall funding is necessary and we've got to do something with the DACA recipients. And maybe he marry those two up, he could end the year on a high note."
author: ChadPergram

text: Graham on Trump/border wall: I think his demand for more wall funding is reasonable. We need to secure our border. The caravans should be a wakeup call for everybody. If you don't get your border and better spot we'll all regret it. So we've got two more weeks to negotiate.
author: ChadPergram

text: Flake on him holding up judicial nominees over Mueller protection bill. Has he spoken to McConnell: He knows where I am on this and I know that some have been involved in discussions to try to bring it to a vote. I hope we can. I really do.
author: ChadPergram

text: From colleague Jason Donner. Flake on Judiciary Cmte again postponing action on nominees due to his protest over Mueller protection bill: "We can solve this this easily. Let's just have a vote. Just have a vote. You can vote against it. Vote for it but it deserves a vote."
author: ChadPergram

text: After mtg w/GM CEO Barra, Dem OH Sen Brown says Brown closure o the Lordstown, OH plant brings "an uncertainty of jobs in that 3 county area..are they going to bring in another vehicle? They can do that"
author: ChadPergram

text: Portman after mtg w/GM CEO Barra. Says he spoke w/Trump "a he’s committed to keeping this plant in Ohio...we're not asking for charity."
author: ChadPergram

text: GM CEO Barra after mtg w/OH Sens Brown/Portman. Is asked about the gov't assistance they got a decade ago. "We are forever grateful for govt assistance to GM and we will continue to provide jobs and that’s the best thing we can do for the US"
author: ChadPergram

text: From colleague Kelly Phares. GM CEO Barra Barra after mtg w/OH Sens Brown/Portman. Says they are "working on a plan" to help the workers of the Lordstown plant "and help some o them transfer." Says they "respect the contract" GM has at Lordstown
author: ChadPergram

text: Senate Judiciary Cmte against cancels scheduled mtg where mbrs vote judicial nominees out of cmte. Cmte is 11-10 GOP. Flake says he won't advance judicial nominees until he gets a vote on his bill to protect Mueller. This is the 2nd wk the cmte has canceled such a session
author: ChadPergram

text: Colleague Amanda Pressman rpts GM CEO Mary Barra to meet with Ohio Hse mbrs on Capitol Hill later this afternoon after announcement about closure of Lordstown, OH plant.
author: ChadPergram

text: OH Sens Brown, Portman meeting w/GM CEO Barra this afternoon about closure of Lordstown, OH plant
author: ChadPergram

text: Motorcade carrying the casket of President George HW Bush departs the Capitol, heading to the National Cathedral
author: ChadPergram

text: Honor Guard now carrying the casket of President George HW Bush down the Capitol steps and to the hearse, bound for the National Cathedral
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem OH Sen Brown & GOP OH Sen Portman to meet this pm on CapHill with GM CEO Mary Barra
author: ChadPergram

text: Bush family now heading to the Capitol to accompany the casket of President George HW Bush to the National Cathedral for his funeral
author: ChadPergram

text: The “Third Law” of Congress
author: ChadPergram

text: No House action today. However the Senate will take one procedural vote late this afternoon
author: ChadPergram

text: The remains of President George HW Bush will be transported to the National Cathedral today for his funeral. His casket has lain in state since late Monday afternoon
author: ChadPergram

text: McConnell escorted Cindy McCain, the widow of Sen John McCain who lay in state earlier this year, into the Rotunda to pay her respects to President George HW Bush
author: ChadPergram

text:
A number of sports luminaries came to the Capitol to pay their respects to Bush 41, led by CBS’s Jim Nantz. Others were Fred Couples, Ben Crenshaw, Chris Evert, Hale Irwin Mike Krzyzewski, Tony LaRussa, Davis Love III, Peyton Manning, 
Phil Mickelson, Jack Nicklaus...
author: ChadPergram

text: GOP TX Sens Cornyn/Cruz introduce resolution to honor the late President George HW Bush https://www.cornyn.senate.gov/sites/default/files/GeorgeHWBushResolution.pdf …
author: ChadPergram

text: Schumer: While I will not discuss the content of the Haspel briefing, it reinforced the need for a strong response to the murder of Jamal Khashoggi. CIA Director Haspel should brief the full Senate without delay.
author: ChadPergram

text: Graham: As to Pompeo and Mattis, I have great respect for them. I imagine if they were Democrats in a Democratic admin I will be all over them for being in the pocket of Saudi Arabia. But since I have such respect for them I'm going to assume that they're being good soldiers
author: ChadPergram

text: Graham after Saudi Arabia briefing: If John McCain were still alive i believe he would be standing with me today leading the charge to come down like a ton of bricks on the Crown Prince for what he’s done to the relationship, the way he’s destabilized the region.
author: ChadPergram

text:
Grassley schedules hrng for Dec 11: “Oversight of U.S. Customs and Border Protection.” Witness will be 
Customs & Protection Commissioner 
Kevin McAllenan
author: ChadPergram

text: Corker on legislation to address Saudi Arabia/Khashoggi: I would like to actually pass something that became law. Others would like just to send a message. So you take all of those together, it would be much better if the commander in chief would stand up.
author: ChadPergram

text: Corker after Haspel mtg on Khashoggi: I have zero question in my mind that Crown Prince MBS ordered the killing, monitored the killing, knew exactly what was happening, planned it in advance. If he was in front of a jury, he would be convicted in 30 minutes guilty.
author: ChadPergram

text: Graham after Haspel mtg on Khashoggi: You have to be willfully blind not to come to the conclusion that this was orchestrated and organized by people under the command of MBS...It is zero chance..that this happened in such an organized fashion without the crown prince
author: ChadPergram

text: Fmr GOP KS Sen Bob Dole visits Bush41 lying in state in the Capitol Rotunda. Both were WWII vets. Dole lost to Bush41 in the ‘88 GOP presidential primaries & was not tapped as Bush’s running mate. But Dole was GOP Senate Ldr during Bush41’s presidency
author: ChadPergram

text: Colleague Lucas Tomlinson rpts Trump mtg w/Armed Svcs Cmte Chairs Inhofe/Thornberry. They want $733b in defense. But Trump has called for a cut of 5% down to $700B. Military funded thru Sept 30, 2019.
author: ChadPergram

text: House-wife briefing on Saudi Arabia and Yemen slated for Dec. 13 at 9 am et. Expecting Mattis & Pompeo. But all details not sorted out yet
author: ChadPergram

text:
The new interim spending bill would fund the remaining seven government spending bills through 11:59:59 pm et on December 21. 
The Senate expected to follow suit, likely on Thursday, according to a senior source.
author: ChadPergram

text: Fox has learned that the House is expected to approve stopgap, 2 week spending bill to avoid a partial shutdown by unanimous consent on Thursday. That avoids a government shutdown on December 8.
author: ChadPergram

text: NRCC: NRCC can confirm that it was the victim of a cyber intrusion by an unknown entity. The cybersecurity of the Cmte’s data is paramount, and upon learning of the intrusion, the NRCC immediately launched an internal investigation and notified the FBI, which is now investigating
author: ChadPergram

text: Collesgue Jason Donner rpts CIA Dir Haspel now conducting closed door briefing for key senators, including McConnell & Schumer. Lots of questions now about Saudi Arabia & Khashoggi
author: ChadPergram

text:
Trump tweet: Could somebody please explain to the Dems (we need their votes) that our Country losses 250 Billion Dollars a year on illegal immigration..Top Border Security, including a Wall, is $25 Billion. Pays for itself in two
 months..Get it done!
author: ChadPergram

text: Colleague Caroline McKee rpts President George HW Bush’s service dog Sully is in the Capitol Rotunda as the fmr President lies in state
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse Judiciary Cmte reschedules its hrng w/Google CEO to Dec 11 at 10 am. Wednesday hrng was canceled due to the state funeral tomorrow for President George HW Bush. There are questions about potential anti-conservative bias at Google with its social media platforms.
author: ChadPergram

text: CIA Dir Gina Haspel now in Capitol Rotunda paying respects to President Bush41 who also served as CIA Director. Haspel to brief senators later this morning behind closed doors. Lots of questions about the death of Khashoggi
author: ChadPergram

text: CIA Dir Gina Haspel to talk to senators behind closed doors this morning. Many senators were upset last week that Haspel wasn’t present to brief on Saudi Arabia and the death of Jamal Khashoggi
author: ChadPergram

text: The remains of President George HW Bush lay in state throughout the night. Rotunda open to the public for people to pay their respects
author: ChadPergram

text: The history of Presidents lying in state in the Capitol Rotunda
author: ChadPergram

text: As President George HW Bush lies in state in the Capitol, politics goes by the wayside. Sort of..
author: ChadPergram

text: After President Trump departs, the Capitol Rotunda re-opens to the public to file past the casket of President George HW Bush
author: ChadPergram

text: President Trump and the First Lady in the Rotunda to pay their respects to President George HW Bush. Stood by the casket for about a minute. Mr. Trump then saluted the 41st President and departed
author: ChadPergram

text:
President Trump is coming momentarily to the Capitol Rotunda to pay his respects to President George HW Bush, who is lying in state. 

They cleared the Capitol Rotunda of the public just before the President arrived.
author: ChadPergram

text: Capitol Rotunda now open for the public to file past the casket of President George HW Bush & pay their respects. Will open around the clock until Wednesday morning.
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump message to Congress about Bush41: Fearless, courageous, adventurous, and unyielding, through the highs and lows of the twentieth century and into the next millennium, President Bush served his Nation, creating an example that will inspire generations for decades to come.
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump message to Congress: President George HW Bush led a life that exemplified what is truly great about America. As with so many of his generation, the Greatest Generation, President Bush worked selflessly..to bring about a world of justice and lasting peace
author: ChadPergram

text: President George HW Bush is the 12th President to lie in state in the Capitol Rotunda. Among the recent ones: LBJ in '73. Reagan in '04. Ford in '06-'07. Sens Inouye & McCain lay in state. Pres Nixon did not. Family mbrs didn't think the public would be respectful of Nixon.
author: ChadPergram

text: Capitol Rotunda will open to the public around 7:30 pm et for the public to pay their respects to President George HW Bush, lying in state in the Capitol Rotunda.
author: ChadPergram

text: Fox is told by a senior Congressional source that lawmakers are increasingly resigned to working up until Christmas to resolve the outstanding issues, including the fight over the border wall.
author: ChadPergram

text:
Senate Apps Cmte Chair Shelby on if something could be resolved quickly to avoid a shutdown:
If we can get an agreement on some numbers, you can turn on a time.

What is plausible for both sides to give?:
That is a good question.
author: ChadPergram

text: Senate Appropriations Cmte Chair Shelby on a possible 2-week, stopgap spending bill: “It means we haven’t resolved anything. We’re still at an impasse. Will (the delay) bring us together? Or push us apart?"
author: ChadPergram

text:
Top Dem on Senate Apps Cmte Patrick Leahy on a potential 2-wk stopgap spending bill: I wish we could have finished this week…I’d be willing to stay this week and over the weekend to get this done. 

Leahy: 
The President gave his solemn word that Mexico would pay for the wall.
author: ChadPergram

text:
GOP WY Rep Cheney on a potential 2-wk stopgap spending bill:
There is a fundamental problem on the Democratic side…everything that Leader Pelosi does is based on her getting the votes to become Speaker.
author: ChadPergram

text:
Incoming Hse GOP Conf Chair Liz Cheney (R-WY), the nbr 3-ranking GOPer in the Hse on potential a 2-wk stopgap spending bill: We have to make sure we have $ for the border wall. We’ll see how long it takes Cheney on if wedging the deadline up against Christmas would help:
It may
author: ChadPergram

text: CIA Dir Haspel to brief senators from multiple committees tomorrow at 11:30 am et. There was controversy last wk when senators from both parties wanted Haspel to brief them on Khashoggi. DefSec Mattis & SecState Pompeo did so instead.
author: ChadPergram

text: Ryan on Bush41 lying in state: "This Rotunda is a trumpet call to glory."
author: ChadPergram

text: Ryan notes that Bush's 1988 campaign was the "first one I was involved in." Says he went to a "big rally at Miami of Ohio" (where Ryan was a freshman in the fall of 1988) the day after the 1st debate. Bush campaigned that fall outside Harrison Hall on the Miami campus
author: ChadPergram

text: Senate Sgt at Arms Michael Stenger(left) & Hse Sgt at Arms Paul Irving (right) prepare to escort President George W Bush & wife Laura into the Capitol Rotunda.
author: ChadPergram

text: VP Cheney & fmr SeState Colin Powell followed the fmr President’s casket into the Capitol, followed by President George W!Bush & wife Laura. Also there were Andy Card, who served as Transportation Sec under Bush41 and Sen. Lamar Alexander (R-TN), who was Education Sec under 41.
author: ChadPergram

text: Honor guard marches the casket of Preeident George HW Bush into the Capitol to lie in state in the Rotunda
author: ChadPergram

text: Flag-draped casket of President Bush41 arrives at the Capitol
author: ChadPergram

text: Casket carrying the remains of Bush41 escorted into the Capitol and up the East Front steps
author: ChadPergram

text: Hail to the chief played on the Capitol plaza for President George HW Bush
author: ChadPergram

text: Honor guard carrying casket of President George HW Bush from the hearse to the Capitol Rotunda

text: Bush family arrives to pay respects to President George HW Bush in the Capitol Rotunda

author: ChadPergram

text: Awaiting the arrival of the remains of fmr President George HW Bush to lie in state in the Capitol Rotunda
author: ChadPergram

text: Senators now filing from the Senate chamber into the Capitol Rotunda for Bush41 to lie in state
author: ChadPergram

text:
Cornyn in if the Senate may let the resolution to move to the Yemen resolution fail:
That would be an option
author: ChadPergram

text:
Cornyn on if the Senate would call up the  Yemen resolutoon for debate:
I think they’re trying to figure that out..I think it’s confused right now..I think there is bipartisan skepticism about getting into an unlimited vote-a-rama
author: ChadPergram

text:
Cornyn on former Senate Majority Leader Harry Reid (D-NV) having the Senare meet on Christmas Eve Day in 2009 to approve the first version of Obamacare, as Congress may stare at a Dec 21 gov’t funding deadline:
What a grinch!
author: ChadPergram

text:
Cornyn on what the House may send the Senate on government funding:
I saw they are going to send over a two-week CR..I don’t know why we’d want a two week CR to go up to December 21. We know what needs to be done..
author: ChadPergram

text: Pence talks w/GOP NC Sen Richard Burr as he heads to the Rotunda for Bush41 to lie in state
author: ChadPergram

text: Members of the Supreme Court just filed past the Senate chamber, en route to the Rotunda for Bush41 to in lie in state. Pence coming by now
author: ChadPergram

text: Program for Bush41 to lie in state in the Capitol Rotunda
author: ChadPergram

text: Senators will gather in Senate Chamber around 4:15 pm er and file over to the Rotunda for the service. Among those spotted here, former Sens. Luther Strange (R-AL), George Allen (R-VA) and Blanche Lincoln (D-AR).
author: ChadPergram

text: Next Senate roll call vote will be at 4 pm et Wednesday. A procedural vote to end debate on nomination of Bernard McNamee to be member of the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission
author: ChadPergram

text:
Dem OH Sen Brown & GOP OH Sen Portman will meet w/GM 
CEO Mary Barra on Wednesday at Portman's office after shutdown of Lordstown, OH plant
author: ChadPergram

text: McConnell now paying tribute to President George HW Bush on the Senate floor. Says Bush41 was the "greatest generation, distilled into a single lifetime."
author: ChadPergram

text: Senators coming to the Capitol Rotunda for the arrival of President George HW Bush's body expected to gather on the Senate floor sometime after 4:15 pm et
author: ChadPergram

text: Senate Chapain Barry Black: We praise you for the life and legacy of a statesman George Herbert Walker Bush
author: ChadPergram

text: The NYSE & NASDAQ will close on Wednesday to honor President George HW Bush
author: ChadPergram

text: Fox is told that the scheduled meeting with Trump, Pelosi & Schumer at the WH tomorrow about gov't funding has been postponed as President George HW Bush lies in state in the Capitol Rotunda
author: ChadPergram

text: Fox has learned that Pelosi/Schumer are asking that a scheduled meeting at the White House tomorrow w/Trump about government funding be postponed a week due to events surrounding President George HW Bush’s funeral and the former President lying in state in the Capitol Rotunda
author: ChadPergram

text: The lighting of the Capitol Christmas tree, scheduled for Wednesday, will now take place on Thursday night due to President George HW Bush lying in state in the Capitol Rotunda
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem CT Sen Blumenthal wants Donald Trump Jr to re-appear before Judiciary Cmte. "Lying to Congress is a federal crime. It is critical..that we determine if the individuals who have come before us deliberately omit or misstate material facts that pertain to our investigation"
author: ChadPergram

text: Closed-door deposition with former FBI Director James Comey will be at 10 et Friday with the House Judiciary Committee. A closed-door deposition with former Attorney General Loretta Lynch will come “later this month.”
author: ChadPergram

text: The scene in one of the Capitol’s underground tunnels after they take all of the benches out of the Rotunda for President George HW Bush to lie in state
author: ChadPergram

text: No votes in the House this week. Likely to approve by unanimous consent a 2 week, stopgap spending plan by unanimous consent. Dems prefer one week. But willing to go along with 2 weeks. New funding deadline would be 11:59:59 pm Dec 21.
author: ChadPergram

text: GOP LA Sen John Kennedy: I love being in the United States Senate. I will not be a candidate for Governor in 2019.
author: ChadPergram

text: Colleague Mike Emanuel confirms former Canadian Prime Minister Brian Mulroney, fmr Senate GOP Whip Alan Simpson and presidential historian Jon Meacham will deliver eulogues for George HW Bush at the National Cathedral.
author: ChadPergram

text: USCP: The USCP is continuing to investigate a Suspicious Vehicle at New Jersey Avenue and C Street NW. Staff and other personnel are directed to AVOID THIS AREA until further notice.
author: ChadPergram

text: A lot of people aren’t sure what to call the new trade deal with Mexico and Canada
author: ChadPergram

text: Manchin scheduled to meet w/Trump at the WH today
author: ChadPergram

text: The Capitol Rotunda opens to the public tonight for people to file past the casket of President George HW Bush lying in state. Will remain open thoughout the night & into Wednesday morning.
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse Chaplain Pat Conroy will deliver the invocation at the ceremony honoring Bush41 at the Capitol late today. Remarks by McConnell, Ryan, Pence. Senatw Chaplain Barry Black delivers the benediction
author: ChadPergram

text: The casket bearing President Bush41 comes to the Capitol late today to lie in state. VP Quayle & the Cabinet follow the casket in behind the honory pallbearers
author: ChadPergram

text: Goodlatte on Fox: If I were a Democrat I'd be concerned about some of the actions taken by..Comey..FBI leading right up to the election announcing a reopening of the investigation into Hillary Clinton's email & then announcing again immediately after that it was being shut down
author: ChadPergram

text: Goodlatte: Mr. Comey will join us for a closed-door transcribed interview later this week. We will release the transcript of his interview to the public as soon as possible after the interview, in the name of our combined desire for transparency.
author: ChadPergram

text: Goodlatte: was disappointed that Mr. Comey filed a motion to quash the subpoena sent to him to appear for our investigation...Mr. Comey chose to file a motion to litigation in an attempt to run out the clock on this Congress, and I am glad that it was withdrawn.
author: ChadPergram

text: Comey withdraws motion to quash the House subpoena for a private deposition. His counsel says Comey lawyers "reached an acceptable accommodation with U.S. House of Representatives Committee on the Judiciary for voluntary testimony."
author: ChadPergram

text: With Bush41 lying in state in the Rotunda & Wednesdsy declared a national day of mourning, the Carols in the Capitol Christmas Concert, scheduled for Statuary Hall at the Capitol Wednesday, has been moved to the Museum of the Bible Wednesday night
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump on the possibility of a 2 wk, stopgap spending bill to avoid a partial shutdown on Dec 8: "If they [lawmakers] come, which they have, to talk about an extension because of President Bush's passing, I would absolutely consider it and probably give it."
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump: I’ll be terminating it within a relatively short period of time. We get rid of NAFTA. It's been a disaster for the United States...That'll be terminated so Congresswill have a choice of the USMCA or pre-NAFTA, which worked very well.
author: ChadPergram

text: Senate now changing flr schedule for the wk flr Bush41 to lie in state in Capitol Rotunda. No votes in the Senate now until Wednesday
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse will now meet Monday to prep resolutions for Bush41 to lie in state in Capitol Rotunda. House will now not be in session on Tuesday, December 4.
author: ChadPergram

text: Capitol will be open round the clock from Monday evening through Wednesday morning for the public to file through the Rotunda and pay respects to President George W Bush as he lies in state.
author: ChadPergram

text: George HW Bush to lie in state in Capitol Rotunda Monday evening through Wednesday morning. A bicameral arrival ceremony Monday, at 5:00 pm et. The public is invited to pay their respects from Monday, December 3, at 7:30 pm ET until Wednesday, December 5, at 7:00 am ET.
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi’s path to the Speakership
author: ChadPergram

text: George HW Bush ran unsuccessfully for Senate twice. Defeated by Dem TX Sen Ralph Yarborough in ‘64. Then to fmr Dem TX Sen Lloyd Bentsen, who famously tangled w/Bush’s VP nominee Quayle in the ‘88 VP debate. Bush served 2 terms in US Hse, elected in big GOP midterm pickup of ‘66
author: ChadPergram

text: Ryan: President Bush best demonstrated the qualities he once described as ‘those little touches of grace and affection and humor that make life sing.’ His life was a hymn of honor. It was in the people’s House where he began his time in public office.
author: ChadPergram

text: Ryan: George H.W. Bush was a man for all seasons. He was great in his impact, making the world safer and freer. He was great in his character, leading with decency and integrity. A war hero and statesman, the country is inspired by his example.
author: ChadPergram

text: Tradition for former Presidents to lie in State in the Capitol Rotunda
author: ChadPergram

text: This is subject to change. But Fox is told President George HW Bush could come to the Capitol to lie in state as early as Monday night. Would likely lie in state through Wednesday
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi: President Bush profoundly believed in the power of ordinary Americans to make a difference.  His belief in a ‘kinder, gentler’ America encouraged people to embrace the spirit of service and encouraged them to share his vision of ‘a thousand points of light.’
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi: In the Congress, my colleagues and I knew President Bush as a gentleman of the highest integrity and deepest patriotism.  It was a privilege to work with him and witness his firm commitment to ensuring America lived up to our Founders’ promise of hope and freedom.
author: ChadPergram

text: Schumer: President George H.W. Bush will be greatly missed in many ways. He was a fine man and even when he opposed your views, you knew he was doing what he thought was best for America. His yearning for a kinder and gentler nation seems more needed now
author: ChadPergram

text: Flags at the US Capitol now flying at half staff to honor the late President George HW Bush
author: ChadPergram

text: As is standard with former Presidents, Fox is told that the Capitol would be open 24/7 for people to file past the casket to pay their respects as President George HW Bush lies in state next week in the Rotunda
author: ChadPergram

text: When someone lies in state, the Capitol Rotunda is usually permitted to file past the casket after formal and family ceremonies. Presidents usually lie in state for a couple of days.
author: ChadPergram
