text: When someone lies in state in the Capitol Rotunda, the casket is placed in the center of the room on the catafalque (KATT-uh-falk), the wooden platform used for Lincoln’s funeral on 1865. The casket is draped with an American flag. An honor guard stands vigil around the clock.
author: ChadPergram

text:
Rev. Billy Graham did not lie in state earlier this year. He lied in honor, one step down from lying in state. The ceremony looks very similar though. 
President Richard Nixon did not lie in state in 1994. His family thought visitors to the Capitol might not be respectful.
author: ChadPergram

text: The last President to lie in state was President Gerald Ford in late 2006-early 2007. President Reagan lied in state in 2004. However, the last two persons to lie in state were not presidents. Sen. Daniel Inouye (D-HI) in 2012 and Sen. John McCain (R-AZ) this year.
author: ChadPergram

text: It is customary for former Presidents to lie in state in the US Capitol to honor their passing. Fox is told we expect to followe standard protocol for President George HW Bush
author: ChadPergram

text: McConnell: George Bush built his life on the premise that loving and serving America was simply a citizen’s duty. He fulfilled that duty time and time again, as completely as anyone could. His legacy will rank among the most distinguished statesmen our nation has ever produced.
author: ChadPergram

text: McConnell on Bush 41: He kept America safe as CIA Director. He represented us with skill as Ambassador to the United Nations, envoy to China & Vice President. And as our forty-first president, George Bush brought clear-eyed, principled leadership to a nation & world in transition
author: ChadPergram

text: Colleague Mike Emanuel rpts Pelosi & Schumer to meet w/Trump Tuesday at 11:30 am et. They need to work out a deal to avoid a partial gov’t shutdown before Dec 7 at 11:59:59 pm et
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi: Democrats know that immigrants, with their courage, optimism and determination to make the future better for their families, make America more American.  We will continue to work every day to ensure the American Dream remains in reach for everyone.
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi: We will hold the Trump Administration accountable for their inhuman policy of separating families, and the trauma and anguish they have inflicted on vulnerable children and families at our border.
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi: Our House Democratic Majority will once again pass the Dream Act to end the uncertainty and fear inflicted on patriotic young men and women across the country.  We will protect TPS recipients and those fleeing unimaginable violence.
author: ChadPergram

text: Newton’s Third Law of Motion says for every action, there is a reaction. It works the same way on Capitol Hill
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi on trade deal: Fixing NAFTA means increasing the paychecks of American workers, delivering real, enforceable labor standards, ensuring fairness for American agriculture, and recognizing the connection between economic growth and environmental protections.
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi on trade deal: This agreement is still a work in progress. We are waiting to see enforcement provisions relating to workers and the environment.  Mexico must also pass and implement its promised labor law changes to raise the wages and working conditions of Mexican workers
author: ChadPergram

text: Letter from Dem CA Sens Feinstein/Harris & WA Dem Sens Murray/Cantwell to Trump Admin urging it to not block wineries from using the duty drawback program. It allows wineries to recoup duties, taxes and fees on imported wines after exporting domestically-produced wines
author: ChadPergram

text: Nadler/Cummings after talking to acting AG Whitaker: Whitaker committed to appear before the House Judiciary Committee in January at a mutually agreeable date, which we look forward to.
author: ChadPergram

text: Incoming Hse Oversight Cmte Chair Cummings: I congratulate Rep. Jordan on becoming Ranking Member, and I look forward to working with him in a bipartisan way..I am hopeful that we can work together to conduct responsible oversight
author: ChadPergram

text: GOP FL Gov & GOP FL Sen-elect Rick Scott suspends "Supervisor of Elections Brenda Snipes from office for misfeasance, incompetence and neglect of duty." Scott says "there needs to be an immediate change in Broward County"
author: ChadPergram

text: From colleague Catherine Herridge. Hse Judiciary Cmte source says “Comey was offered more favorable conditions than the other witnesses. We offered to release the transcript following his interview, since we share his dedication to transparency. “
author: ChadPergram

text: Colleague Jake Gibson rpts Federal Judge Trevor McFadden may make a ruling on Monday in former FBI Director James Comey’s effort to defy a Congressional subpoena. Hse atty Thomas Hungar says it would be, “extraordinary” for a federal court to interfere with a Congressional probe
author: ChadPergram

text: GOP AK Sen Sullivan on earthquake: “This was a big one..the damage is quite significant”
author: ChadPergram

text: GOP AK Rep Young, AK Sens Murkowski/Sullivan now discussing earthquake. Murkowski says it “will take a great deal of recovery”
author: ChadPergram

text: Colleague Jake Gibson rpts lawyers for fmr FBI Dir Comey want a federal judge to force Judiciary Cmte to hold an open hrng with him. Federal Judge to hear case on Monday & could make a ruling that day.
author: ChadPergram

text: From Dem AZ Rep Grijalva spokesman Adam Sarvana responding to accusatory, personal tweet directed at Grijalva by Interior Sec Zinke: “Rep. Grijalva does not work while drunk and does not create a hostile workplace environment.”
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem AZ Rep Grijalva responding to Sec Zinke tweet about his drinking habits: “The American people know who I’m here to serve, and they know in whose interests I’m acting. They don’t know the same about Secretary Zinke.”
author: ChadPergram

text: Colleague Caroline McKee rpts AK Congressional delegation now on the phone w/FEMA Admin Brock Long after today's earthquake
author: ChadPergram

text: AK Congressional delegation to receive briefing on earthquake from FEMA Admin Brock Long. Then holding presser. GOP AK Rep Don Young & GOP AK Sens Lisa Murkowski & Dan Sullivan
author: ChadPergram

text: Sen. Lisa Murkowski (R-AK) says the main roadways around Anchorage are damaged badly and cannot be repaired until spring. Eighty-five percent of all goods come into Alaska via Anchorage. Murkowski says this could be a problem if there are major transportation issues.
author: ChadPergram

text: Fox is told the FEMA Disaster Relief Fund (or “Durf”, as it’s said in Capitol Hill-speak), has about $30 billion. Fox is told that should be fine to cover the IMMEDIATE needs of the earthquake. But it will take a while to sort out what assistance may be needed later.
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump tweet: To the Great people of Alaska. You have been hit hard by a “big one.” Please follow the directions of the highly trained professionals who are there to help you. Your Federal Government will spare no expense. God Bless you ALL!
author: ChadPergram

text:
GOP AK Sen Murkowski on AK earthquake: 
This is a very, very, very hard wake up call for the population center there in Anchorage
author: ChadPergram

text: GOP AK Sen Murkowski calls earthquake a “a very serious, serious, serious tragedy in Alaska..the magnitude is really very troubling...It’s cold right now..the damage is really quite concerning
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse Apps Cmte Chair Frelinghuysen indicated last night the "requests have been pouring in" to help cover the damage of hurricanes and wildfires in an upcoming supplemental spending bill. Possible there could be requests for additional money now after the Alaska earthquake
author: ChadPergram

text: From Colleague Caroline McKee. Spox for GOP AK Sen Dan Sullivan says most buildings being evacuated after earthquake. Indicates this is the largest earthquake to hit Alaska since "The Great Alaskan Earthquake" in 1964.
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem OH Rep Kaptur on new NAFTA/new trade deal: This isn't the better deal and the combination of this deal as well as his tariffs and the way he has imposed them has cost these companies billions of more dollars to get the metals and components to put into their production.
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem OH Rep Kaptur on Trump's trade deal w/Mexico & Canada: I think that people are going to come to realize that it was just a lot of words..I think the president's negotiators really muffed up.
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem OH Rep Kaptur on trade pact: To sign..an agreement with the government of Mexico a couple of says before the new president is sworn in is rather curious. This will have to come before Congress of review. the trade authority starts here and not with the president.
author: ChadPergram

text: Some Members of Congress aren’t Members of Congress for very long
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi reiterates that there cannot be a government shutdown. On finding an agreement, she says “we have to.”
author: ChadPergram

text:
Pelosi on trying to get a deal with her opponents who want her to vacate her post:
Between when I will retire and not? I don’t think so…I don’t think we should put timelines on the Speaker.
author: ChadPergram

text:
Pep.-elect Chris Pappas (D-NH) on trade deal:
In my district we benefit from trade, particularly with Canada...The haphazard approach with tariffs is not the right approach
author: ChadPergram

text:
Rep.-elect Mike Levin (D-CA) on trade deal:
The President has taken our relationship with Canada and Mexico to the brink..a lot of this is for show
author: ChadPergram

text:
Rep.-elect Tom Malinowski (D-NJ) on probes Dems may launch next year: There’s a lot of discussion about legislating versus investigating..I think that’s a false choice

Pelosi:
The American ppl want us to address kitchen table issues..Oversight is a Congressional responsibility
author: ChadPergram

text: Rep.-elect Veronica Escobar (D-TX) on the investigations incoming House Dems think deserve attention: The separation of families on the border..and Puerto Rico
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi calls new trade agreement “The trade agreement formerly known as Prince..no, NAFTA.” Says it lacks worker and environmental protections
author: ChadPergram

text: Top Dem on Senate Intel Cmte Warner on Marriott’s data breach affecting up to 500 million guests:  Rather than accepting this trend as the new normal, this latest incident should strengthen Congress’ resolve. We must pass laws that require data minimization
author: ChadPergram

text:
Rep. John Sarbanes (D-MD) on reform legislation in the new Congress:
Don’t get tangled up in the money and the special interests
author: ChadPergram

text: House freshmen now finding out their office assignments for the new Congress, going through the office lottery
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem OH Rep Kaptur, one of the most ardent opponents of NAFTA, blasts Trump on trade. Says Administration “muffed” the new deal. Says it was “all talk”
author: ChadPergram

text: Kaptur on new trade deal: This Administration’s rush to sign something, creates more uncertainty for working people..President Trump’s campaign promises to working people and the reality of his NAFTA only reinforce this Administration’s standard: Say one thing, do another.
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem OH Rep Kaptur The same week General Motors announced the idling of five U.S. facilities and cutting 15,000 living wage jobs, including in Lordstown, Ohio..Trump has claimed premature victory as U.S., Canadian and Mexican officials signed a tentative replacement for NAFTA.
author: ChadPergram

text: Schumer on USMCA “For the new trade agreement to receive a majority support in Congress..t must prove to be a net benefit to middle-class families and working people in our country and must have strong labor and environmental protections, which in the present deal are too weak.
author: ChadPergram

text: Hatch on Mexico/Canada trade deal:  In the coming months, Congress will have the opportunity to debate the details of USMCA and consider how it will impact workers and job creators in this country. I encourage my colleagues to take the time to carefully review the agreement
author: ChadPergram

text: Office lottery today on CapHill for newly-elected House mbrs
author: ChadPergram

text:
Hse Apps Cmte Chair Frelinghuysen on how he felt about the state of play averting a gov't shutdown
I feel better about retiring

Frelinghuysen on resolving the issues: 
Things have a way of happening as we get closer to December 7
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse Apps Cmte Chair Frelinghuysen says there will be a supplemental spending bill to cover natural disasters like hurricanes & wildfires. The cost? "I don't know. The requests have been pouring in"
author: ChadPergram

text:
Hse Apps Cmte Chair Frelinghuysen on avoiding a shutdown:
I feel like things are gelling.
Frelinghuysen on if there is enough time to finish:
I don’t know. I have asked that question myself repeatedly.
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse Dems are insistent on rejecting a border wall. There seemed to be some limited opening for concessions by Senate Dems for some wall or "border security" money. But any deal to avert a partial shutdown requires 60 Senate votes. So there must be some give
author: ChadPergram

text: GOP TX Rep Kay Granger to serve as top GOPer on the Appropriations Cmte. Notably, the Democrats will make Rep. Nita Lowey (D-NY) the Chairwoman of the Appropriations Committee. Two women will lead one of the most-powerful committees in Congress.
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem CA Sens Feinstein/Harris request $9.054 billion to help CA recover from wildfires
author: ChadPergram

text: Schumer: Senator Tim Scott has done a courageous thing, and he’s done the right thing. Thomas Farr has been involved in the sordid practice of voter suppression for decades and never should have been nominated, let alone confirmed to the bench. Thankfully, he won’t be.
author: ChadPergram

text: Colleague Mike Emanuel rpts GOP SC Sen Tim Scott to oppose nomination of Thomas Farr to the federal bench. Scott's vote was essential to confirming Farr. This essentially torpedoes the nomination as the Senate lacks the votes for confirmation
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi on Cohen: The President’s personal lawyer just admitted to lying on behalf of the President about Trump’s financial ties to Russia. This..provides additional documented proof that..Trump’s inner circle has brazenly lied and covered up the truth to protect the President
author: ChadPergram

text: Schumer on gov’t funding: A bipartisan agreement remains on table and would gaij more than 60 votes..we can avoid shutdown with a CR for DHS, still provide for border security, this option would receive more than 60 votes in the Senate
author: ChadPergram

text: Senate Intel Cmte Chair Burr: Michael Cohen’s indictment and guilty plea is once again an example that you cannot lie to Congress without consequences. It should be no surprise that Mr. Cohen has had in his possession for months a letter requesting return visits to the Committee
author: ChadPergram

text: Corker says he expressed concerns about how the administration is grappling with Saudi Arabia/Khashoggi to Pence at the Capitol today. Pence was on CapHill to break a tie on a Senate vote. Corker declined to characterize what he told the Vice President nor relay Pence’s response
author: ChadPergram

text: Corker laments that Congress was having to wrestle with the Saudi Arabia/Yemen/Khashoggi resolution at all. “It’s much harder to do legislatively,” said Corker. “I’d much rather the administration figure out a way to handle this.”
author: ChadPergram

text: Corker notes  that the Yemen/Saudi Arabia resolution requires one more procedural vote before it hits the floor. Corker indicated the resolution would likely come up next Tuesday.
author: ChadPergram

text:
Corker trying to develop a revamped Saudi Arabia/Yemen resolution 
which would satisfy the concerns senators “that care about Saudi Arabia and the Crown Prince.” Corker was unwilling to address specifics of what an amended resolution would look like.
author: ChadPergram

text: Bipartisan senators upset about admin's handling of Khashoggi/Saudi Arabia. Exacerbated by what senators viewed as an inadequate briefing on the subject yesterday.
author: ChadPergram

text: The Senate voted to send the Yemen resolution to the floor yesterday. But the resolution is a parliamentary bramble, unique compared to most Senate procedures and open to all sorts of procedural & legislative mischief. This is because the resolution deals with U.S. “war powers"
author: ChadPergram

text: Corker says he’s trying to develop a substitute plan which will address the concerns senators have about a resolution calling for the U.S. to stop supporting the civil war in Yemen, via Saudi Arabia.
author: ChadPergram

text: Flake's term expires on Jan 3. GOPers will have 53 seats next yr & won't have to deal w/Flake's protest opposing judicial nominees over Mueller bill. Grassley says nominees could be resubmitted next yr & confirmed then with new Senate
author: ChadPergram

text: If Flake continues protest on Mueller, Senate would have to rely on Vice President Mike Pence to break a host of 50-50 ties to confirm nominees if Flake stands his ground.
author: ChadPergram

text: Judiciary Cmte chair Grassley on if he would try to move judicial nominees out of cmte, even w/o Flake's help due to his Mueller protest: “I don’t know that that’s every happened,” said Grassley about sending nominations to the floor without a successful committee vote.
author: ChadPergram

text: If Flake, remains a nay on Farr nomination, Senate GOPers need all other GOP senators to vote yea & Pence to break 50-50 tie. GOP ME Sen Susan Collins on if her position is changing.  Says “I’m doing research on Farr.”
author: ChadPergram

text: On Pence breaking tie on Senate procedural vote today. This is Pence’s 11th tiebreaking ballot in the Senate, and 2nd in as many days. This puts Pence ahead of Vice President John Breckenridge who broke 10 Senate ties
author: ChadPergram

text: Senate would not have had the votes today to confirm Farr for federal bench because Inhofe was absent for family emergency. GOP needs Inhofe to get them to 50 & Pence to break the tie
author: ChadPergram

text: Pence breaks tie to break filibuster on nomination of Jonathan Kobes for 8th Circuit Court of Appeals. Inhofe absent for family emergency. So Flake “pairs” his vote with Inhofe’s absence. Vote was 49-49
author: ChadPergram

text: Grassley, as a squadron of reporters chase him into the GOP Senate luncheon in the Mansfield Room of the Capitol, asking him about the Farm Bill: “Would you let me eat?”
author: ChadPergram

text:
GOP SC Sen Scott won’t comment on if he asked for delay on confirmation vote of Thomas Farr for the federal bench. There are concerns about Farr’s views on race. 
Scott’s vote is essential to at least get a tie on Farr & have Pence break the tie
author: ChadPergram

text: Senate has altered its agreement to vote to confirm Thomas Farr today for federal bench in NC. Pence was needed to break tie to end filibuster on nomination Wed after Flake defected. Fox is told it is now in order to move the Farr nomination on December 3.
author: ChadPergram

text: With swearing in Dem MI Rep Jones, Hse now has 433 mbrs. 236 GOPers. 197 Dems. 2 vacancies. Former Reps. Ron DeSantis (R-FL) and Evan Jenkins (R-WV).
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse adopted resolution saying Ryan is allowed to swear in Dem MI Rep Jones. In 1909, Hse declared seat of Rep George Lilley vacant after he was elected CT Gov. Established a precedent barring persons to simultaneously hold 2 offices simultaneously. She is Detroit Council prez
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse swears-in Rep Brenda Jones (D-MI) to serve for 5 wks. Rest of unexpired term of fmr Rep John Conyers (D-MI). Will continue to serve as President of Detroit City Council while in Congress. Rep.-elect Rashida Tlaib (D-MI) takes over for the full term Jan 3
author: ChadPergram

text: Showdown over the wal could determine whether there is a partial government shutdown next week
author: ChadPergram

text: Schiff on Cohen: Now more than ever, the Special Counsel must be protected from any interference by Trump or acting Attorney General Whitaker. Our Committee, and the new House Majority, will use all of its powers to preserve the independence of our justice system
author: ChadPergram

text: Schiff on Cohen: Today’s guilty plea obtained by the Special Counsel demonstrates that the President’s associates were willing to lie to Congress about the Trump Organization’s business interests in Russia.
author: ChadPergram

text: Top Dem on Senate Intel Cmte Warner on Cohen: This is yet another example of the President's closest allies lying about their contacts with Russia. With each indictment and each guilty plea, we learn more about the President’s connections to Russia
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse to swear-in Dem MI Rep-elect Brenda Jones to fill unexpired remainder of John Conyers term. But Jones will continue to be President of Detroit City Council. Will not draw Detroit pay. But will have full Hse privileges. Dem MI Rep-elect Tlaib takes over for full term in Jan
author: ChadPergram

text: Top Dem on Senate Intel Cmte Warner on Trump potentially pardoning ppl: That would be a complete abuse of power. The power to pardon has not ever been used to protect a president & his family and, again, we've seen from this White House again and again a disregard for rule of law
author: ChadPergram

text: Top Dem on Senate Intel Cmte Warner: Cohen decided to work with the special prosecutor, my understand is some level of working together and I think we've all felt that Michael Cohen has a lot of information that I hope he shares with the special prosecutor
author: ChadPergram

text: From colleague Jason Donner Top Dem on Senate Intel Cmte Warner on Cohen: This is 1 more example of one of the president's closest allies lying about their ties to Russia & Russians..Cohen was one of the witnesses that we've always wanted to have come back and that need goes up
author: ChadPergram

text: House Budget Cmte to unveil portrait of fmr chair & current Hse Spkr Ryan today.
author: ChadPergram

text: Agriculture Cmte chairs & top Dems Conaway, Roberts, Peterson & Stabenow: We’re pleased to announce that we’ve reached an agreement in principle on the 2018 Farm Bill. We are working to finalize legal and report language as well as CBO scores, but we still have more work to do.
author: ChadPergram

text: House Oversight Committee hearing today entitled “Evaluating Federal Disaster Response and Recovery Efforts.”
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse hrng today entitled "U.S. Policy Toward Syria”
author: ChadPergram

text: Senate to vote to confirm Thomas Farr as federal judge for Eastern District of NC today. Pence had to cast a vote to break a tie yesterday to overcome a filibuster on the nomination
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse Dems continue with ldrshp elections today. DCCC chair is one election. Hse GOPers to pick top R’s on their cmtes. Among those up: Oversight, Judiciary, Appropriations, et al
author: ChadPergram

text: House today considers bill to extend flood insurance pgms
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem CA Rep Lee on losing race for Dem Caucus Chair to Dem NY Rep Jeffries: It is a profound honor to follow in the footsteps of my late mentor, Congresswoman Shirley Chisholm..She used to tell people, ‘If they don’t give you a seat at the table, bring in a folding chair’
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem NY Rep Rice: There were twice as many people voting "no" for Pelosi than we need..on the floor..but there was no one running against her. So its pretty obvious why there weren't as many votes against her this time because there was no one running against her.
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem NY Rep Rice on her opposition to Pelosi & her mtg w/Pelosi: We need a plan for leadership transition. It was not a terribly productive conversation..she does not have the ability to get votes on the floor. Now, none of us want to take to floor fight.
author: ChadPergram

text: Senate locks in deal to hold confirmation vote on Thomas Farr to become a federal judge at noon et Thurs. Pence had to break a tie today to overcome a filibuster on his nomination today. Senators agree to postpone any further action on the Saudi/Yemen resolution until next wk
author: ChadPergram

text:
Senate GOPers who voted yea to send to the flr resolution about US involvement in war in Yemen:

Alexander
Cassidy
Collins
Corker
Daines
Flake
Graham
Lee
Moran
Murkowski
Paul
Portman
Toomey
Young
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse Dems delay vote on DCCC chair until Thurs
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi on the death of fmr Dem AZ Rep Ed Pastor: The first Latino Congressman elected to the U.S. House from Arizona, Congressman Pastor devoted every day in Congress to advancing opportunities for immigrants and communities of color.
author: ChadPergram

text: From colleague Jason Donner. Hatch on a possible gov’t shutdown: It's not a good idea. Never talk about a shutdown. So you know I have mixed emotions about that but I don't think there's a need for a shutdown. I think we can get these things resolved if we just work together.
author: ChadPergram

text: Gingerbread Capitol, in the US Capitol, by the members dining room on the House side. Smell of gingerbread wafting through the hall
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi when asked if she was concerned about the 32 Dems who voted against her for Speaker. Replies: “No. I’m excited about the 203 yes’s”
author: ChadPergram

text: Senate trying to get deal to punt Yemen war resolution to next week. Also attempting to tee up confirmation vote on Thomas Farr for nomination for federal bench in NC at noon et Thursday
author: ChadPergram

text: CIA on Haspel not attending Senate Saudi Arabia brfg: While..Haspel did not attend today’s Yemen policy briefing, the Agency has already briefed the (Intel Cmte) & Congressional leadership..The notion that anyone told Director Haspel not to attend today's briefing is false
author: ChadPergram

text: From colleague Kristina Biddle. Graham on why he voted yes to begin debate on Yemen war resolution: I changed my mind cause I’m pissed..the way the admin has handled Saudi has been unacceptable. The briefing didn’t help my today at all.
author: ChadPergram

text: Feinstein on Yemen war resolution: The United States can no longer turn a blind eye to this conflict because we are a party to it. The longer we enable the conflict to continue, the more innocent men, women and children will die.
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem PA Rep Conor Lamb: Today, I voted not to elect Leader Pelosi as the next Speaker of the House.  Over the past year, I’ve found that people in western Pennsylvania want new leadership in Congress on both sides. I agree. I believe we need new leadership
author: ChadPergram

text: Senate votes to begin debate on resolution to end U.S. military support for the war in Yemen. The vote was 63-37. Unclear if they actually vote on the resolution tonight..or punt to next week. It’s up in the air where they go next.
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse Dems elect Clyburn as MajWhip for the next Congress
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem CT Sen Murphy on Pompeo/Mattis briefing on Khashoggi: "I don't think the administration won any votes in this briefing."
author: ChadPergram

text: Top Dem on Senate Foreign Rltns Cmte Menendez says not having CIA Dir Haspel at briefing on Khashoggi was a "cover up." Says he doesn't accept at face value that MBS didn't have knowledge of the killing
author: ChadPergram

text: GOP SC Sen Graham on if the CIA doesn't brief CapHill on Khashoggi death: “I’m not going to be denied the ability to be briefed by the CIA..Anything that you need me for to get out of town. I ain’t doing it until we hear from the CIA”
author: ChadPergram

text: GOP SC Sen Graham calls Pompeo/Mattis briefing on Saudi Arabia "inadequate because the CIA was not there." Says he still wants to know if MBS as involved. Says “I’m not going to blow past this." If CIA doesn't brief, says "they will have a hard time getting me to vote”
author: ChadPergram

text: Senate is now taking a procedural vote to “discharge” from the Foreign Relations Cmte a resolution to end U.S. military support for the war in Yemen. If Senate discharges the bill, it could decide to debate & vote right away or potentially punt the resolution to next wk
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi about this ldrshp vote compared to others: This is all the same.  One time I didn't have an opponent. I always had – not an opponent but opposition.  Today it didn't materialize into an opponent.
author: ChadPergram

text: Hoyer: I am honored to have been chosen by my Democratic colleagues to return to the position of House Majority Leader..As Majority Leader, I will also continue my efforts to empower the next generation of leaders.
author: ChadPergram

text: Dems elect Hoyer as MajLdr for next Congress
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi is NOT Speaker-elect at this point. She is Speaker-designate. But still needs to score more votes to hit the 218 threshold in the Spkr vote on the flr in January
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi needs to whittle down those 35 who voted no or left their ballots blank by about half in order to hit 218 in January. Some members will oppose her in the caucus and vote for her on the floor. Two years ago, Pelosi scored 134 votes. Rep. Tim Ryan (D-OH) marshaled 63 votes
author: ChadPergram

text:
Pelosi formally nominated as Democratic Speaker candidate, 203-32. Three blanks. 238 Members voted. Keep in mind there are non-voting delegates to Congress who vote in this race.
203 voted “yes” for Pelosi. 
32 voted “no” for Pelosi
There were three banks.
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi on Hse Dems: Majority, majority, majority...We have been deputized to be a check on the president and this government.
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi on working w/Trump: President Bush never began a meeting unless the Speaker was present. I expect nothing less than that from the President. I think the president will be respectful.
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi on Dems who oppose her: There is dissent - but going forward we will unify.
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem MA Rep Moulton on mtg w/Pelosi & his opposition to Pelosi: “I am disappointed to report that no agreement was reached in this initial meeting. We are hopeful Leader Pelosi will invite us back to the table to plan for the future success of the Democratic Party.”
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem Reps RiceNY, RyanOH & Moulton met w/Pelosi earlier today. Moulton says "No one wants to see this civil conversation spill into a floor fight. Right now..Pelosi will not have the 218 votes necessary to become Spkr. Her 3-person leadership team has been unchanged in 11 yrs"
author: ChadPergram

text: Fox is told Pelosi is NOT expected to speak at the mics a second time once the Speaker vote is finished
author: ChadPergram

text: Vote for Pelosi for Speaker still ongoing behind closed doors, even though Pelosi just spoke at the mics
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi on where she stands with gettinng the votes for Speaker: “I think we’re in pretty good shape.”
author: ChadPergram

text: Fox is told the Senate could deal with the Saudi/Yemen resolution today..or wait until next week. It hinges on the 4 pm et procedura vote. Otherwise, the Senate may resume burning the post-cloture time on the judicial nomination of Thomas Farr
author: ChadPergram

text: The Senate now debating the motion to discharge the Saudi/Yemen War Powers resolution. A Procedural vote is at 4 pm et. If the motion is agreed to, the Senate goes back to the Thomas Farr nomination and tries to figure out how to move forward on the resolution later
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi emerges from Dem Caucus, saying they had “the most unifying session.” Dem MA Rep McGovern says “everyone loves each other right now”
author: ChadPergram

text: House Democrats now voting on Pelosi for Speaker. The vote will consume a few more minutes. Then the counting..which will likely take 30 to 40 minutes. So probably nothing until 3 pm et or so. We are expecting Pelosi to speak at the mics ar some point
author: ChadPergram

text: Ten Senate tie-breakers now ties Pence with Vice President John Breckenridge who also broke ten Senate ties.
author: ChadPergram

text: With Pence’s 10th tie-breaking ballot, he surpasses Vice President Elbridge Gerry (Pronounced GARY, with a hard G, but known for “gerrymandering,” with a soft G) who broke nine Senate ties and Vice President Thomas Marshall.
author: ChadPergram

text: So, to break a tie on the procedural vote on Farr Vice President Pence came to the Capitol and cast his tenth tie-breaking vote. Pence last broke a tie on the nomination of Russ Vought be Deputy Budget Director.
author: ChadPergram

text: GOP SC Sen Scott ultimately cast the 50th yea vote to break the filibuster on the Farr nomination, setting up the Pence tie-breaker
author: ChadPergram

text: All 49 Democrats opposed Farr, arguing about his views and rulings on race. Flake opposed Farr said he won’t help advance any of President Trump’s judicial nominees until he gets a vote on his bill to protect Mueller. Flake voted no. That made the vote 50-50.
author: ChadPergram

text: Pence breaks tie to overcome filibuster on nomination of Thomas Farr to be a federal judge in the Eastern District of North Carolina
author: ChadPergram

text: Procedural vote on Farr nomination still open. Began at 12:55 pm et. Pence still waiting to potentially break a tie..IF there is a tie. GOP SC Sen Scott is the only senator who hasn’t voted
author: ChadPergram

text: If Senate fails to overcome procedural barrier on Thomas Farr nomination, it’s a direct biproduct of Senate blocking Flake on bill to consider bill to protect Mueller. Flake voted nay. All Dems have voted nay. Vote still open
author: ChadPergram

text: Thomas Farr procedural vote still open. 49 yeas. 50 nays. GOP SC Sen Scott has not voted. Pence at the Capitol waiting to break potential tie if Scott votes yes
author: ChadPergram

text: Pence en route to Capitol to break potential tie on procedural vote on Farr nomination
author: ChadPergram

text: Senate now voting to end debate on nomination of Thomas Farr to be a federal judge in the Eastern District of North Carolina. Needs 51 votes.
author: ChadPergram

text: On CapHill, Pompeo says he’s “read every piece of inteligence” on Khashoggi. Says nothing directly linking Crown Prince to murder
author: ChadPergram

text: Pompeo on CapHill. Says he spoke to senators about Khashoggi. Says resolution Yemen resolution “is poorly timed.“ Says resolution could be “undermine” efforts to get a ceasefire.
author: ChadPergram

text: There are only 51 Republicans in the Senate now. That means Republicans COULD have trouble moving Farr for federal bench if Flake holds his position in refusing to advance judicial nominees because he can’t get a vote on Mueller protection bill.
author: ChadPergram

text: In the next hour, the Senate will take a procedural vote to end debate on the nomination of Thomas Farr to become a federal judge for the Eastern District of North Carolina. Flake has said he won’t help advance judicial nominees until he gets a vote on his Mueller protection bill
author: ChadPergram

text: Flake blocked again in effort to to advance bill to protect Mueller. Flake asked “unanimous consent” to move the bill. But Sen. Mike Lee (R-UT) objected.
author: ChadPergram

text: Flake/Coons/Booker now on Senate flr attempting to get vote on bill to protect Mueller. McConnell indicates he will object. & block them as he did 2 wks ago. Considering the bill requires the blessing of all 100 senators (called unanimous consent) All it takes is 1 to block them
author: ChadPergram

text: Colleague Mike Emanuel rpts ballots for House Speaker read yes or no on electing Pelosi for Spkr. No direct option to vote for someone else. She is not being challenged
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem NY Rep Jeffries defeats Dem CA Rep Lee for Dem Caucus chair
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem MA Rep Joe Kennedy is placing Pelosi's name in nomination for Spkr. Those giving speeches for Pelosi are Dem Reps Castor, Swalwell, Schiff, Beatty & LewisGA along w/Reps-elect Craig, Escobar & HillCA.
author: ChadPergram

text: Colleague Kristina Biddle rpts Flake anticipates an objection by someone in the Senate to him trying to get a vote on his bill to protect Special Counsel Robert Mueller. Expect Flake to make his request in about an hour.
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem AZ Rep. Gallego: Today we mourn the passing and honor the legacy of an Arizona legend, Congressman Ed Pastor..Pastor was a trailblazer who dedicated his life to fighting for working families. He represented Arizona’s 7th district with distinction for 12 terms
author: ChadPergram

text: Trying to keep track of all of the new faces on Capitol Hill
author: ChadPergram

text: DefSec Mattis/SecState Pompeo to come to CapHill shortly to brief all 100 senators about Saudi Arabia/Yemen. Also expect discussion on Ukraine.
author: ChadPergram

text: Ryan pushing for border wall in upcoming funding bill. Notes that any package must secure 60 votes in the Senate.
author: ChadPergram

text: House Dems now meeting to vote in internal leadership elections. Timing for votes is unclear. Could bleed into the afternoon
author: ChadPergram

text: Some Hse Dems who oppose Pelosi for Spkr will likely vote against her today. But could support her on the flr in January. That’s the vote which counts. Gives those Dems an opportunity to say they voted against Pelosi
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi on track to win Demncaucus vote to be Spkr today. No one is formally challenging her. But Pelosi will likely be short of the votes she needs on the flr in Jan to become Spkr. Still has some work to do behind the scenes
author: ChadPergram

text: Around noon, Sens Flake, Coons & Booker plan to go the flr & get the Senate to consider a bill to protect Mueller. McConnell says he will object. All it takes is one objection to block them.
author: ChadPergram

text: Senate-wide briefing today w/Secs Pompeo & Mattis. Main topic is Yemen and Saudi Arabia. The Jamal Khashoggi murder, Russia & Ukraine likely to come up
author: ChadPergram

text: Flake expected to try to get consent by Senate to call up bill to protect Mueller today. McConnell blocked him 2 wks ago. McConnell suggests he’ll do the same today
author: ChadPergram

text: Senate slated today to take procedural vote to end debate on nomination of Thomas Farr for the federal bench. All Dems oppose. Flake not backing any judicial nominees until he gets a vote on his bill to protect Robert Mueller. Pence could be needed to break tie
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse hrng today titled “Bureau of Prisons Management of its Female Inmate Population, and Other Challenges”
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse Dem Caucus ldrshp elections today. Pelosi expected to win in the caucus. But likely needs some more votes in order to prevail with the Spkr vote on the flr in January
author: ChadPergram

text: NRSC chair Gardner: Senator Hyde-Smith won tonight because she has a trusted record of fighting for Mississippi, and we are happy she will be returning to the United States Senate.
author: ChadPergram

text: GOP MS Sen Cindy Hyde-Smith defeats Dem Mike Espy in Senate runoff to serve final 2 yrs of term belonging to fmr GOP MS Sen Thad Cochran. GOP will have 53-47 advantage in Senate next yr. Picked up a net of 2 seats in the midterms
author: ChadPergram

text:
Pelosi to Hse Dems: The public has entrusted us to save our democracy.  It is our patriotic duty to deliver a more open, responsive, bipartisan and unifying government For The People.
 
I respectfully ask for your vote for Speaker of the House of Representatives.
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi to Hse Dems: We have been blessed w/ a..Caucus now enhanced by an historic Freshman Class. My responsibility is to recognize the myriad of talent and tools at our disposal to take us in to the future by showcasing the idealism, intellect and imagination of our Caucus
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi to Hse Dems: The American people voted for a check & balance on President Trump by sending a Democratic Majority to Washington. In order for us to honor that charge and engage the public, I suggest that our sessions on the House Floor be deemed America’s Town Hall meetings
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse Dems who vote against Pelosi in the caucus vote tomorrow COULD argue that they opposed her in caucus. However, there were no other candidates running for Speaker. So, come January, they COULD vote for her on the floor.
author: ChadPergram

text: In yrs past, we've had Dems who opposed Pelosi in the caucus vote for her on the floor. Therefore, the vote tally we get tomorrow on Pelosi may not represent the vote tally we get in January on the floor for Pelosi.
author: ChadPergram

text: There is a coalition of Hse Dems who want someone BESIDES Pelosi for Speaker. So, if Pelosi opponents don’t require an actual vote, it’s possible we may have no idea how short Pelosi is for the floor votes for Speaker.
author: ChadPergram

text: For Dme ldrshp elex Wed: Hse Dem Caucus rules say that their leaders are selected by a secret ballot. BUT…there's an option for Democrats to elect their leaders by unanimous consent and acclimation for positions which are uncontested. Pelosi, Hoyer & Clyburn face no challengers
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi only needs a simple majority of Dems in the caucus. But she needs 218..or a majority of Hse mbrs voting on the flr for someone BY NAME when the full Hse votes in January. Question tomorrow is how many votes does Pelosi need to get 218
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse Dems pick ldrs at caucus mtg tomorrow. Unclear when the vote for Spkr will be. Could come in the morning or bleed into the afternoon. Pelosi will win the caucus vote. But still needs to cobble together some votes to win on the flr in January.
author: ChadPergram

text:
Hse swears-in Dem PA Rep Susan Wild. Her special election had not been certified 2 wks ago. She suceeds fmr GOP PA Rep Charlie Dent. House now has 432 members. 236 Republicans. 196 Democrats.
Three vacancies: Conyers, DeSantis & Evan Jenkins of WV.
author: ChadPergram

text: Senate is slated to vote Wed pm to end debate on nomination of Thomas Farr to be a federal judge in NC. All 49 Dems oppose Farr. Flake won't back any judicial nominee until he gets a vote on his Mueller protection bill. Pence could be needed to break a tie
author: ChadPergram

text: Scalise taps GOP GA Rep Drew Ferguson as Chief Deputy Whip
author: ChadPergram

text: Ryan spox says GOP ldrs talked to Trump about "completing work on the Farm Bill, criminal justice rfm & bipartisan measures to build on the success of tax reform as well as the need to complete the remaining appropriations bills, including responsible funding for border security"
author: ChadPergram

text: After WH mtg on gov't spending,. McCarthy says the “President is very solid” with the border wall.
author: ChadPergram

text: Flake on if he will get clearance to bring up bill tomorrow to protect Mueller unlike a few wks ago: “I don’t know. I know that they’ve been trying to see if the votes are there for it so we’ll see. It would need 60 votes to get past cloture"
author: ChadPergram

text: Scalise on border wall after WH mtg: There's a way to get this resolved and get $5 billion. That's not too much to secure border. We are a nation of laws and ought to be able to keep country safe and make sure people come in legal way are respected.
author: ChadPergram

text: Scalise after Hse GOP ldrshp mtg w/Trump on gov't funding & a border wall: This is President Trump following through on a promise. W need to be there for him and see that gets done
author: ChadPergram

text: After WH mtg on gov’t funding, McCarthy was asked if a provision to protect Robert Mueller would be a red line if it was added to the bill. McCarthy said “I didn’t know Robert Mueller needed protection. Our southern border needs protection.”
author: ChadPergram

text: WH mtg on gov’t funding/border wall fight. No comment from Ryan as he returns to the Capitol
author: ChadPergram

text: From colleague Lucas Tomlinson: Army Lt. Col. Audricia Harris, a Pentagon spokeswoman, tells Fox News there is no active-shooter at Walter Reed, it was only a drill.
author: ChadPergram

text:
McConnell on Major League Baseball withdrawing its donation to Sen. Cindy Hyde-Smith (R-MS):
I’ve has no discussion about any of the donations to the campaign
author: ChadPergram

text:
McConnell on dealing with Saudi Arabia after the Jamal Khashoggi death:
We’re discussing what the appropriate response should be
author: ChadPergram

text:
McConnell on bill to protect Mueller: 
This is a solution in search of a problem... I think he should be allowed to finish

McConnell on if he would block the bill from coming to the floor like he did a few weeks ago:
I probably would yes.
author: ChadPergram

text:
Sen. John Barrasso (R-WY) on Ukraine/Russia:
I believe the response so far has been inadequate..I think we need to move ships into the Black Sea
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse GOP ldrs now at the WH, mtg with Trump about government funding and the border wall
author: ChadPergram

text:
Schumer on border wall:
We are for strong border security..the $1.6
is our position..If there is any shutdown, it’s on President Trump’s back..Stick to the $1.6 billion..They haven’t spent a penny of the $1.3 billion
author: ChadPergram

text: Tweet by Dem MD Rep Dutch Ruppersberger: I am currently at Walter Reed Medical in Bethesda where we've been told there is an active shooter. I am currently safe in a conference room w/ approx 40 others.
author: ChadPergram

text: From colleague Guerin Hays. Corker on Senate briefing tomorrow on Khashoggi and Saudi Arabia: I’m glad that Pompeo and Mattis are coming that will be helpful, but I just think it would be better if the CIA director was here, who basically did the assessment.
author: ChadPergram

text: Sens Flake/Coons/Booker all say they will go to the flr tomorrow & try to get a vote on a bill to protect Mueller. McConnell blocked a similar effort a few weeks ago
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse Dem incoming freshmen now mtg w/candidates in contested leadership races for the new Congress
author: ChadPergram

text: Fox is told much of the conversation in the Senate GOP lunch today with Pence centered on gov’t funding/border wall & the administration’s pitch to advance a criminal justice reform bill
author: ChadPergram

text: From colleague Jennifer Bowman. Nat’l Security Adviser Bolton says CIA Dir was “certainly not” blocked by WH from spking to senators about Khashoggi
author: ChadPergram

text: Pence now at the Capitol lunching with GOP senators. Expect discussion about border wall/gov’t funding. Hse GOP ldrs head to WH next hr to also discuss gov’t funding & border wall
author: ChadPergram

text:
Homeland Security Apps Subcmte chair Capito on the possibility of a shutdown over the wall:
We’ve got to find a sweet spot there. But if we just to to a Continuing Resolution (which is a temporary bill to avoid a shutdown) we’re going to underfund (border security)
author: ChadPergram

text:
Homeland Security Apps Subcmte chair Capito on if migrants teaming at the border exacerbates the need for the wall:
It highlights we have a difficult problem at the border
author: ChadPergram

text: Flake continues to oppose the confirmation of judges unless the Senate votes on his bill to protect Mueller Flake on if a non-binding “sense of the Senate” resolution is sufficient: No. We have to have a vote on the bill. If it fails, it fails
author: ChadPergram

text: Helsinki Commission chair Wicker: I strongly condemn Russia’s recent violence against Ukrainians, including the seizure of Ukrainian vessels in the Black Sea and Azov Sea regions. Russia must release the Ukrainians it has illegally detained.
author: ChadPergram

text: From colleague Jason Donner. Graham talked to Trump yesterday about the wall. When asked if $5 billion in border wall funding was a red line for the president now, Graham said “it seems like it.”
author: ChadPergram

text: Even though money for Mueller couldn't be directly touched by a partial gov't shutdown impacting DoJ, it's possible DoJ assets he uses (clerical workers, prosecutors, FBI agents) could be deemed "non-essential" during a shutdown. But not Mueller's office itself.
author: ChadPergram

text: Mueller's probe & his immediate team is funded by a “permanent, indefinite appropriation.” It’s not directly allocated by Congress each yr. Kind of like an entitlement. Congress approved a permanent, indefinite appropriation for Independent/Special Counsels in '88
author: ChadPergram

text: However, if there was a gov't shutdown & Mueller was deemed "non-essential" by admin, how long would shutdown be? A day? A wk? DoJ will eventually get full funding & Mueller would be back on the job.
author: ChadPergram

text: Could a shutdown sideline the Mueller probe? In theory, yes. But that likelihood is pretty slim. The bill funding DoJ is 1 of 7 bills incomplete now. All "non-essential" pgms at DoJ could shut down on Dec 8 if not funded. Unclear if Admin would deem Mueller "essential."
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse to swear-in Rep-elect Susan Wild (D-PA) today. She succeeds former Rep Charlie Dent (R-PA) who resigned. Wild is the 4th new member to be sworn-in. She will get a jump in seniority on the rest of the freshman class.
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi’s path to the Speakership. “Know your power.”
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi fights for the Speakership. As she often says “know your power.”
author: ChadPergram

text: Two big issues the administration is working on with CapHill during the lame duck session: Funding for the border wall amid the debate to fund the remaining 7 annual spending bills. Also an effort to move criminal justice reform
author: ChadPergram

text: Pence to CapHill today. Lunches with Senate GOPers. Then meets w/Hse GOP ldrs
author: ChadPergram

text: Jt Select Committee on Budget and Appropriations Process Reform meets today. Completing the cmte’s rpt on recommendations to alter the budget/appropriations process
author: ChadPergram

text: House back today for 1st time since before Thanksgiving. Freshmen Mbrs-elect return to DC for more orientation
author: ChadPergram

text: Runoff in MS Senate election today between GOP MS Sen Hyde-Smith & Dem Espy. Neither managed to get 50.1% on election day, forcing the runoff
author: ChadPergram

text: Prolonging the fight over the border wall into 2019 with Dems could help Trump. Trump needs a foil. Fighting with Democrats over the wall as he nears the 2020 presidential campaign could be good politics for the President. Hse Dems provide a sparring partner
author: ChadPergram

text:
Lots of pressure on Trump to make good on his campaign promise of a border wall and tempt a shutdown. Or is Trump willing to take half a loaf…and say he secured a quote..”down payment on the wall?”
 That tees up a fight with House Democrats next year.
author: ChadPergram

text: It’s possible mbrs could avoid a shutdown Dec 8 by approving interim bill. Dems would balk at a bill which goes until early January. That scenario would hamstring House Democrats righr as soon as they assume the majority next year.
author: ChadPergram

text: There are conversations about potential attachments to a spending bill to avoid a gov’t shutdown. Provisions to protect Special Counsel Robert Mueller from firing. Emergency aid to help California and the Carolinas recover after devestating wildfires and hurricanes
author: ChadPergram

text: LRepublicans lose control of the House in January. A December standoff over the wall is why Republicans view this as the last chance to secure wall funding.
author: ChadPergram

text: Gov’t funded thru 11:59:59 pm et Dec 7. Flashpoint is President Trump’s push for a border wall in the Department of Homeland Security spending bill. 7 of 12 annual spending bills unfinished
author: ChadPergram

text: A partial government shutdown looms at the end of next week over border wall funding. Trump says funding for the wall “never looked better"
author: ChadPergram

text: Coons on Russia/Ukraine: Vladimir Putin will only stop when we stop him. And we need to make a decision and a clear decision about whether we're going stand for a free and independent Ukraine
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem DE Sen Coons on criminal justice reform bill: It's got the support of the president. It's got the support of a wide range of Democratic and Republican senators. I don't know what Leader McConnell is waiting for. This is the moment to move ahead
author: ChadPergram

text: GOP LA Sen Kennedy on criminal justice reform bill: I just think the bill is ass backwards. It says the system's broken. So we're going to fix it and the bureaucracy on the back end. Well first you got to prove the system's broke.
author: ChadPergram

text: GOP LA Sen Kennedy: There's also some talk about tying the Mueller investigation bill to the budget. I think that would be a would be huge mistake.
author: ChadPergram

text: GOP LA Sen Kennedy: I certainly don't want a government shutdown. You know life is hard but it's harder when you're stupid. And it would be stupid to shut to shut government down.
author: ChadPergram

text: Senate adopts resolution congratulating the Boston Red Sox on winning the 2018 World Series
author: ChadPergram

text: Schumer on nomination of Thomas Farr for federal bench. Says “Farr was a lawyer for the re-election campaign of GOP Sen Jesse Helms, during which the DoJ alleged that over 120,000 postcards had been sent overwhelmingly to black voters intended to intimidate them from voting.”
author: ChadPergram

text: GOP OH Sen Portman: General Motors is now lettinng down those workers who have done so much for General Motors. I’m disappointed.
author: ChadPergram

text:
Senate Apps Cmte Chair Shelby on risks of a gov’t shutdown over the border wall:
We have to have a CR (interim spending bill to avoid a shutdown) or KERPLUNK
author: ChadPergram

text:
Senate Apps Cmte Chair Shelby on if the wildfires and need for aid there complicates keeping the gov’t open in the upcoming spending bill
It exacerbated it because there’s some big numbers out there
author: ChadPergram

text:
Senate Apps Cmte Chair Shelby on avoiding a gov’t shutdown:
I think the real obstacle is the border wall..this is the topic of the moment
author: ChadPergram

text:
Shelby on potential add-ons to the bill to avoid a partial shutdown, ranging from language to protect Special Counsel Robert Mueller to DACA to sanctions for Saudi Arabia:
We need to keep it as clean as we can make it..we need to figure out a way to thnd the government
author: ChadPergram

text:
Senate Apps Cmte chair Shelby on if the President would shut down the government over the wall:
I’m more concerned about the Democrats shutting it down
author: ChadPergram

text: Feinstein on confrontation at the border: It’s clear the president is doing all he can to end our asylum system, which will do nothing to help our national security and is little more than a political tactic that will end up harming California and the nation.
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem OH Sen Brown on GM shutting plants: They don’t care about the communities
author: ChadPergram

text:
Rubio on the need for a multi-year funding plan for the wall:
Can you fund it over sustained period of time? Because it’s not a one year project..if it’s (the funding package) the first yest of a five-year plan, we’ll never see the other four
author: ChadPergram

text:
Rubio on the push for a border wall:
The more physical structures you have, you’re going to have better border security
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem OH Rep Kaptur on GM plant closures: For too long a rigged economic system highlighted by bad trade deals such as NAFTA and a tax system that incentivizes offshoring has stacked the deck of corporate power against the American worker.
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem OH Rep Kaptur: Time and time again both the taxpayer and our workers have been asked to sacrifice for the good of the General Motors brand. This latest move from General Motors is an affront to that sacrifice
author: ChadPergram

text: Top Dem on Hse Homeland Security Cmte Thompson:The Trump Admin’s immigration agenda is clearly intended to foment chaos at the border. Any border..policy that results in mothers & children being gassed is not only cruel and morally reprehensible but also an abject failure
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem OH Rep Tim Ryan on GM closing plants including Lordstown plant in his district: It is squarely within the oversight responsibility of the House Ways and Means Committee to investigate the outcome of this corporate tax handout.
author: ChadPergram

text: Menendez: Yesterday’s events show that the Kremlin remains sharply intent on weakening Ukraine’s security and democratic trajectory.  In response, the Trump Administration must immediately increase security assistance to Ukraine, including the provision of lethal marit
author: ChadPergram

text: Menendez: I strongly condemn the Russian Federation’s escalation of hostilities in the Kerch Strait yesterday. The Kremlin must immediately return the seized Ukrainian vessels and cease any future actions that threaten the freedom of passage through the Kerch Strait.
author: ChadPergram

text: Portman: During frank conversations with GM CEO Mary Barra after the announcement that GM cut a shift at the plant due to the weakening market for the Chevy Cruze, I urged her to look to the Lordstown plant for production of other vehicles
author: ChadPergram

text: Portman: I am deeply frustrated with General Motors’ decision to shut down its Lordstown plant and disappointed with how the hardworking employees there have been treated throughout this process.
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem MI Rep Dingell on GM cuts: This is a warning and we all must be concerned about protecting jobs and keeping them in this country. I care deeply about working families hearing this news right now.
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump to MS today to campaign for GOP MS Sen Hyde-Smith. Is in runoff tomorow against Dem Espy
author: ChadPergram

text: From colleague Mike Emanuel. Senate-wide briefing set for Wed w/Secs Mattis & Pompeo. Expect Yemen & Saudi Arabia to be key part of mtg along w/Khashoggi murder. Russia could be discussed too after what happened in Ukraine. Hse has asked for briefing. But nothing scheduled yet
author: ChadPergram

text: Big focus this wk is on internal Hse Dem ldrshp elections. Pelosi likely to be nominated for Spkr. But doesn’t quite have the math nailed down yet to become Spkr in January. Is much closer though.
author: ChadPergram

text: Capitol Christmas tree arrives on the West Front of the Capitol this morning
author: ChadPergram

text: House-mbrs elect come back to DC this wk for more freshman orientation
author: ChadPergram

text: Senate back in session today. A number of cloture petitions to cut off debate about various nominees are looming. But the big issue on Capitol Hill is can they avoid a gov’t shutdown fight over the border wall
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi to Dem Hse mbrs: “Respectful of the views of all Members, I request that we all support the nominee of our Caucus for Speaker on the Floor of the House. Our diversity is our strength and our unity is our power."
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi to Hse Dems: I am very pleased that our Rules package will establish a select committee to improve the operation of Congress, ensuring that we deliver in a manner that is transparent, bipartisan and unifying.
author: ChadPergram

text: Freshman orientation for new House members always poses challenges. Especially for the press corps
author: ChadPergram

text:
Chicago’s Mayor Emanuel on Pelosi:
As we prepare to head into one of the most consequential Congresses.. this is no time to have a rookie sitting across the table from..McConnell or..Nancy Pelosi is as tough and cagey as McConnell is ruthless and Trump is unprincipled
author: ChadPergram

text: A partial government shutdown looms in early December
author: ChadPergram

text: The parliamentary mechanics of what it takes to become Speaker of the House.
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi on death of Librarian of Congress James Billington. Served for 28 yrs: Our nation has lost a true patriot and one of its most relentless defenders. Dr. Billington’s life and remarkable legacy have left an indelible mark on our unique American story
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem RI Sen Reed: Every prior President found time to visit our troops in active combat theaters..It’s time for President Trump to step up and recognize that our troops put their lives on the line every day with unrelenting devotion to our country.
author: ChadPergram

text: CBC chair Richmond on Fudge chairing subccmte on elections: She will have her hands full b/c voter suppression, especially of minority voters, is running amok in an environment where the DoJ has decided not to lift a finger to protect voters. There is no 1 better for this post
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi’s route to the Speakership runs through Oakland Raiders legend Al Davis: “Just Win Baby”
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse Oversight Cmte chair Gowdy writes to WH CoS Kelly regarding Ivanka Trump’s use of personal email for gov’t business. Says the cmte “must assess” whether there were effortsnto preserve documents in compliance with the law. Wants info by Dec 5
author: ChadPergram

text: Corker/Menendez to Trump: In light of recent developments, including the Saudi govt’s acknowledgement that Saudi officials killed..Khashoggi..we request that your determination specifically address whether Crown Prince Mohamed bin Salman is responsible for..Khashoggi’s murder
author: ChadPergram

text: With Fudge out of the way in a prospective challenge to Pelosi to Speaker, Pelosi still appears shy of 218 she needs on the flr. But so far, no one else is challenging her. As they say on Capitol Hill, you can't beat someone with nobody.
author: ChadPergram

text: Fudge now supports Pelosi. But Fudge on Pelosi last week: “She has been a great leader for us. She has been a wonderful Speaker and Minority Leader. I just think we need some change. We ran on change and I think we should have that change."
author: ChadPergram

text: Case study in how Pelosi eventually gets 218 votes to become Spkr: Fudge had considered running against Pelosi for Spkr. Met w/Pelosi Fri. Pelosi says she’s re-establishing panel to study elections. Fudge is named chair. Fudge drops prospective bid for Spkrship. Will back Pelosi
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem OH Rep Fudge won’t challenge Pelosi for Spkr. That helps some. But still unclear how Pelosi gets to 218 on the flr in January. The math is now better for Pelosi. But she’s not there yet
author: ChadPergram

text: Fudge: Last week I announced that I was strongly considering a run for Speaker..Pelosi has granted me the opportunity so that the protections of the Voting Rights Act will be reinstated & improved.:I now join my colleagues in support of the ldrshp team of Pelosi, Hoyer & Clyburn
author: ChadPergram

text: And..we’re off. Pelosi release: “Democratic Leader Nancy Pelosi announced her intention to restore the Elections Subcommittee of the Committee on House Administration in the 116th Congress and name Congresswoman Marcia L. Fudge the new Chair”
author: ChadPergram

text: Graham: While Saudi Arabia is a strategic ally, the behavior of the Crown Prince – in multiple ways – has shown disrespect for the relationship and made him, in my view, beyond toxic.
author: ChadPergram

text: Graham: It is not in our nat’l security interests to look the other way when it comes to the brutal murder of..Khashoggi. I firmly believe there will be strong bipartisan support for serious sanctions against Saudi Arabia, including appropriate mbrs of the royal family
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump: The US intends to remain a steadfast partner of Saudi Arabia to ensure the interests of our country, Israel..I understand there are members of Congress who, for political or other reasons, would like to go in a different direction – and they are free to do so.
author: ChadPergram

text: Top Dem on Senate Intel Cmte Warner: The President’s failure to hold Saudi Arabia responsible in any meaningful way for the death of Jamal Khashoggi is just one more example of this WH’s retreat from American leadership on issues like human rights and protecting the free press
author: ChadPergram

text: Schiff on Khashoggi: To suggest ‘maybe he did and maybe he didn’t’ or that we are incapable of finding out the truth, or that knowing the truth our silence can be bought with arms sales, undermines respect for the Office of the Presidency
author: ChadPergram

text: Feinstein on Khashoggi: Human rights is more than just a phrase, it has to mean something. And that means standing up and condemning a brazen murder by a foreign government. Everyone who played a role in this killing must be held accountable.
author: ChadPergram

text: Feinstein: I’m shocked that President Trump said there will be no punishment for Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman for the killing of Jamal Khashoggi..This was a premeditated murder, plain and simple.
author: ChadPergram

text: The race for House Speaker. Senior House Dem says “it’s about to get ugly.”
author: ChadPergram

text: Durbin: My heart is with Mercy Hospital in Chicago tonight.  I am praying for the victims..I am grateful to the men and women of the Chicago Police Dept who responded with bravery, including Officer Samuel Jimenez who made the ultimate sacrifice in the name of protecting others
author: ChadPergram

text: 16 incumbent or incoming Hse Dems sign letter, saying they won’t vote for Pelosi
author: ChadPergram

text: Schumer: Putting aside Mr. Whitaker’s many conflicts of interest and history of hostile comments toward the special counsel’s investigation, his appointment as acting AG is in direct violation of the Constitution’s Appointments Clause and should concern every American
author: ChadPergram

text:
Dem Sens Blumenthal, Hirono & Whitehouse file federal complaint 
questioning the constitutionality of the Whitaker appointment as acting AG
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem CO Rep DeGette withdraws challenge to Clyburn for Hse MajWhip: I have been heartened by the backing I have received..owever, many of my supporters have expressed concern about pressure they are receiving to return the three senior leaders to their posts without opposition
author: ChadPergram

text: USCP: At 10:00 am today, November 19, 2018 USCP officers will be conducting a training exercise utilizing visible ballistic vests and field helmets. As part of this exercise, small groups of USCP officers may be seen running to multiple locations & maintaining tactical formation
author: ChadPergram

text: NRSC chair Gardner: Today’s results make official what we’ve known since Election Day – Governor Rick Scott will be the next United States Senator for the great state of Florida
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse MajLdr Kevin McCarthy & GOP CA Reps Ken Calvert & Doug LaMalfa on AF1 w/Trump on trip to CA for wildfires
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump on helping Pelosi get the votes to be Speaker: Whatever number of votes she needs, if it’s 50 or 10 or 2 or 1, she’s got them from me. Automatic. So tell her opposition, they’re wasting their time.
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump on Pelosi: Her own party is harassing her. There’s nobody else who can be Speaker…Certainly they should start off with Nancy Pelosi as Speaker..If she needs any votes, if she asks me, I will give her the votes to put her over the top.
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump: I would help Nancy Pelosi if she needs some votes. She may need some votes. I will perform a wonderful service to her. I like her, Can you believe it? I like Nancy Pelosi. She’s tough and she’s smart, but she deserves to be Speaker and now they’re playing games with her
author: ChadPergram

text: Who will lead Democrats in the House next year when they claim the majority?
author: ChadPergram

text: Ethics Cmte says Freedom Caucus ldr Meadows violated Hse rules by "failing to take appropriate steps to ensure..his office was free from discrimination." Says he kept Kenny West on payroll after credible sexual harassment claims were made against his West.
author: ChadPergram

text: A look at the race for Speaker
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem MI Rep Brenda Lawrence & USVI non-voting Del to Congress Plaskett write to Trump over how he treated African American women journalists Abby Phillip, April Ryan and Yamiche Alcindor. Asks that Trump apologize to these reporters
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem CA Sens Feinstein/Hatch to McConnell/Schumer about wildfires: We understand..significant balances remain in federal disaster accounts..we urge you to..make sure that any additional disaster funding..for those recovering from hurricanes also be extended to wildfire victims
author: ChadPergram

text: An interim deal to avoid a Dec gov't shutdown through early Jan would be a problem for Hse Dems. Rather than starting the new Congress with investigations and inquiries, Democrats must first burn critical days trying to figure out how to fund the gov't
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi wants gov't funded thru Sept 30, '19. If there is a flashpoint over the wall, it’s possible there could be a gov't shutdown just before Democrats take charge. Or…there could be a limited agreement to fund the government only through early January.
author: ChadPergram

text: Some Republicans want to go to the mat over the wall and force a shutdown if Democrats don’t blink. The lame duck session will be the last time GOPers have the House, the Senate and the presidency for two years once Democrats take command of the House in January.
author: ChadPergram

text: There is an incentive for Democrats to work to completion of these appropriations bills. Many of their policy priorities reside in the remaining spending areas…as none of them cover defense. Would be cut under interim bills
author: ChadPergram

text: On efforts to avoid a partial gov't shutdown over the wall in Dec, a senior Senate Republican source tells Fox that they are trying to get “as much wall money as possible. There is no path to getting all seven bills otherwise.”
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump met at the White House yesterday with top Senate Republicans to discuss legislation in the lame duck. But they covered very little ground on the wall.
author: ChadPergram

text: Very little progress made this wk on CapHill toward avoiding a partial gov't shutdown over the wall. Funding expires at 11:59:59 pm et Dec 7. It would only be “partial” shutdown because 5 of the 12 spending bills have been law for a while now. They still have to deal w/7 bills
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem CA Sen Feinstein on wildfires: But as we move into the recovery phase, it’s important to know that federal funds are available now to help wildfire victims with their immediate needs. Those affected should register with FEMA as soon as possible to begin receiving aid.
author: ChadPergram

text: On sexual harassment, Ethics Cmte says Dem NV Rep Kihuen “apologized to the complainants and acknowledged that his actions may have been perceived in ways other than what he intended.” Cmte says “Kihuen now appears to better understand the effects that a power imbalance can have"
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse Ethics Cmte determines that Kihuen violated House Rule XXIII (23) which states that lawmakers “shall behave at all times in a manner that shall reflect creditably on the House.” The panel adds that Kihuen “downplayed his actions” while speaking to investigators
author: ChadPergram

text: Ethics Cmte says that “as a Member of Congress, Rep Kihuen engaged in unwanted physical contact by repeatedly kissing DC Firm Employee’s cheek and touching her shoulders and lower back, and engaged in unwanted verbal advances by commenting on DC Firm Employee’s physique"
author: ChadPergram

text: On Dem NV Rep Kihuen he Ethics Committee says “similarities in the allegations bolster the credibility of the complaints.”
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse Ethics Cmte: A..lobbyist said Kihuen made improper advances toward her including “sliding his hand under her dress and onto her thigh..and “asking her what color her panties were.” He also “though the use of emojis” suggested “that they make a sex tape together"
author: ChadPergram

text: Ethics Cmte: A staffer on Kihuen’s 2016 campaign “testified that she was subjected to unwanted physical and verbal advances” by Kihuen. He touched “her thigh on two occasions,” commented on her looks, suggested they “should get a hotel room together”
author: ChadPergram

text: In its rpt on Kihuen, the Ethics Cmte says he “generally denied the allegations of unwanted advances. Despite..Kihuen’s denials, each of the complainant’s allegations were supported by documentary evidence..some of the alleged incidents were corroborated by 3rd party witnesses"
author: ChadPergram

text: Last year, House Minority Leader Nancy Pelosi (D-CA) said that Kihuen should step down. He did not. But Kihuen did not seek re-election to a second term.
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse Ethics Cmte finds that Dem NV Rep Ruben Kihuen "made persistent and unwanted advances towards women who were required to interact with him as part of their professional responsibilities." Says he violated Hse rules by engaging in this conduct
author: ChadPergram

text: Fudge on when she will announce if she's challenging Pelosi for Speaker: I told her I’m going home for Thanksgiving and talk with my family and then we’ll have a decision.
author: ChadPergram

text:
Hse votes to take away special protections under the Endangered Species Act for the gray wolf. 
The vote was 196-180. This means there will be no protections for the gray wolf in the Lower 48 states. However, the critically endangered Mexian gray wolf is still protected.
author: ChadPergram

text:
Dem NY Rep-elect Max Rose who opposes Pelosi for Spkr about what he discussed with Pelosi. He says they talked about ways to get “more ferries and more buses on Staten Island." Rose’s observations on Washington:
"I have never mad more mini crab cakes at all of these functions."
author: ChadPergram

text:
elosi just finished mtg w/Dem NY Rep-elect Max Rose who opposes her for Spkr. Rose says “nothing changes” about his position on Pelosi. Rose on if he was offered anything in the mtg:
"I was offered a Coca-Cola…some dark chcoloate…there was no pitch…no transactional politics"
author: ChadPergram

text: Fudge will make decision to challenge Pelosi after Thanksgiving. Formal Democratic Caucus leadership election is on November 28. Speaker vote is on the floor on January 3
author: ChadPergram

text: Grassley moves as Chairman of the Judiciary Cmte to chair of the Finance Cmte. Graham on a bid to chair the Judiciary Cmte: If I am fortunate enough to be selected..I will push for the appointment and Senate confirmation of highly qualified conservative judges
author: ChadPergram

text: Fudge says she will announce if she is challenging Pelosi immediately after Thanksgiving
author: ChadPergram

text: Colleague Caroline McKee rpts CBC chair Richmond would Rep Marcia Fudge (D-OH) for House Speaker if she does decide to run. But says his biggest concern is mainly focused on getting Clyburn elected as MajWhip
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem WA Rep Jayapal on if the Democratic division over Pelosi is bad for the party: I think chaos is good if it’s productive..We need a leader who can lead us quickly..we need to deliver real results
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse Progressive Caucus Co Chair Pramila Jayapal (D-WA) on Pelosi: I think that she has the experience. She’s someone who get things done. We don’t need someone with a learning curve..We need a leader who can lead us quickly..we need to deliver real results
author: ChadPergram

text:
Dem OH Rep Ryan on timing on releasing the letter of Dems opposing Pelosi:
We all have the meditate and practice patience

Dem OH Rep Ryan when I asked if the letter is indeed “real.”:
It is very real. I have seen it. We will be releasing it..no comment on the numbers
author: ChadPergram

text:
Dem OH Rep Ryan on if the division over Pelosi is bad for the party, right after they got the majority:
Our party is strong enough to have an internal leadership discussion..the whole thing that the world is going to fall about if we have a family discussion is not relevant
author: ChadPergram

text:
Dem OH Rep Ryan on the freshmen Democrats who said they would oppose Pelosi:
They carry extra weight. We have a responsibility to protect them
author: ChadPergram

text:
Dem OH Rep Ryan on if the dispute over Speaker could spill onto the floor:
There may be a floor fight. I don’t think anyone would be interested in blocking the first African American to be Speaker.
author: ChadPergram

text:
Dem OH Rep Ryan on Dems trying to help freshmen who said they would oppose Pelosi:
There’s a nbr of us trying to protect new members..this is how this all started. These new mbrs said they weren’t going to vote for Pelosi…that’s how they got elected. There were agents of change
author: ChadPergram

text:
Dem OH Rep Tim Ryan on the “Five White Guys” hashtag:
I have no comment on that
author: ChadPergram

text:
Dem OH Rep Ryan on Fudge possibly challenging Pelosi: If she decides to run, I will do anything I can to help her..I couldn’t be more excited

Ryan on if a Fudge bid shows division:
We’re in the Capitol, man. There’s division..I think Marcia is the person who could heal
author: ChadPergram

text:
House Minority Leader Nancy Pelosi (D-CA) ks now meeting with Rep. Marcia Fudge (D-OH. 

Fudge is mulling a prospective challenge to Pelosi to become Speaker.
author: ChadPergram

text: Fudge on Pelosi: She has been a great leader for us, she has been a wonderful speaker and minority leader. I just think that we need some change. We ran on change and I think we should have change.
author: ChadPergram

text: Fudge on if she may challenge Pelosi: I've not made a decision that I'm going to run yet.. People are trusting us now to make change in this country and they've been telling us what they're interesting in.
author: ChadPergram

text: From colleague Caroline McKee. Fudge on possibly challenging Pelosi: There comes a time when people sometimes need to hear a different voice. I also feel very strongly about the fact that our caucus as diverse as ours needs diversity at the top of the caucus.
author: ChadPergram

text: Vote sequence underway on the House floor. Almost no reporters standing on the GOP side of the Speaker’s Lobby off the floor. All clustered on the Democratic side because that’s where the news is as the Dems are poised to return to the majority.
author: ChadPergram

text:
From colleague Jake Gibson. Federal Judge Timothy Kelly orders WH pass of CNN’s Jim Acosta restored. Kelly: "I will grant the application for the temporary restraining order. 
I order the government reinstate the pass."
author: ChadPergram
