text: All in the Family. GOP WY Rep Liz Cheney takes the same Hse leadership position her father held 30 years ago when he was in Congress
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse today to finish work on bill to remove gray wolves from the endangered species list. But tucked into the bill is a provision to block vote on effort to end US involvement in Saudi intervention in Yemen
author: ChadPergram

text: Only the House is in session today. Wrangling continues behind the scenes as Pelosi tries to secure the votes for Spkr. Freshman orientation continues
author: ChadPergram

text: Colleague Mike Emanuel confirms GOP NY Rep Tom Reed is open to voting for Pelosi for Spkr if she supports bipartisan rules changes
author: ChadPergram

text: Colleague Caroline McKee rpts Senate Apps Cmte Chair Shelby says the obstacle to avoiding a gov't shutdown in Dec is over how to fund the border wall. Shelby just met w/Trump & other Senate GOP ldrs at the WH
author: ChadPergram

text: Colleague Caroline McKee rpts McConnell says they had a “productive discussion” with the President at the White House. McConnell said he is optimistic that they have a way forward to fund the border wall.
author: ChadPergram

text: WH: The President met with Senate Majority Leader McConnell and Senators Shelby and Thune in the Oval Office to discuss the lame duck agenda, including the farm bill, government appropriations – including border security – disaster relief funding, nominations, & prison reform."
author: ChadPergram

text: Durbin on border wall & December spending fight: Democrats are really committed to border security. Many of us are skeptical about the so-called wall. When we talk to the experts it is a primitive form of protecting America in many respects. It is not the best form.
author: ChadPergram

text: Durbin on the spending fight over a border wall in December: The Republican majority will decide if the government shutdown. The president will decide if the government shutdown.
author: ChadPergram

text: GOP LA Sen Kennedy on if he would still oppose a bill to protect Mueller even if McConnell were to bring up the bill: "Until I'm convinced that it's necessary I don't mind going it alone. Sometimes a majority just means that all the fools are on the same side."
author: ChadPergram

text: British Prime Minister Harold MacMillan famously said that "events" were the most important factor in politics. If there is a gov't shutdown in Dec over border wall, that could HELP Pelosi in her leadership race. Gives her the opportunity to spar w/Trump & Congressional GOPers
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem OR Rep Schrader on the danger a vote for Pelosi holds for some House Democratic freshmen: As long as she is the face of the party, all of the new members are going to get wiped out. Look at 2010. All of the women lost. Women should be very nervous
author: ChadPergram

text:
Dem OR Rep Kurt Schrader on preferring Fudge over Pelosi:
Nothing against Nancy. It’s time to move on. We need a new face.
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem OR Rep Kurt Shrader says he backs Fudge over Pelosi for Spkr. Fudge was the “campaign manager” for Dem OH Rep Tim Ryan when he challenged Pelosi for MinLdr '17. Ryan scored 63 votes. Schrader on Fudge: "She fits the profile..she’s tough"
author: ChadPergram

text: Clyburn says he spoke to Dem OH Rep Fudge who is, in his words, "ruminating" a leadership challenge to Pelosi. Says it was "pleasant." Notes that he's "had a few other unpleasant ones with her..but not today." Says that Fudge would be a threat to Pelosi, Hoyer and himself.
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem MO Rep Cleaver: There is no one opposing Pelosinand there’s a differentnname every 30 minutes and you cant beat somebody with a nobody
author: ChadPergram

text: McConnell & other GOPers at WH to discuss gov’t funding & wall before Dec 7 deadline
author: ChadPergram

text: Colleague Jason Donner rpts Acting AG Whitaker met with GOP SC Sen Graham. Graham says he doesn't see a reason for Whitaker to recuse himself from Mueller probe. Graham says he's now confident there won't be interference in Mueller investigation.
author: ChadPergram

text: Clyburn on if someone could successfully challenge Pelosi: “No I don’t think so. I’m supporting Pelosi and Hoyer and hopefully they’re supporting me”
author: ChadPergram

text: Senior House Democratic lawmaker on if Pelosi can’t get the votes to become Speaker: “It’s who blinks first. Is it Nancy or is it the caucus?”  Another sr Hse Dem on the leadership fight: “It’s going to get ugly”
author: ChadPergram

text:
Congressiona Black Caucus Chair Richmond on potential challenges to Pelosi: “The only thing I care about right now is a gentleman named Jim Clyburn”

* This is significant because it’s thought Clyburn could matriculate the leadership ladder if Pelosi is sidelined
author: ChadPergram

text:
Some have suggested Dem NY Rep Hakeem Jeffries should challenge Pelosi. Jeffries: “It’s important to keep Nancy Pelosi in the top job”

Jeffries on what happens if there is a challenge to Pelosi:
“That’s a hypothetical and I think she’s going to get to 218”
author: ChadPergram

text: House Democrats now filing into caucus meeting. Expect lots of conversation about Pelosi’s future
author: ChadPergram

text:
Pelosi on if there is sexism among male House Democrats who may oppose her for Speaker:
I have never gone to that place..if there is any misogyny
author: ChadPergram

text:
Pelosi on funding the gov't by Dec 7:
We would not like to see a Continuing Resolution (in other words, Pelosi wants the other bills funded through September 30, 2019)

Pelosi on funding the government before the December 7 deadline:
We want to just get it done. We can do it
author: ChadPergram

text:
Pelosi on the next omnibus spending bill, due December 7, to avoid a government shutdown:
Democrats and Republicans can come to their own agreements. It’s just when some of these poison pills

Pelosi on the spending bills:
We’re making good progress on the individual bills.
author: ChadPergram

text:
Pelosi on the likelihood of her becoming Speaker:
I have expressed total confidence

Pelosi when asked if has the votes if the election were today?:
Yes

Pelosi: 
I have overwhelming support to be the Speaker of the House
author: ChadPergram

text:
Pelosi on effort to push climate change policy in the new Congress:
It was urgent in 2007. It’s more urgent now

Pelosi on establishing a new climate change committee next year:
There is tremendous pressure for us to return to that place where the climate issue is preeminent
author: ChadPergram

text:
Pelosi on a potential leadership challenge from Rep. Marcia Fudge (D-OH):
Come on in. The water’s warm
author: ChadPergram

text:
Pelosi on effort to push climate change policy in the new Congress: It was urgent in 2007. It’s more urgent now

Pelosi on establishing a new climate change committee next year:
There is tremendous pressure for us to return to that place
where the climate issue is preimminent
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi says their request in the pending omnibus spending bill would be to include language to protect Mueller
author: ChadPergram

text:
Pelosi says Democrats won the House with the odds against them:
We’ll see what the number is..I should have said that winning 23 seats in a voter suppressed, gerrymandered map is a wave..close to a tsunami
author: ChadPergram

text:
Pelosi on the California wildfires:
We’ve had these again and again. But these seem to be very deadly
author: ChadPergram

text: McConnell & others to the WH today to discuss gov’t funding and border wall with Trump before Dec 7 deadline
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi press conference starting now. Expect lots of questions about her route to the Speakership
author: ChadPergram

text: From colleague Jason Donner. Feinstein believes GOP would move to protect Mueller if there was interference w/probe. Says Senate should pass bill to protect Mueller because it “clears the air” & nothing would be lost by doing so
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse Intel Cmte Chair Nunes now on the flr, paying respects to Damon Nelson, staff director of Intel Cmte, who died recently
author: ChadPergram

text: The importance of a foil in politics
author: ChadPergram

text: Senate Judiciary Cmte now mtg on judicial nominations. Flake says he will oppose them until McConnell lets Senate consider bill to protect Mueller. GOP has 11-10 advantage on Judiciary Cmte & 51-49 advantage on the flr. Flake’s threat makes it harder to confirm judges
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse to consider bill to remove gray wolves from the endangered species list. But tucked into the bill is a provision to block vote on effort to end US involvement in Saudi intervention in Yemen
author: ChadPergram

text: Senate today to consider effort from GOP KY Sen Paul to try to disapprove of arms sales to Bahrain. Procedural vote at 12:15 pm et
author: ChadPergram

text: Senate Judiciary Cmte meets today. Flake vowing to oppose nominees after McConnell blocked him from calling up bill to protect Special Counsel Mueller
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse hrng today entitled “Examining Misconduct and Retaliation at the U.S. Forest Service.”
author: ChadPergram

text: Orientation sessions continue for new House members today. House Dems hold a caucus mtg. Opponents to Pelosi returning as Spkr getting louder, searching for alternative candidate
author: ChadPergram

text: Grassley to Feinstein requests about hearings on Whitaker and Sessions. Grassley tells Feinstein Whitaker can serve under the '98 Vacancies Reform Act. Says "every Attorney General works only at the will of the President."
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi holding reception in Statuary Hall of the Capitol tonight for incoming House Dems. Sounds of violin quartet playing "I Feel Pretty" from "West Side Story" echoing throughout the Capitol (true)
author: ChadPergram

text:
Colleague Mike Emanuel rpts 17 Hse Dems (incumbents & mbrs elect) are signing a letter to oppose Pelosi. RyanOH Moulton RiceNY Perlmutter
Schrader Vela Fudge Foster Higgins Lynch Sanchez Cooper VanDrew Cunningham Rose Brindisi McAdams
author: ChadPergram

text: You can always tell when it’s the night of the Radio/TV Correspondents’ Association dinner. The Capitol press galleries are empty.
author: ChadPergram

text: GOP NJ Rep Tom MacArthur: Tonight, I called Congressman-Elect Andy Kim to congratulate him on his victory. Enough provisional ballots have been counted to make the outcome clear. My staff and I will work with him to ensure a smooth transition in every way.
author: ChadPergram

text: Ryan on criminal justice reform plan pushed by Trump: Redemption is at the heart of the American Idea, and that’s what this is about. Creating a smoother path for those who have been incarcerated to successfully reenter and contribute to society is a worthwhile goal
author: ChadPergram

text: From colleague Caroline McKee. Jordan congratulates McCarthy on becoming MinLdr. Jordan: "I was encouraged by the fact that we got as many votes as we did. some may look and say you only got 40 some votes but it is never easy to go against the grain in this town."
author: ChadPergram

text: After McConnell blocked Flake from starting debate on bill to protect Mueller, Flake announced at he would oppose any of judicial nominees currently in committee or on the senate floor until the Mueller bill gets a vote.
author: ChadPergram

text: Flake asks "unanimous consent" for Senate to start debate on bill to protect Mueller. McConnell objects, blocking consideration of the bill. Flake now on flr, defending Mueller investigation. Flake effort tied to Sessions firing last week.
author: ChadPergram

text: McCarthy on Hse Dems: If their agenda is simply impeachment we’ll be there to defend the American public. I hope you see that this conference is united.
author: ChadPergram

text: Scalise on GOP losing the Hse:  People see how successful we’ve been. History is working against us in the House  and it caught up to us. We need to do a better job of getting around the country to let people know what we stand for.
author: ChadPergram

text: Colleague Jason Donner rpts Senate Apps Cmte Chair Shelby & McConnell will go to WH tomorrow to talk to Trump about Dec 7 gov't funding deadline & border wall.
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem OH Rep Fudge on Pelosi's bid for Spkr: "I'm not making a case to anyone I'm voting for what I think is right. I believe we need change so I'm supporting change."
author: ChadPergram

text: USCP arrest man w/2 rounds of ammo in Cannon Blg. Fox is told suspect was here for a tour. USCP MISSED the ammo at the Cannon x-ray. But found the ammo at the 2nd x-ray when he was coming to the Capitol from Cannon for a tour. USCP probing the miss. Suspect had no firearm w/him
author: ChadPergram

text: Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell (R-KY) said earlier today that he didn’t think there was any need to consider a bill to protect Mueller..because he doesn’t anticipate that the President will fire him.
author: ChadPergram

text: We expect an objection on the flr to the Coons/Flake gambit to protect Mueller. That means the Senate didn’t defeat the Coons/Flake bill. It means the Senate rejected the inquest by Coons and Flake to even consider it.
author: ChadPergram

text: On the bill to protect Mueller..In the Senate, one usually asks “unanimous consent” to forge ahead on the bill. However, that’s tricky. Securing unanimous consent is just that: you need the buy-in of all 100 senators. If only one senator objects, that’s it. You’re stuck.
author: ChadPergram

text: Expect Sens Coons/Flake to head to the floor at 4:15 pm et and ask the Senate to immediately start debate on a bill to protect Special Counsel Robert Mueller. Senators from both sides are worried about Mueller’s future after the firing of former AG Sessions last week.
author: ChadPergram

text: Incoming House GOP Conf Chair Liz Cheney, on taking on the role her father Dick Cheney had as Conf Chair three decades ago: “My father has a real love for this institution.” Her father’s advice to her: “He told me not to screw it up”
author: ChadPergram

text: McCarthy on the Hse Dems agenda: You simply cannot resist
author: ChadPergram

text: McCarthy on defeating Jordan for Minority Leader: It’s healthy to have a debate. I think it’s good Jim Jordan was running
author: ChadPergram

text:
Meadows on if the defeat of Jordan and id it was as a beat down:
I don’t know you can characterize any vote
author: ChadPergram

text: Freedom Caucus  Leader Meadows on Jordan losing badly to McCarthy for Minority Leader: “At least we didn’t go out and automatically crown somebody as the new leader.”
author: ChadPergram

text: GOP WY Rep Liz Cheney takes over the post of Conference Chair which her father held for two years in the late 1980s before becoming GOP Whip & then DefSec
author: ChadPergram

text: Some analysts will view the defeat of Jordan for MinLdr by McCarthy as a repudiation by rank and file GOPers as a rebuke of the Freedom Caucus. Jordan only scored about a quarter of the vote
author: ChadPergram

text: GOP WY Rep Liz Cheney elected Hse GOP Conf Chair. Her father served as Hse GOP Whip for 2 months before becoming DefSec in ‘89
author: ChadPergram

text: McCarthy beats Jordan in Minority Ldr race, 159-43
author: ChadPergram

text: Scalise elected Whip unanimously. Still counting votes between McCarthy and Jordan for Minority Leader
author: ChadPergram

text: House GOPers now voting on Minority Leader. Race between McCarthy and Jordan
author: ChadPergram

text: House Dems now conducting closed door caucus where Pelosi introduces all freshman Dems to the rest of the caucus
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse GOPers now meeting for their leadership elections. McCarthy v Jordan for MinLdr
author: ChadPergram

text:
McCarthy on the House Democrats:
This is going to be a tight majority on their side
author: ChadPergram

text:
McCarthy on Jordan running against him for Minority Leader. “Every time during an election you should have a challenge.” McCarthy on the Republican loss in the midterms:
“History was against us. Mike Bloomberg spent a lot of money to defeat Republixan women”
author: ChadPergram

text: McConnell says "no" when asked if there will be a gov't shutdown. Says they need to tackle gov't spending & the farm bill during the lame duck session
author: ChadPergram

text: McConnell says says he doesn't think the Mueller investigation "is in danger." He says that's why there's no need for legislation to protect Mueller.
author: ChadPergram

text: With the retirement of Hatch & GOP keeping the majority in the Senate, Grassley will become the Senate President Pro Tempore, 3rd in line to the presidency behind the VP, and the Speaker
author: ChadPergram

text: Incoming Senate GOP Whip Thune says he hopes Dems in the Hse will work with them "in a bipartisan way" "rather than spend all of their time on investigations"
author: ChadPergram

text: Schumer: When all the votes are counted in Florida we could be just where we started at the beginning of the 115th Congress with 48 members, even facing the worst map that we have ever had.
author: ChadPergram

text: Schumer: I believe there is a sea change. For 30 years the powerful wealthy few who have dictated tax policy on the republican side..That's over..our focus, has put a knife through the heart of that argument.  You won't see the Republicans doing that very much anymore.
author: ChadPergram

text: Schumer: Republicans predicted the tax bill would save their party, lead to enormous victories in the midterms. Turns out they were afraid to even talk about it. In almost all of their campaigns they didn't  mention it.  That's because it was so unpopular.
author: ChadPergram

text: Schumer back as MinLdr. Durbin is Whip. Ast Dem Ldr is Murray. Chair of Dem Policy/Communications Cmte: Stabenow. Vice Dem Caucus Chairs are Warren & Warner. Klobuchar chairs Steering Cmte. Sanders chair of Outrecah. Manchin Vice Chair of DPCC. Baldwin is Dem Conf Sec
author: ChadPergram

text: GOP FL Gov Scott says he will recuse himself from certifying the Senate Canvassing Commission results. Says he did so in 2014 as well.
author: ChadPergram

text: Top Hse Cmte Dems Cummings, Nadler, Pallot, Schiff send 7 letters asking for info from Acting AG Whitaker about his involvement involvement with World Patent Marketing
author: ChadPergram

text: Colleague Caroline McKee rpts GOP FL Gov Scott appeared at Senate GOP photo op this morning with McConnell, even though the Senate FL race hasn't been called. Question asked about Scott. But all sidestepped the question
author: ChadPergram

text: Colleague David Kobe rpts Pelosi says she is "very" confident she will be re-elected Spkr
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse Dem Caucus for the morning is complete. The Dems met again with incoming freshman Dems this pm. Pelosi will introduce all freshman Dems. Colleague David Kobe rpts Dem MD Rep Cummings says he supports Pelosi “a million percent”
author: ChadPergram

text: Colleague Mike Emanuel rpts McConnell re-elected MajLdr by acclamation. Schumer re-elected MinLdr by acclamation
author: ChadPergram

text: House freshman now gathering on House steps for class photo
author: ChadPergram

text: Did gun control advocates make any progress in the midterms? Only in small increments
author: ChadPergram

text: Sens Flake/Coons expected to try to get Senate to call up bill to protect special counsel Robert Mueller. Requires unanimous consent of the entire Senate. In other words, no objections by anyone just to debate the bill
author: ChadPergram

text: Senate GOPers pick their ldrs today. Cornyn is term-limited as Whip. Thune expected to move up from Conference Chair to Whip
author: ChadPergram

text: McConnell welcomes incoming GOP senators to his office today. GOP FL Gov Rick Scott expected to appear, even though he hasn’t formally been declared the winner in the Senate race
author: ChadPergram

text: IncomingnHse freshmen gather on the Hse steps for their class photo this morning
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse GOPers pick ldrs for new Congress today. Key vote is McCarthy v Jordan for Minority Ldr
author: ChadPergram

text: Nightfall on Capitol Hill
author: ChadPergram

text:
Rep. Rosa DeLauro (D-CT) on if Pelosi can become Speaker:
We took the House of Representatives back…I don’t think there will be a rebellion. I believe Pelosi will be elected Speaker
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem MI Kildee on Democrats who want “change.”: "Anyone who is promoting change had better know what change is….you have to be able to know what’s next." Kildee says he’s worried the Dem caucus “doesn’t think like a majority” because so many members have been in the minority.
author: ChadPergram

text:
Dem IL Rep Bustos on if Pelosi can get the votes to become Spkr:
"I think we’ll work things out..I think she’ll figure things out." Dem MI Rep Kildee on Pelosi: "I think she’s in a pretty good position."
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem IL Rep Bustos on Rep.-elect Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez (D-NY) protesting in Pelosi’s office today: "Not my style."
author: ChadPergram

text:
Dem IL Rep Bustos on whether House Democratic candidates got over the tips of their skis, saying they wouldn’t vote for Pelosi:
When you’re a first-time candidate, it’s hard. It’s challenging.
author: ChadPergram

text:
Dem IL Rep Bustos on what House Democrats must consider when evaluating leadership candidates and looking at the slate as a “team’:
I was a college basketball player. You have forwards. You have centers. You have guards. There’s a lot that brings us together.
author: ChadPergram

text:
Rep. Cheri Bustos (D-IL) on Democrats who said they would vote against House Minority Leader Nancy Pelosi (D-CA) for Speaker:
Be true to yourself…we’re going have a new generation of leadership. We don’t just have the top three.
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem UT Hse candidate Ben McAdams is in DC for freshman orientation. But his race hasn't been called yet. "When someone congratulates you, you don't know whether to put an asterisk on that." The Hse invites multiple candidates to orientation in races which aren't final
author: ChadPergram

text: Elections most places were last wk. But In the Northern Mariana Islands, elections are just wrapping, delayed by Super Typhoon Yutu, the second most powerful storm in US history. 5-term, non-voting Democratic Delegate to Congress Kilili Sablan has been re-elected
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem MT Sen Tester on winning re-election yet opposing Kavanaugh: Kavanaugh was not good on the 4th Amdt. He's one of the people that set up mass surveillance for a previous admin as a judge. He supported the Patriot Act. Montanans don't like..gov't snooping in their private lives
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem MT Sen Tester on how he won: MT's a big state geographically. But there's just a little over a million ppl..if you work hard & get around the state..you can literally shake hands with or look in the eye everybody is going 2 vote for you & everybody's going to vote against you
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem MT Sen Tester on winning re-election even though Trump took him on for thwarting Ronny Jackson VA Sec nomination: In the end the answers weren't given and he removed himself and the people in Montana understood that.
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem MT Sen Tester on how he won re-election even though Trump/Pence campaigned against him: I think that actually their visits..helped me..it's one of the reasons I got over 50 percent. I think Montanans look at that they saw how political the president was making this race
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem MT Sen Tester on how he beat GOPer Rosendale despite Trump campaigning against him & Tester opposing Kavanaugh: It's just a matter of reminding people of what you've done what you've accomplished the things you've done to help move the ball forward for a rural state like MT
author: ChadPergram

text: Danger looms for Dems in the House if they overplay their hand
author: ChadPergram

text: GOP LA Sen Kennedy on Acting AG Whitaker: I don't think it's fair..to bash him before he even has a chance to find the men’s room..talk means nothing. What counts is what you do. So far he's done nothing that should should make anybody worry about the Muller investigation
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse swears-in 3 new mbrs: NY Dem Morelle succeeds the late Dem NY Rep Slaughter. Dem PA Rep Scanlon succeeds fmr GOP PA Rep Meehan. GOP OK Rep Hearn succeeds fmr OK Rep & NASA Admin Bridenstine. Hse now has 431 mbrs. 4 vacancies. Breakdown is 236 GOPers to 195 Dems.
author: ChadPergram

text: What does “pie” have to do with avoiding a government shutdown? Everything.
author: ChadPergram

text: GOP SC Sen Graham: The Kavanaugh hearing was one of those moments where you sorta strike a nerve with people on our side. They wanted somebody to speak up. That person was me...These things come and go.
author: ChadPergram

text: GOP Rep Mark Walker on GOP mtg after they lost the majority: It was a little somber because..close to 70 percent of our conference have not been in the minority. I think there is still some sobering to take place before it registers.
author: ChadPergram

text: GOP NY Rep Chris Collins, under indictment, says he has not spoken to Trump. Says he is "happy to be re-elected."
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem MO Rep Emanuel Cleaver on Fox & election for Spkr: I’m going to support Nancy Pelosi. We have a system where I’m going to have to vote for Nancy Pelosi or I’ll vote for Mickey Mouse or one of the Kansas City Chiefs
author: ChadPergram

text:
GOP PA Rep Scott Perry on the timing of the House GOP leadership vote after the midterms:
I think this is way too fast
author: ChadPergram

text: Freedom Caucus leader & Rep. Scott Perry (R-PA) says GOPers should vote for  Freedom Caucus favorite and Rep. Jim Jordan (R-OH) over Hse MajLdr Kevin McCarthy (R-CA) for MinLdr “unless we want to keep losing races..I don’t want to do the same things we’re doing and losing”
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse GOPers now having candidates forum for their internal leadership election, which are tomorrow
author: ChadPergram

text: Hoyer releases list of 155 House Democrats who intend to support him as MajLdr in the 116th Congress
author: ChadPergram

text: Spox for Scott Senate campaign: It’s nice to see Bill Nelson emerge from hiding. But it’s surprising that he would want to appear with Chuck Schumer, who’s using him as a pawn and dragging his legacy through the mud in an effort to change election laws ahead of 2020.
author: ChadPergram

text: From colleague Jason Donner. Cornyn: "I don’t think it’s necessary to file legislation” to protect Mueller investigation" Cornyn on if committment to protect special counsel will be key to confirming a new AG; "I suspect that will be front & center during the confirmation hrgs"
author: ChadPergram

text: Top Dem on Hse Judiciary Cmte Nadler writes to Acting AG Whitaker & FBI Dir Wray. Say when Dems take control of Hse, DoJ/FBI have outstanding requests for info from Congress & Hse Dems will follow up when they are in the majority
author: ChadPergram

text: Senate now meeting for 1st time since Kavanaugh confirmation process last month.
author: ChadPergram

text:
Schumer on FL Senate recount:
We will not have a rerun of 2000 when bullying and intimidation was the rule
author: ChadPergram

text:
Schumer on FL Senate recount:
If this is done fair and square, Senator Nelson has an excellent chance at re-election
author: ChadPergram

text:
Schumer on FL Senate race:
Every vote must count..President Trump and Gov. Scott seem dead set against counting every vote..because they’re afraid Bill Nelson will be re-elected
author: ChadPergram

text:
Dem FL Sen Nelson:
It’s obvious Mr. Scott cannot oversee the recount...
He should remove himself from the recount process
author: ChadPergram

text:
Dem FL Sen Nelson:
This process is about one thing: making sure every ballot is counted..
Nelson:
Sadly it’s become clear that my opponent isn’t interested in making sure every ballot is counted
author: ChadPergram

text: On effort by Sens Coons/Flake to ask unanimous consent Wed to get Senate to consider bill to protect Mueller. All it takes is for one senator to object..which is likey...and they can’t consider the bill. Usually such agreements are worked out ahead of time with the leadership
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem DE Sen Flake on effort to get Senate to consider bill to protect Mueller: Flake & I will be doing a live unanimous consent tomorrow..It is my hope & expectation that we will find a way to get a flr vote on this bill.. One option would be to try & attach it to a spending bill
author: ChadPergram

text: McCarthy faces Freedom Caucus favorite Jordan in GOP vote to be Hse MinLdr tomorrow. Ceiling for Jordan is expected to be only 60-plus on a good day. If McCarthy overwhelmingly prevails, a Jordan loss could be seen as a rebuke to the Freedom Caucus
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem NY Rep-elect Ocasio-Cortez protests in Pelosi’s office on climate change..even though Pelosi pushed “cap and trade” thru Hse when she was Spkr. Pelosi has long said climate change was her “flagship issue.” USCP arrest 51 people for unlawful demonstration in Pelosi's office
author: ChadPergram

text: What it takes for Pelosi to return to the Speakership:
author: ChadPergram

text: From colleague Jason Donner. GOP UT Sen-elect Romney on if Whitaker should recuse himself from the Mueller probe: That’s really a very important question and I’m sure I’ll get a chance to talk to you about that, but not yet, not today..This is an orientation day
author: ChadPergram

text: Fmr HHS Sec & Dem FL-elect Shalala says she will back Pelosi for Spkr. Says it won’t be an issue getting freshmen to support Pelosi. “They know a first-rate leader when they see one.” Says Pelosi is responsible for the passage of Obamacare
author: ChadPergram

text:
Hse to swear-in 3 mbrs elect tonight for open seats which were vacated. These new mbrs get a jump on seniority on their colleagues who won’t be sworn-in until Jan 3. 
The new mbrs sworn-in today are Reps.-elect Mary Gay Scanlon (D-PA), Joe Morelle (D-NY) and Kevin Hern (R-OK).

text: When asked about her vote for Speaker, Dem OK Rep-elect Horn says support for Pelosi is “challenging” for her district
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem OK Rep-elect Kendra Horn won’t commit to voting for Pelosi for Spkr. Says she has to make her decision on “what is best for Oklahoma”
author: ChadPergram

text: USCP: The USCP is responding to demonstration activity on the Rotunda Steps on the East Front of the U.S. Capitol Building. All other personnel are directed to avoid the area until further notice.
author: ChadPergram

text: At freshman orientation, Dem NM Rep-elect Haaland says she would support Pelosi for Spkr, because she was instrumental to passage of Obamacare
author: ChadPergram

text: Top Dem onnSenate Judiciary Cmte Grassley to holdnhearings with Acting Attorney General Matthew Whitaker and fired Attorney General Jeff Sessions.
author: ChadPergram

text: At Hse freshman orientation, Dem Reps-elect Spanberger (VA) & Neguse (CO) say they haven’t decided who they will support for Spkr.

text: Trimp tweet: When will Bill Nelson concede in Florida? The characters running Broward and Palm Beach voting will not be able to “find” enough votes, too much spotlight on them now!
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem CA Hse candidate Harley Rouda (race not called) won’t commit to voting for Pelosi even though he is from CA like her. Says he wants to look at the candidates 1st
author: ChadPergram

text: At least 9 Hse candidates go through orientation session, even though their races aren't called. CA: Harder, Kim, Cisneros, Porter, Rouda. GA: Boudeaux. ME: Golden. TX: Ortiz Jones. UT: McAdams

text: GOP ME Rep Bruce Poliquin files federal lawsuit to halt "ranked choice" system to determine outcome of his race against Dem challenger Jared Golden. Voters for "2nd" & "3rd" choices then go to top 2 vote getters if no one secures 50 percent.
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem TX Rep-elect Veronica Escobar on Pelosi for Spkr: I do I support her. She  has been incredibly strong ldr . She shepherded through the Affordable  Care Act When many people thought it couldn’t happen. We need that kind of strength right now..it's a job for a woman right now
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem TX Rep-elect Veronica Escobar: I live in a beautiful state, a vibrant border community of El Paso Texas. And border communities like mine have been maligned by our president. And by his enablers in Congress.
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem VA Sen Kaine on Amazon putting 2nd HQ in VA: “I’m thrilled that our skilled workforce helped persuade Amazon to bring a major new headquarters and its tens of thousands of jobs to Virginia. Congratulations are in order to Governors McAuliffe and Northam and the local leaders
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem VA Sen Warner on Amazon moving 2nd HQ to VA: As a former technology executive, I'm really excited about the potential Amazon offers..As we welcome Amazon's new investment in Virginia, we must commit to implementing this announcement in a way that will benefit the whole region
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem TX Rep Gonzalez on GOP push for border wall: Opposition is an understatement..My stance remains the same, if not stronger. I have utilized this public comment period to add an additional resource in the fight to prevent this waste of taxpayer dollars.
author: ChadPergram

text: Freshmen Hse mbrs arriving soon for orientation at hotel near CapHill. Very big class. Some districts will feature 2 persons attending the orientation if the race hasn’t been called yet
author: ChadPergram

text: Dozens of Hse freshman will descend on DC today for the beginning of freshman orientation for the 116th Congress which begins in January
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse/Senate in session today for 1st time since midterms. Hse hasn’t been in session since Sept. Senate since the confirmation of Kavanaugh
author: ChadPergram

text: Flake twet: Congratulations to @kyrstensinema on a race well run, and won. It’s been a wonderful honor representing Arizona in the Senate. You’ll be great.
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse freshmen will meet on the flr to meet Hse officers early Wed am. They then pose for the 116th freshman House class photo on the East Front of the Capitol on Wednesday morning. Office lottery is not scheduled until after Thanksgiving.
author: ChadPergram

text: House Republicans will host a candidate’s forum on Tuesday night..with their internal leadership races Wednesday afternoon. McCarthy vying to become MinLdr against Freedom Caucus favorite Jordan.
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse Dems will hold multiple caucuses throughout the week, starting Wednesday. Expect lots of debate about Pelosi & her Spkr bid. Doesn't have the votes yet. But no one is running against her. House Democratic leadership elections aren’t expected until the end of the month.
author: ChadPergram

text: CapHill scribes will be on the watch this wk for GOP MS Sen Cindy Hyde-Smith. In runoff this month against fmr Dem MS Rep Mike Espy. Hyde-Smith is under heavy scrutiny for her remarks about lynchings. Hyde-Smith then appeared to make her situation worse at a press conference.
author: ChadPergram

text: Lots attention this wk on Capitol Hill Sen.-elect Mitt Romney (R-UT), who is poised to join the Senate early next year. Sen. John Thune (R-SD) is expected to succeed Senate Majority Whip John Cornyn (R-TX) as Whip. Cornyn is term-limited in that post.
author: ChadPergram

text: In the Senate, all eyes are on the arrival of GOP FL Gov Rick Scott & Dem FL Sen Bill Nelson. Contest remains uncalled. Nelson will be in to vote. Scott is expected to hit town in time for the photo of new GOP senators on Wednesday morning. Scott will vote on GOP ldrshp elections
author: ChadPergram

text: House freshmen-elect arrive in town Tuesday morning and check in at their hotel a few blocks from the Capitol. Dinner Tuesday night for new members in Statuary Hall of the Capitol.
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse/Senate come back to session for 1st time since midterms Tuesday. Legislative agenda will mostly be light. Farm bill is still outstanding. Must forge deal to avoid partial gov't shutdown by Dec 7. Border wall funding will be the flashpoint.
author: ChadPergram

text: DSCC Chair Van Hollen: Senator-Elect Sinema has demonstrated the independent leadership that Arizonans value, and they elected her to continue a strong legacy of service for their great state.
author: ChadPergram

text: With Sinema winning AZ Senate race, expect immediate chatter about AZ Gov Ducey potentially appointing McSally to Senate once Kyl steps down from seat he was appointed to after McCain died
author: ChadPergram

text: McSally: I just called Kyrsten Sinema and congratulated her on becoming Arizonams first female senator after a hard fought battle. I wish her all success as she represents Arizona in the Senate.
author: ChadPergram

text: GOP AZ Rep McSally concedes & congratulates Dem AZ Rep Sinema in  Senate contest. FL race still out. GOP will have at least 52 Senate seats in new Congress. GOP flipped 3 seats so far. Dems 2.
author: ChadPergram

text: Tonight on Jeopardy! The question is “Who is Jeff Sessions?”
author: ChadPergram

text: Perhaps one of the best cases Pelosi can make to return to Spkrshp is that she has been there before. As Speaker, Pelosi has already tangled with the President of the opposite party and knows how to take a deliberate approach to investigations and oversight.
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump made it hard for Dems to keep probes in check when he fired AG Sessions. The Democrats’ hunger for investigation and revenge may be too much for them to resist. Striking the proper balance will likely prove to be Pelosi’s biggest challenge if she is to be Spkr
author: ChadPergram

text: “I don’t think we’ll have any scattershot freelancing,” said Pelosi of Democratic inquiries. “When we go down any of these paths, we’ll know what we’re doing and we’ll do it right.” Naturally, this all falls within the eye of the beholder. GOP will say Dems are going too far
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi kept Dems in check when she was Spkr before & some wanted to push further to impeach Bush43. Unclear if Pelosi can harness Dems in same way as she used to. Pelosi could have some Dems who don't think she will push hard enough. Some Dems will think left is going too far
author: ChadPergram

text: Dealing w/Trump probes will be a challenge for Dems. Dems partly won control of Hse because voters blamed GOP for fealty to Trump. But Dems must strike balance. Unclear if they can do that.
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump needs a foil in Hse Dems. GOP turned Pelosi into their archenemy yrs ago. Democrats must play their cards very carefully, lest they plunge into the historical trap which Trump may lay for them, ala how GOP Hse actually helped Bill Clinton in mid-90s
author: ChadPergram

text: Best thing which ever happened to President Clinton is that he got a foil w/Hse GOPers & Gingrich in '94. Clinton cruised to re-election '96 after GOPers overplayed their hand.
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse Dems need to be careful not to overplay their hand w/investigations of Trump. Trick is how to do proper oversight & balance probes. Could backfire on Dems
author: ChadPergram

text: Dems just don’t need to win control of the Senate in order to make up ground on the gun issue. They need to get close to 60 votes in the Senate to have a snowball’s chance of doing anything. 60 is the threshold required in the Senate to overcome a filibuster on legislation.
author: ChadPergram

text: Fmr Dem MS Rep Espy is in a runoff Nov 27 against GOP MS Sen Hyde-Smith. But if Espy prevails, he may not be the type of candidate gun control advocates are looking for. The NRA awarded Espy its “Silver Rifle” award more than a decade ago.
author: ChadPergram

text: Despite lots of noise after Parkland, gun issues didn't resonate in many Senate races. Dem TX Rep O'Rourke couldn't run on guns in TX against Cruz. If Dems are going to make impact on guns, they need to win seats like WY/UT, which is a big task. Dems did flip NV, however
author: ChadPergram

text: Win by Rep-elect McBath in GA may deserve study for gun control advocates. This is a district once held by GOP GA Rep & later HHS Sec Price. Price often won w/60%. If Dems hope to make inroads on gun policy, this is the type of district which they must flip from red to blue.
author: ChadPergram

text: Gun control advocates may have lost ground in the Senate losing Dem seats. Parkland students called out GOP FL Gov Rick Scott who is in recount with Dem FL Sen Nelson. Did Parkland move the meter at the midterms?
author: ChadPergram

text: When Dems take the Hse in Jan, they will have elected about 20 Dems who push gun restrictions. Among them are Reps-elect Jennifer Wexton & Jason Crow who defeated NRA-supported Reps. Barbara Comstock (R-VA) and Mike Coffman (R-CO).
author: ChadPergram

text: There was a huge march in DC earlier after the Parkland, massacre. Dems argued that somehow, after Columbine & Tucson and Sandy Hook and Aurora and Las Vegas, that Parkland was different. Dems may have made modest gains on gun control in Hse elections, but lost ground in Senate
author: ChadPergram

text: On Fox, Dem NY Rep-elect Max Rose says he won't vote for Pelosi. Says he is "waiting for someone to throw their hat in the ring..those talks are going on, I'm sure..I am not going to vote for her. No ifs, ands or buts, under any circumstances."
author: ChadPergram

text: Rep.-elect Lucy McBath (D-GA) comes to Congress in the same way fmr Rep. Carolyn McCarthy (D-NY) did in '96. Both lost their loved ones to gun violence. McBath's son was killed in a racially-motivated shooting. McCarthy's husband died in the '93 Long Island Rail Road shooting
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem Sens Schatz/Booker call for DoJ probe into voter suppression in GA: "The Department of Justice still has the authority and the obligation to enforce the Voting Rights Act and protect the right to vote"
author: ChadPergram

text: Top Dem on Hse Ways/Means Cmte Richard Neal makes pitch for Pelosi to return to Spkrshp. Says the "next Speaker must be a shrewd battle-tested negotiator who knows how to out-maneuver Republicans."
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem FL Sen Nelson: Rick Scott should remove himself from any role in the recount process so the people can have confidence in the integrity of the election
author: ChadPergram

text: Fmr Dem WV Hse candidate Richard Ojeda announces presidential run at Korean War Memorial in DC
author: ChadPergram

text: Colleague Peter Doocy rpts GOP FL Gov Rick Scott will come to DC this week to participate in some new-member orientation activities, including the photo Wednesday. Will also vote in leadership elections.
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi: In California, our heroic firefighters and first responders, many of them veterans, are battling the deadly wildfires here at home.  We hold in our hearts those who have lost their loved ones.
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi: As we travel to Washington for this lame duck period, House Democrats are anything but lame ducks.  We are flying high and taking pride in the greatest Democratic victory in the House since 1974.  This is because of our excellent candidates
author: ChadPergram

text: After Parkland, Dems promised tougher gun control measures. They may have made progress in the House, but lost ground in the Senate
author: ChadPergram

text: Fmr Spkr Nancy Pelosi aims to return to the Speakership again when Dems take control of the House in January
author: ChadPergram

text: Sinema campaign: With the latest ballot count, Kyrsten’s lead is insurmountable..Kyrsten has now expanded her overall lead to 32,640 or 1.52 percent, meaning McSally would have to win the remainder of Maricopa ballots by 22% to take the lead in this race. This is not plausible
author: ChadPergram

text: Schiff on death of Intel Cmte staff Dir Damon Nelson: Our Cmtee has lost a family member, and a truly decent and caring man..He will be deeply missed, and the Committee won’t be the same without Damon’s consummately professional and steadfast leadership
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse Intel Cmte Chair Nunes: It is with deep sorrow that I inform you that Damon Nelson, the staff director of the House Intelligence Committee, passed away yesterday at Anne Arundel Medical Center in Maryland following a brief illness.
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem FL Sen Nelson: If Rick Scott wanted to make sure every legal ballot is counted, he would not be suing to try and stop voters from having their legal ballot counted as intended. He's doing this for the same reason he's been making false and panicked claims about voter fraud
author: ChadPergram

text: McCarthy on Fox on if Hse GOP will fund border wall: It’s always been the case in the House that we do have the votes to fund that.
author: ChadPergram

text: McCarthy on Fox on Hse Dem ldrshp: It is the same old leadership they had before. They're bringing back Nancy Pelosi Steny Hoyer and Clyburn. These are the exact same people that America rejected.
author: ChadPergram

text: McCarthy on Fox on if he’s confident he’ll be Hse MinLdr: Yes I am. Listen we had to fight to win this majority back in 2010. I was a big part of that. That was a much bigger hill to climb. I believe we can win this majority back.
author: ChadPergram

text: FL sets a hearing on Wednesday on motion by Dem FL Sen Nelson for a restraining order to stop vote by mail and provisional ballots from being discarded
author: ChadPergram

text: GOP FL Gov Scott on Fox: Senator Nelson is clearly trying to commit fraud to win this election that’s all this is
author: ChadPergram

text:
Top Congressional Dems write to DoJ ethics officer. Ask that acting Attorney General Matthew Whitaker 
step aside from overseeing special counsel probe
author: ChadPergram

text:
GOP FL Gov Scott on if he’ll appear at a photo opportunity with McConnell at the Capitol on Tuesday with incoming Republican Senators:
I haven’t decided where I’m going to be this week. We’re going to watch this recount process
author: ChadPergram

text: GOP FL Gov Scott on Dem FL Sen Nelson: Bill Nelson is a sore loser. He has been in politics way too long and he just won’t give up
author: ChadPergram

text: Sinema campaign: Make no mistake: this was an incredibly disappointing day for Martha McSally. Her meager gains in the rural counties were totally wiped out by Kyrsten’s continued strong performance in Maricopa County and across the state...
author: ChadPergram

text: In AZ Senate race, lead by Dem Sinema widens over GOPer McSally with Maricopa/Pima County ballots. But more than a quarter million ballots outstanding
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem FL Sen Nelson: This process is about one thing: making sure every legal ballot is counted and protecting the right of every Floridian to participate in our democracy...We believe when every legal ballot is counted we’ll win this election.
author: ChadPergram

text: Florida’s SecState orders recount in both the Senate & gubernatorial races
author: ChadPergram

text: The fallout after the midterm elections
author: ChadPergram

text: Sinema campaign: Once again, today’s data confirmed our expectation that as the ballots are counted, Kyrsten will steadily build her advantage and be elected to the U.S. Senate..she will win this race.
author: ChadPergram

text: What it may take for Pelosi to become Speaker
author: ChadPergram

text: Grassley: Today’s proclamation ensures that all asylum claims must come through our ports of entry. Anyone who illegally crosses our border will be ineligible for asylum. Asylum is supposed to protect only those vulnerable people..who have a credible fear of persecution
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem IL Rep Bustos backs out of the race for Ast Dem Ldr. Will run instead for DCCC chair. Says Dem NM Rep Lujan "has clearly earned his seat in leadership and he is running for that position." Dem RI Rep Cicilline now running for Ast Ldr
author: ChadPergram

text: Not much margin for error for Pelosi if she is to become House Speaker
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem TX Rep Cuellar: The caravan with over 6,000 migrants has departed Mexico City en route to Tijuana, Baja California, Mexico. This caravan will likely follow the Viacrucis caravan that made its way to the California border in April 2018.
author: ChadPergram

text: GOP FL Rep Gaetz on Broward County Elections Supervisor Brenda Snipes: The bipartisan, Senate-confirmed Secretary of State should place the office in receivership and take over. Enough is enough
author: ChadPergram

text: GOP FL Rep Gaetz: The outrageous ballot-counting issues in Broward County are un-American and unacceptable. I call on Governor Scott to immediately suspend Brenda Snipes, Supervisor of Elections for Broward County. She has failed to follow state transparency laws
author: ChadPergram

text: No fmr Spkr has returned as Spkr since Rayburn did so in mid-50s. In fact Rayburn did it twice. Spkr Martin also returned as Spkr once in the late 1940s.
author: ChadPergram

text: When 116th Congress begins on Jan 3, Hse can do nothing until it elects a Spkr. Spkr vote hasn’t gone to a 2nd ballot since 1923. Hse finally re-elected Spkr Gillett on the 9th ballot after 3 days. Hse burned 2 months & 133 ballots before electing on Nathaniel Banks Spkr  in 1856
author: ChadPergram

text: The key for Pelosi returning as Spkr is others NOT running for Spkr and artfully seeing a number of  absences or members voting “present” during the roll call vote in January.
author: ChadPergram

text: There may be a coalition of Dems opposed to Pelosi for Spkr. But, as they often say on Capitol Hill, you can’t beat somebody with nobody. And so far, no one has emerged to challenge Pelosi for the gavel. Same for Hoyer becoming MajLdr
author: ChadPergram

text: Fmr Dem ID Rep Walt Minnick wanted to vote against Pelosi for Spkr in '09. But Minnick had never announced his position publicly. Says it's harder for freshman Ds who oppose Pelosi. “Once they publicly committed, they need not backtrack,” said Minnick.
author: ChadPergram

text: Fmr Dem ID Rep Walt Minnick won in '08 in a district which favored GOP by 21 pts. Planned to vote present & not for Pelosi. Pelosi told him it would harm her. He voted for Pelosi. Lost re-election. Said it hurt him but was hard to win re-election any way there.
author: ChadPergram

text: In Jan 17, Pelosi was the Dem nominee against Spkr Paul Ryan. Pelosi garnered 189 yeas. But Jim Cooper & Kathleen Rice voted for Tim Ryan. Ron Kind voted for Cooper. Rep. Kyrsten Sinema (D-AZ) voted for Rep. John Lewis (D-GA). Among Democrats, moderate Kurt Schrader did not vote
author: ChadPergram

text: That said, one wonders if Pelosi will need 218 to become Spkr . It’s possible lawmakers could vote “present” or perhaps not even vote at all. That could help Pelosi. She won her 1st Spkr vote 233-202 w/no defections in Jan '07
author: ChadPergram

text: If freshman Dems who oppose Pelosi wind up voting for her for Spkr, that could jeopardize them from the start. The NRCC will have immediate fodder with which to use against those freshmen, based on their first vote on the House floor. The ads almost write themselves.
author: ChadPergram

text:
Like it or not, Pelosi has a way about getting the votes for things like her Spkr bid. Will she use the power of persuasion? Dole out plum assignments? Some Dems who oppose Pelosi whisper she is selfish if
 she goads freshman members from battleground districts to support her
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi has little margin for error to return as Spkr. Some Dems who would oppose her returning as Spkr: RiceNY Moulton Foster RyanOH Vela Schrader Lamb.
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi doesn't have much margin for error to win Spkrshp. Reps-elect who have said they wouldn't back her for Spkr: Crow Hayes Tlaib Stevens VanDrew Sherrill Rose Cunningham Spanberger Phillips Allred Small KimNJ & Slotkin
author: ChadPergram

text: Let's say Ds have 233 Hse seats. In the caucus, Pelosi only needs 117 votes. But she needs an outright majority of all Hse mbrs voting on the flr to win in Jan to become Spkr. COULD be less than 218.
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse Ds will hold their internal leadership elections soon. What Pelosi must do first is command a majority of the DemCaucus. Right now Ds have won at least 225 seats with 13 seats still uncalled. It’s believed Democrats will likely be in the mid-230s when all races are finalized
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi is the odds-on favorite to return to the Speakership in Jan when Dems reclaim control of the House. But it’s not a done deal for Pelosi. Yet. As is always the case t’s about the math, it’s about the math, it’s about the math. Pelosi still has some work ahead
author: ChadPergram

text: GOP ME Sen Collins wants Senate to consider bill to protect Mueller: "The bill further specifies that only a Senate-confirmed DoJ official could remove the Special Counsel...Whitaker is not a Senate-confirmed official."
author: ChadPergram

text: GOP ME Sen Collins: I believe that we should bring to the Senate floor legislation that would put restrictions on the ability of..Trump to fire the Special Counsel.
author: ChadPergram

text: In letter to GOPers, Jim Jordan makes his case to become Minority Leader. Says GOP must must up a “valiant defense” to thwart Democrats in what he terms as “endless investigations” of the Trump Administration.. Says he will “lead” efforts to block Democrats on that score.
author: ChadPergram

text: Will House Dems support Pelosi for Speaker of the House?
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump tweet: Jeff Flake(y) doesn’t want to protect the Non-Senate confirmed Special Counsel, he wants to protect his future after being unelectable in Arizona for the “crime” of doing a terrible job! A weak and ineffective guy!
author: ChadPergram

text: Schumer writes to Trump about Sessions firing. has set of questions about Whitaker becoming Acting AG. Asks with whom Trump discussed this & if Trump spoke to Whitaker about Mueller & if Trump asked for a loyalty pledge from Whitaker.
author: ChadPergram

text: Deciphering the midterm elections
author: ChadPergram

text: Schumer on FL Senate race: Not even the President—can prevent the lawful counting of votes. We will not allow him..to steal this election...Brian Kemp eventually realized it’s..inappropriate to use..official pwrs to influence one’s own election..Scott should realize that as well
author: ChadPergram

text: From colleague Mike Emanuel: Hse GOP Conf Chair Cathy McMorris Rodgers decides against running for ldrshp slot in new Congress. GOP WY Rep Cheney running for conf chair. McMorris Rodgers had considered running for Whip if GOP was in the majority
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem Caucus Chair Vice Chair Sanchez: Earlier today I learned that my husband is facing charges in CT. After careful consideration of the time and energy being in leadership demands, I have decided that my focus now needs to be on my son, my family, and my constituents in CA
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem OH Rep Ryan on if someone should challenge Pelosi: I hope somebody does. I think it is important for us to have that competition.
author: ChadPergram

text: On Fox, Dem OH Rep Ryan says he doesn't intend to challenge Pelosi. But he hopes that someone does. "I do want to make sure that the views of new members that are coming in who have stated they were not going to vote for Pelosi are represented."
author: ChadPergram

text: The end of the road for fmr AG Jeff Sessions
author: ChadPergram

text: Dem Sen Coons/GOP Sen Flake to ask unanimous consent next wk for Senate to consider bill to protect Mueller. If one senator objects, Senate can't consider bill.
author: ChadPergram

text: Trump orders flags to be lowered to half-staff after mass shooting in Thousand Oaks, CA
author: ChadPergram

text: Hse GOPers who lost. Several races still uncalled: Coffman Curbelo Handel Roskam Hultgren Blum YoungIA Yoder BishopMI LewisMN Paulsen Lance Faso Donovan Russell Rothfus Culberson Sessions Taylor Brat Comstock
author: ChadPergram

text: A look at what the House Democratic leadership may look like
author: ChadPergram

text: Nadler/Schiff/Cummings/Feinstein send letter to FBI Dir Wray/DNI Coats/CIA Dir Haspel/Treasury Sec Mnuchin asking for preservation of documents on Sessions firing. Say "Committees will also be investigating Attorney General Sessions’ departure."
author: ChadPergram

text: Pelosi on CA shooting: People deserve real action to end the daily epidemic of gun violence that is stealing the lives of our children on campuses, in places of worship & on our streets. House Democrats will fight to pass bipartisan, commonsense solutions to prevent gun violence
author: ChadPergram
